loans.name: Hexiell Abigail

texts.es: Hexiell de 33 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos, ella posee una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace 10 años y con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra salir adelante con su familia, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas productos por mayor como: golosinas, sopas, macarrones, detergente, etc. y asi poder surtir su tienda y tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en: Hexiell is 33 years old and lives in her own house with her husband and two children. She has a small store located in her residence, which she has run for ten years. She uses her profits from her sales to cope with family needs. She is requesting a loan to purchase more wholesale products such as sweets, soups, macaroni, soap, and more to stock her store and have a better income.

loans.use: to purchase sweets, soups, macaroni, soap, and more

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn works hard to support her family. Evelyn is widowed and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Evelyn requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Evelyn has been in this business for 5 years now.

Evelyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Asia Bibi

texts.en:
Asia is a dedicated mother 7 children. She lives with her family in Lahore. Her husband is in the business of making furniture. He is skilled and can make carved furniture, a local favorite. He is in the process of establishing himself and works hard day and night. His expenses does not allow him to save money for future use.

In order to make more profits he wants to buy more raw material but he does not have funds. Asia has therefore come to help her husband buy the raw material through applying for a loan. They hope that they will be in a better financial position in the future and educate all their children.

loans.use: to help her husband buy wood, paints and different types of nails for furniture making.

loans.name: El Coyolar Group

texts.es:
Grupo ¨El Coyolar¨.  Con el fin de seguir adelante con sus negocios y seguir aportando en los gastos económicos del hogar, solicitan por primera vez crédito ADIM y a los inversionistas de KIVA. 
La coordinadora del grupo Lesbia, 46 años,, soltera  y responsable de 1 hijos, se dedica a la venta de diversas frutas como naranjas agrias y limón, comercializa en su comunidad con la ayudad de su compañero, quien también vende los productos. Invertirá en la compra de tamarindo, para tener mayores productos y aumentar las ganancias.
Las demás integrantes son Rosa, 42 años y Karla, 26 años, se dedican a también a la comercialización de cosechas de frutas en diferentes puntos de manera ambulante, para poder vender sus productos y así recoger ganancias que le permitan llevar dinero que cubra los gastos básicos para el hogar.
texts.en:
The El Coyolar Group is seeking their first loan from ADIM and Kiva investors to continue with their businesses and continue contributing to household expenses. The coordinator of the group is Lesbia, 46. She is single and has one dependent child. She sells various fruits like bitter oranges and lemos. She sells them in her community with her partner, who also sells these fruits. She will buy tamarind to increase her product and her profits.

The other members of the group are Rosa, 42, and Karla, 26, who also earn their living selling fruit harvests across town as street vendors. They sell their products and collect profits, which allows them to bring in money to cover basic household needs.

loans.use: to expand her offering of fruits by purchasing tamarind

loans.name: Amna

texts.en: Amna is a 28-year-old Lebanese single woman living with her parents. Her brothers work tirelessly to fulfill their daily needs and represent the main income source. Amna is still studying and focusing only on her school. Today, with the aim to pay her technical study fees, she is applying for a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. In the future, she plans to take more Kiva loans to be able to continue her education.

loans.use: to pay her technical study fees.

loans.name: Fc Sevilla Group

texts.es:
¨FC Sevilla¨, es un grupo consolidado, responsable, y muy laborioso, conformado por 3 mujeres emprendedoras. Están con ADIM, por primera  vez, solicitando crédito para engrandecer sus negocios. 
Su coordinadora es Juliana, de 45 años, soltera y madre de 2 hijos. Dedicada a la compra y venta de cosechas de diversas frutas, según la estación y temporadas del país. Iniciando su negocio gracias a los financiamientos de otras financieras. Ahora requiere del préstamo para la compra de 20 árboles con grandes cosechas de naranjas, así poder ofrecer esta jugosa fruta a sus clientes. Con las ganancias desea seguir mejorando su negocio. 
Las demás integrantes son Ana, de 20 años, dedicada también a la comercialización de frutas como jocotes y nancites;  y María de 45 años quien se dedica a la venta de cosechas de frutas. Con el financiamiento recibido se comprometen a ser cumplidas y salir adelante por sus familias.
texts.en:
FC Sevilla is an established, responsible, and very industrious group consisting of three female entrepreneurs. They are with ADIM for the first time, applying for a loan to increase their businesses.

The group coordinator is Juliana, 45, the single mother of two children. She earns her living purchasing and selling harvests of various fruits, depending on the season and the climate of the country. She began her business with other financing. Now, she requires a loan to purchase 20 large orange trees so she can sell this juicy fruit to her customers. She wants to keep improving her business with her earnings.

Other members are Ana, 20, also selling fruits like plums and nance fruits and Maria, 45, who also sells harvests of fruit. They will fulfill their loan obligations and take care of their families.

loans.use: to purchase 20 large orange trees

loans.name: David

texts.en: David is 31 years old, married, and supports two children aged nine and four years old. He is a dairy farmer and also sells green tea leaves.This has been his business for the last five years; it earns him a monthly income of Kshs.5,000. He has applied for a loan of Kshs.10,000 as his first term and he intends to use it to buy dairy feeds. The profits shall be used in paying school fees.

loans.use: To purchase dairy feeds

loans.name: Philister

texts.en:
Philister is a married woman. She has 7 children. She operates a retail business where she sells vegetables. She has been involved in this business for 7 years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

She will use the Kes 10,000 loan to buy more stock of vegetables. Her business goal is to have a wholesale business within 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She will use the anticipated profits to boost business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of vegetables.

loans.name: Steve

texts.en:
Steve is a married man. He has one child.

He operates a barber shop. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

He will use the KES 35,000 loan to buy modern barber shop equipment. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. He will use the anticipated profits to boost business.

loans.use: to buy modern barber shop equipment

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a buy and sell coconut business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to purchase more coconuts to sell to her customers for her buy and sell coconut business.

Leonila has been in this business for 20 years. Leonila earns additional income from food vending.

Leonila has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more coconuts to sell to her customers

loans.name: Ma. Weldelina

texts.en:
Ma. Weldelina is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Ma. Weldelina is 48 years old and has three children who are in school.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her general store. She earns additional income from fish vending.

Ma. Weldelina has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Peninah

texts.en:
Peninah is 38 years old, married and a mother of four children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2013 so as to benefit from the trainings, especially enterprise development. Through the training, she is now able to keep proper records.

She is involved in poultry keeping. She is borrowing with a Kiva loan to buy more chicken and also construct a modern poultry house. This will enable her expand her poultry business and earn more income to pay family expenses, e.g. food, clothing and access to quality healthcare services.

Peninah is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: to buy more chickens and construct a modern poultry house to help her meet family expenses: e.g. food, clothing, and medical.

loans.name: Ilsis María

texts.es: Ilsis es habitante de San Jacinto, un municipio de Bolívar reconocido como el centro artesanal del departamento, allí reside en compañía de su cónyuge y sus siete hijos menores de edad.  Ella es una artesana de 33 años que mantiene sus tradiciones a través de los tejidos de mochilas y bolsos que elabora y comercializa a almacenes de la población, actividad que le permite compartir con su familia y generar un ingreso extra a los que su cónyuge consigue con su empleo. Ilsis maneja diseños exclusivos que entrega según pedidos de su clientela y son cancelados de inmediato, sin embargo su capital no es suficiente para cubrir la demanda, es por ello que realizó una solicitud de crédito, su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para comprar  hilos y accesorios, y así aumentar la producción de su microempresa y la variedad de diseños y tonalidades. Ilsis lleva diez años en esta labor y a futuro se proyecta como propietaria de un almacén de artesanías. Su meta familiar es realizar adecuaciones a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Ilsis is a resident of San Jacinto, a municipality of Bolivar, recognized as the artisanal center of the department. She lives there in the company of her husband and her seven minor children. She is a 33-year-old artisan who maintains her traditions through weaving packs and bags which she makes and sells to the shops of the town, an activity which allows her to share with her family and to generate income additional to that which her husband obtains from his work.

Ilsis uses exclusive designs that she delivers according to the demands of her customers and fulfills immediately. Nevertheless, her capital is insufficient to cover the demand, For this reason, she made a request for a loan, her first Kiva loan through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, in order to buy yarn and accessories, and thus increase the production of her microenterprise and the variety of designs and color combinations.

Ilsis has done this work for ten years and in the future she sees herself as the owner of a handicraft shop. Her family goal is to make improvements to her residence.

loans.use: to buy yarn and accessories.

loans.name: Genaro

texts.es: Genaro, de 47 años de edad, es casado, tiene 6 hijos, reside junto a su esposa y 4 de sus hijos en el municipio de Gracias, Lempira. Él siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura, y cultivando café lleva 16 años. El café lo vende en grano en oro en la misma zona. El préstamo que está solicitando es el segundo ciclo y es por 9,000 Lempiras para comprar abono y fertilizantes para darle mantenimiento a la finca de café y pago de limpieza de la misma. El propósito es lograr la mejor calidad y producción de café para obtener buenos ingresos económicos para su familia.
texts.en:
Genaro is 47 years old. He is married with six children. He lives in the municipality of Gracias, Lempira with his wife and four of his children. He's always worked in agriculture and he has been producing coffee for 15 years. The coffee he sells is of the golden bean variety from that area. 
This is his second loan and he is asking for 9,000 Lempiras to buy compost and fertilizers to maintain his coffee farm and to pay worked for the clean-up. His goal is to achieve better production of quality coffee so that he can generate a good income for supporting his children.

loans.use: to buy compost, fertilizers and to pay for the clean-up of the coffee farm.

loans.name: Motaz

texts.en: Motaz is working hard to complete his education; he is a student in university majoring ‎in marketing and lives in a refugee camp called Baqaa. Motaz`s father is retired from the army ‎and his pension is not enough to cover all ‎household expenses, including his daily and education expenses. Because of that, Motaz is working while pursuing an education to help his ‎father to cover all the needs of his family. Lately Motaz is facing financial ‎problems that lead him to apply for an educational loan to pay for his university fees and ‎achieve his dreams.‎

loans.use: To pay for his university fees and ‎achieve his dreams.

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es: María, de 41 años de edad, es una madre soltera, tiene 5 hijos, vive con ellos en el municipio del Negrito, Yoro, cerca al Progreso Yoro. Ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tortillas de maíz en su casa. Esta actividad la realiza desde hace 5 años. Las tortillas las vende en su comunidad durante el día. Ha decidido solicitar la cantidad de 7,000 Lempiras para invertir en la compra de maíz para la elaboración de tortillas que le permita cumplir con la demanda que tiene y poder trabajar mejor aumentando sus ventas. También podrá mejorar la casa para poder atender mejor a los clientes. Tiene como meta mejorar su negocio, mejorar su entorno familiar, brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
María is 41 years old. She is a single mother of 5 children and she lives with them in the municipality of Negrito, Yoro, nearby Progreso, Yoro. She makes and sells corn tortillas out of her home. She started the business five years ago. She sells tortillas to her community during the day. 
She is asking for a loan for 7,000 Lempiras to buy corn to make tortillas so she can keep up with the current demand and to make her job easier and increase her sales. She will also be able to make home improvements to provide a better service to her customers. Her goal is to improve the business, make things better for her family and provide them a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn to make and sell tortillas.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
The person in the photo is called Simon. He is fifty two years old, married, and blessed with six children, one in secondary school.

He joined hand in hand Eastern Africa in 2015 and learnt more on enterprise development and financial management. Simon has been doing vegetable farming for the past three years.

After the HiHEA training, he started a dairy farming business which has increased his income. He is now able to provide his family with food and pay school fees. He is taking a Kiva loan to buy quality fodder that will ensure consistent milk productivity.

He appreciates Kiva and their lenders for the support and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy quality fodder that will ensure consistent milk productivity.

loans.name: Mikailu

texts.en:
Mikailu is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Mikailu has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. Before joining Babban Gona, Mikailu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Mikailu can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 

As a Babban Gona member, Mikailu will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Mikailu is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to build a house for his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Artesanía El Zapote Group

texts.es:
En el Estado de México existen varias comunidades con un origen étnico fundado el la cultura mazahua. Su clima es templado por lo que es común observar un color verde profundo en la vegetación durante todo el año; muchas de las hierbas autóctonas tienen propiedades terapéuticas y son utilizadas como infusiones.  Es, por otro lado, un lugar habitado por personas muy amables y trabajadoras cuya alegría es compartida con cualquier visitante.  Muchos aún conservan su lengua materna y las fiestas patronales tienen rasgos que han perdurado por muchas generaciones.
   Doña Flora es integrante de un grupo formado en una de las comunidades anteriormente mencionadas, es una persona muy alegre y su buen humor nunca pasa desapercibido. La motivación más grande proviene de su pequeña hija quien estudia la educación primaria. Actualmente se dedica a la elaboración de ropa artesanal, "desde pequeña veía como mi mamá elaboraba capas, mochilas, suéteres, bufandas, y otras prendas con motivos mazahua; los colores son muy llamativos y tienen figuras características de la región” comenta contenta. Una vez formada su propia familia, decidió dedicarse de lleno a la actividad saliendo a vender a otras comunidades con el objetivo de aumentar sus ingresos. La temporada que está por llegar es la mejor del año ya que las ventas aumentan considerablemente por lo que, con el apoyo del préstamo, podrá comprar más material y aumentar su producción. Su actividad fuerte comienza desde el mes de octubre para que, llegada la época decembrina, tenga mercancía suficiente para cualquier pedido imprevisto.
   El sueño que tiene en mente es aumentar su producción y dar trabajo a nuevas personas, además busca asentarse en un local para que los clientes puedan observar detalladamente sus artesanías. "Por ahora confío que nos irá muy bien ya que han llegado los fríos y es nuestra mejor oportunidad para vender el producto de nuestro esfuerzo" comento de manera entusiasta. 
   Los demás integrantes del grupo son Paula, Rosalina, Maximina, María Eugenia y Araceli quienes, de igual forma, invertirían en bordados artesanales.
*La fotografía fue tomada en la plaza del centro municipal, Doña Flora es quien viste un rebozo azul.
texts.en:
In the State of México there are various communities with an ethnic origin based on the Mazahua culture. The climate is temperate so it is normal to see a deep green color of vegetation all year round. Much of the native grasses are therapeutic and are used as teas. On the other hand these communities are inhabited by very friendly and hard-working whose joy is shared with any visitor. Many still conserve their native language and their Saint days have features that have lasted through many generations.

Flora is a member of a group in one of the above-mentioned communities. She is a very happy person of good humor who never goes unnoticed. Her greatest motivation comes from her small daughter who studies in primary school. She currently works making handcrafted clothing. 'Since I was small I watched how my mother made capes, bags, sweaters, scarfs and other clothing with Mazahua designs. The colors stand out and they have characteristic figures from the region", she commented.

Once she formed her own family she decided to work full time in this business, going out to sell in other communities with the goal of increasing her income. The up coming season is the best of the year as sales increase considerably. So with the help of the loan she can buy more material and augment her production. Her busy time starts in the month of October so that coming up to the December season she has enough merchandise for any unforeseen orders.

The dream that she carries in her mind is to increase her production and provide work for new people. She is also looking to set up in a shop so people can see her crafts in detail. "For now I am confident that things are going well as the cold has arrived and it is our best opportunity to sell the product of our efforts", she commented enthusiastically.

The other members of the group are Paula, Rosalina, Maximina, María Eugenia and Araceli who will also invest in handicraft embroidery.

*The photograph was taken in the plaza in the municipal center. Flora is wearing a blue shawl.

loans.use: to buy raw material like fabric, yarn, needles, thread, etc.

location.town: Fresno Nichi, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Lucecitas Group

texts.es:
En una de las comunidades más coloridas de Veracruz se lleva a cabo la Feria Ganadera en el mes de diciembre organizada por la Asociación Ganadera Local. Se realizan exhibiciones de la producción artesanal, industrial, cultural y de servicios; además de la tradicional muestra de ganado vacuno, principalmente. En una de sus colonias se integró un grupo llamado Lucecitas cuyos integrantes son: Lucia quien vende bolsas artesanales, cosméticos y recipientes; Esbeydi, botanas y elotes; Nayeli, comida; Víctor, abarrotes. Por su parte, Severo da servicios de jardinería; Daniela, de estética y Jorge quien repara celulares. 
   Doña Lucia ha formado una familia a lado de su esposo Florentino y sus cuatro hijos los cuales hoy en día son mayores de edad.  Desde hace más de 28 años decidió dedicarse a la venta de cosméticos y recipientes de plástico por catálogo con el firme propósito de apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. Al pasar los años sus actividades se fortalecieron a tal grado que con las ganancias pudo dar educación a todos sus hijos, además de realizar mejoras en su casa, satisfacer sus gustos personales e iniciar una nueva actividad.
   Así, después de recibir un curso de manualidades, inició con la elaboración y venta de bolsas de mano, las cuales realiza de manera artesanal. Ella comenta contenta, “me siento muy contenta con mis actividades y orgullosa por ser una mujer productiva”. Ahora está esperando el apoyo de VFMéxico para comprar tela de manta bondeada, piedras, listones, rubores, sombras, labiales  delineadores y recipientes para cubrir todas sus actividades.
   Por otro lado, los integrantes del grupo expresan: “gracias por el préstamo otorgado y por motivarnos para continuar con nuestras actividades”.
*La fotografía fue tomada en el patio trasero de Lucia quien viste blusa color verde.
texts.en:
In one of the most colorful neighborhoods of Veracruz, the Livestock Fair is held in December and is organized by the Local Farmers Association. Aside from the traditional showing of bovine animals, there are exhibits on artisanal, industrial and cultural production, as well as exhibits for different services. In one of this area's communities, a group called "Lucecitas" was formed. The members of this group include: Lucia, who sells handmade bags, cosmetics and containers; Esbeydi, who sells snacks and corn on the cob; Nayeli, who sells food; and Victor, who sells groceries. Also, Severo provides gardening services; Daniela, beauty services, and Jorge repairs cell phones.

Lucia has formed a family together with her husband, Florentino, and their four children, all of whom are now adults. More than 28 years ago, she decided to begin selling cosmetics and plastic containers via catalog with the clear purpose of supporting her husband with the household expenses. As the years passed, her business grew stronger to such a level that with the profits, she was able to provide an education to all of her children, make improvements to her home, satisfy her personal pleasures, and begin a new business.

And so, after taking a craft course, she began to create and sell handbags which she makes by hand. She happily shares, "I am very happy with my businesses and am proud to be a productive woman." She is currently waiting for the support of VFMexico in order to buy embroidery fabric, stones, ribbons, blush, eyeshadow, lip liner, and containers in order to stock all of her businesses.

On the other hand, the members of the group share: "thank you for the loan and for motivating us to continue with our businesses."

*The picture was taken in the backyard. Lucia is wearing a green shirt.

loans.use: to buy embroidery fabric, stones, ribbon, blush, eyeshadow, lip liner, and Tupperware.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is 28 years old, married to Wycliffe and blessed with three children. For the past five years she has grown vegetables such as onions and potatoes, which has earned her approximately 7,000 KES a month.

Hellen has taken out and successfully repaid four previous loans through Kiva's field partner VisionFund Kenya. She has now applied for a 36,000 KES loan to buy fertilizer to top dress her field. She plans to use her profits to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to top dress her field.

loans.name: Enyon

texts.fr: Enyon est une femme mariée âgée de 34 ans qui vit à Tokoin. Mère d’un seul enfant, Enyon s’efforce  pour gagner son revenu  en revendant des articles de mercerie et des tissus dans son atelier de couture. Pour s’approvisionner, Enyon se rend une fois par mois au marché. Pour commander des rouleaux de doublures, de viselines et des unités de sac, Enyon nécessite ce fonds pour financer son approvisionnement. Avec la marge bénéficiaire qui en résultera suite à une bonne vente, Enyon va pouvoir aider son mari à bien s’occupé de leur enfant et  agrandir son commerce.
texts.en: Enyon is a 34-year-old married woman living in Tokoin. The mother of one child, she strives to earn an income by selling sewing supplies and fabrics in her sewing workshop. To stock up, she goes to the market once a month. To put in an order for rolls of lining material, viselines, and bags, Enyon has need of these funds to finance her supplies. With the profits resulting from good sales, she will be able to help out her husband to take good care of their child and to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase 12 rolls of lining material, 7 rolls of visselines, and 50 units of bags

loans.name: Madhuri's Group

texts.en:
Madhuri, a differently abled lady standing to the righthand side in the photograph, has been working six hours a day for the last eight years. During this time, she has set up a good business of selling milk to a steady stream of loyal customers.

However, demand still exceeds supply. Madhuri would now like to buy a second cow to meet this increasing demand. She needs a loan from you to do just that.

She is growing old, but does not have the luxury of slowing down as yet. She needs to save some money for an uncertain future, and milk from a second cow will help her do just that.

Madhuri, along with her group member, is requesting a loan of 30,000 INR from Kiva's partner People's Forum. She will use her portion of the loan amount to buy another milking cow.

By helping Madhuri, you'll be reaffirming that age is just a number and helping this lady and her husband lead a life of dignity and respect.

loans.use: to buy another milking cow

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: Doña María, tiene 63 años de edad, es una madre soltera, vive junto a dos hijos, un nieto y su nuera, en El Progreso, Yoro. Siempre se ha dedicado al comercio con la venta de mercadería y comida. Actualmente vende calzado, ropa usada y nueva y también productos plásticos.  La venta de mercadería la realiza de manera ambulante donde ofrece blusas, camisetas, pantalones, ropa de niños, sandalias, cameras, platos, plástico en general y otros. Lleva varios préstamos solicitados en ODEF, actualmente solicita otro por 8,000 Lempiras los que utilizara en la compra de ropa nueva como ser ropa interior, blusas, sabanas, ropa de niño y camisetas de todo tipo, para obtener más clientes. Sus metas son mejorar su negocio, obtener mejores ingresos, mejorar su vivienda y seguir apoyando a su familia para tener una buena calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María is 63 years old. She is a single mother and she lives with her two children, a grandson and a daughter-in-law in El Progreso, Yoro. 
She's always worked selling products and food. She is currently selling shoes, used clothing, children's clothing and plastic containers.
She sells door to door offering blouses, shirts, slacks, children's clothing, sandals, jackets, bowls, plastic containers and others.
She's requested several loans from ODEF and she is asking now for 8,000 Lempiras that she will use to buy brand new clothing such as underwear, blouses, bed sheets, children's clothing and all types of shirts to attract more customers.
Her goals are to improve her business, to get a better income, to improve her home and to continue supporting her family so they can have a good quality of life.

loans.use: to buy retail clothing such as underwear, blouses, bed sheets, children's clothing and all types of shirts to attract more customers.

loans.name: Riverside Young Mothers Group

texts.en:
On the left is Elizabeth, the leader of the two-member Riverside Young Mothers Group in Nakuru. She is thirty nine years old, married and blessed with three children. She operates a salon and cosmetics shop where she offers beauty services.

Elizabeth joined Kiva's field partner Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2013. She has applied for a 20,000 KES loan to be divided between her and her partner. She will use her share to stock up on beauty products for her salon. This will enable her to meet her customers’ demands, thus making her more money.

Elizabeth’s income will go a long way in supporting her family’s basic needs and medical care. She is grateful to Kiva and its lenders and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: to stock up on beauty products for her salon.

loans.name: Seneida

texts.es: Doña Seneida, de 57 años de edad, es una madre soltera, y vive con una hija en el municipio de Santa Rita, Yoro. Ella siempre se ha dedicado al comercio, anteriormente vendía comida y hace 5 años se dedica a la venta de ropa. Doña Seneida alquila un local en el mercado de la comunidad donde ofrece ropa de vestir para Damas, niños y caballeros. el préstamo que solicita es el sexto ciclo con la institución, el cual es por 20,000 Lempiras, este préstamo también lo invertirá en la compra de ropa nueva y fardos de ropa usada para la temporada navideña y escolar. Esto le servirá para aprovechar la temporada y cumplir con los encargos que le han hecho sus clientes. Su meta es crecer en su negocio y obtener mejores ganancias para seguir apoyando a la familia económicamente.
texts.en:
Seneida is 57 years old. She is a single mother and she lives with her daughter in the municipality of Santa Rita, Yoro. 
She's always been involved in commerce. She used to sell food and she's been selling clothing for 5 years. Seneida rents a store at a local market in her community where she offers dress clothes for ladies, children and men. 
This is her sixth loan with this partner and she is asking for 20,000 Lempiras. She will also use it to buy new clothing and used clothing in bulk for school and the holiday season. This way, she can take advantage of the season and fulfill some orders her customers have already placed.
Her goal is to grow her business and make a better income to continue financially supporting her family.

loans.use: to buy brand new clothing and used clothing in bulk for school and the holiday season.

loans.name: Sabougnouma Group

texts.fr:
Agé de 58 ans, marié et père de 8 enfants, monsieur Etienne  est soucieux d’avoir  un parc de bœuf, il fait recourt aux services financiers du RMCR pour améliorer son activité d’embouche.
il s’approvisionne dans les marchés locaux et sert de fournisseur dans ces mêmes marchés, ce qui lui permet d’avoir un bénéfice mensuel de 25 000 FCFA.
Embaucheur depuis 30 ans il veut acheter plus de bétail qui lui permettra d’acquérir plus de bénéfice pour qu’il subvienne à ces besoins familiaux (frais  scolaires des enfants, soins de santé des enfants et leurs habillements).
Restant attaché à son activité d’embouche par amour pour les animaux, il est souvent confronté à certains problème  comme : le soin et l’alimentation des animaux pour faire fasse a toute ses exigences il veut un financement des préteurs pour devenir l'un des meilleurs embaucheur de la localité.
texts.en:
Mr. Etienne, aged 58, is the married father of eight. He is keen on having a cattle ranch and has turned to RMCR financial services to improve his livestock business. He stocks up from the local markets and makes use of suppliers from these same market. This allows him to have a monthly profit of 25,000 francs CFA.

A livestock farmer for thirty years, he wants to purchase more animals enabling him to acquire more profit, so as to meet the needs of his family (the children’s schooling costs, healthcare, and clothing).

Remaining attached to his livestock business because of his love of animals, he is often confronted with certain problems, such as: care and feeding of the animals. To cope with all the requirements, he wants financing from lenders in order to become one of the best livestock farmers in town.

loans.use: to raise cattle

loans.name: Seniwe (0166) Group

texts.fr:
Manssan Honoré  est celui qui a la main dans le sac d’arachide, se tenant devant son magasin de stockage en compagnie des membres de son groupement.Âgée de 46 ans  marié et père de 10 enfants dont l’âge varie entre 6 à 17 ans dont 8 scolarisés. Il est commerçant de céréale depuis plus de 10 ans, en plus de cette activité, il pratique l’élevage et l’agriculture. Ses deux épouses s’occupent des travaux champêtres et de l’entretient des enfants.
Il achète et vent sur les marchés locaux dans un rayon de 60 km environ avec une marge bénéficiaire de 150 000F/mois. Il fait recours au prêt RMCR pour augmenter d’avantage ses capacités de stockage et de vente de céréale surtout en cette période des récoltes.
Son rêve, c’est de pouvoir construire un grand magasin de stockage de céréales  pour pouvoir vendre le céréale aux plus nécessiteux .
texts.en:
Manssan Honore, the one with his hand in the bag of peanuts, is pictured in front of his warehouse together with members of his borrowers' group. He is 46 years old, married and the father of 10 chidlren ranging from 6 to 17 years of age, eight of whom are in school. Manssan Honore has been selling cereals for over 10 years. In addition, he raises livestock and grows farm produce. His two wives work the fields and take care of the children. Mansan Honore buys and resells in the local markets within a radius of about 60 km [37 miles], making a profit margin of 150,000 West African francs per month. 

He has applied for a loan from RMCR in order to increase his capacity to stock cereals for resale, particularly during this harvesting season. His goal is to be able to build a big cereal warehouse to be able to sell cereals to the underserved population.

loans.use: to buy cereals for resale.

loans.name: Mujeres Activas Group

texts.es:
El Comité Mujeres Activas está en el 1º ciclo, son un grupo que están empezando a trabajar con el programa de comité de mujeres, ellas se unieron para poder ayudarse las unas a las otras por medio del trabajo unido.
Dory es una de las que integra este grupo, ella vende bebidas de toda clase, y comenta que gracias a sus ventas tiene los medios para poder dar a sus seres queridos una vida digna y sin probaciones. Dory se destaca en este grupo por ser una mujer muy activa que siempre está dispuesta a aprender.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar gaseosas, jugos, cervezas, vinos y otras bebidas, de manera a tener más variedad que ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
"El Comité Mujeres Activas" ["Active Women's Committee"] is in its first loan cycle. They are a group who are starting to work with the women's committee program. They came together to be able to help one another through working together.

Dory is one of the women who fits in this group. She sells all types of drinks, and says that thanks to her sales she has the means to be able to give her loved ones a dignified life without trials. Dory stands out in this group for being a very active woman who is always ready to learn.

She requests this loan in order to be able to buy soda, juice, beer, wine, and other beverages--in this way having more variety to offer her clients.

loans.use: to buy drinks for sale, such as: soda, juice, beer, wine and other drinks.

loans.name: Sady Coralia

texts.es: Las ganas de salir adelante es lo que caracteriza a Sady, es una joven que con mucho esfuerzo lograra terminar su carrera, su esposo y su hija son su principal motor para seguir estudiando. La ingeniería le gusta mucho y está segura que podrá ser una profesional de éxito. Como está a cerca de culminar su carrera Sady solicita un crédito para pagar su examen de grado y obtener el título. Dentro de sus planes futuros esta conseguir un mejor empleo donde pueda desempeñarse.
texts.en:
Her desire to get ahead is a great quality in Sady. With a great deal of effort, this young lady will be able to get her degree and finish her professional career. Her husband and daughter are her fuel to keep studying. She likes engineering a lot and she is confident she will become a successful professional. She is close to obtaining her degree, so Sady is asking for a loan to pay for her final exam and get her diploma.
Her future plans are to find a better job where she can use her skills.

loans.use: to pay for her graduation exam and obtain her degree.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El grupo lleva por nombre Kuña Guapa, es  de la ciudad de San Ignacio, ellas son unidas y solidarias entre ellas, se fijaron como meta el crecimiento de cada una, no solo en lo económico, sino también como personas. Ella es una mujer muy sacrificada que pone todo de sí para poder crecer y salir adelante.
La señora Maria, es presidenta del grupo, está casada y también es madre, ella tiene una repostería donde trabaja todos los días cumpliendo con el pedido de sus clientes de la mejor manera. Maria es muy buena con lo que hace, es por ello que tiene muchos clientes que siempre les hace muchos pedidos, y con los que quiere cumplir siempre.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar harina, huevos, azúcar, manteca, dulces y otros productos para poder seguir con su repostería, y de esa manera tener los medios para poder ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
The group is named Kuña Guapa; it's from the city of San Ignacio. The women are very united and supportive among themselves. They set as a goal the growth of each woman, not only from an economic point of view, but also as individuals. She is a very selfless woman that gives her all to be able to grow and move forward. Señora Maria, the president of the group, is married and also a mother. She has a pastry shop where she works every day filling her customers orders in the best way possible. Maria is very good at what she does; that's why she has a lot of clients who always make a lot of orders, which she desires always to fulfill. 
She is requesting this loan in order to be able to buy flour, eggs, sugar, butter, sweets and other products to be able to continue working in her pastry shop, and in this way have the means to help her family.
.

loans.use: To buy supplies for pastry-making, like: flour, eggs, sugar, butter, sweets and other products.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is a married man. He has three children. He describes himself as disciplined. He operates a farm where he grows maize and french beans. He has been involved in this business for 20 years. His business is located in a fertile area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be a lack of water. He will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy farm inputs. His business goal is to have a large farm within five years. 

Simon hopes that in the future he will be successful. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: el joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 29 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, posee una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace 10 años, tiene muchos clientes por la variedad de productos que comercializa y asi es como puede solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el joven vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hija, el esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas mercaderia sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: The face of the young man in the photo has been blurred because he is 29 years old and lives in a high risk zone. He owns a small store located in his residence for the last ten years. He has many customers because of the variety of products he sells, and that's how he can cover expenses of his household. He lives in his own home with his wife and daughter. He is requesting a loan for the purchase of more merchandise such as soups, eggs, basic grains, soda pop, sweets, pastries, etc., so as to earn better income for a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise such as soup, eggs, basic grains, soda pop, pastries, etc.

loans.name: Jimmy Dany

texts.es: Las ganas de ayudar a las personas es lo que caracteriza a Jimmy, es por esta razón que estudia psicología, está a punto de culminar su carrera y ser un profesional de éxito. Su papa es su principal apoyo y desea que su hijo logre coronar la carrera.  Jimmy tiene que realizar diversos trabajos que le asignan en la universidad es por esta razón que solicita un crédito para comprar una computadora y entregar de manera más rápida los trabajos.  Desea culminar su carrera y encontrar un trabajo donde pueda desempeñarse y adquirir mayor experiencia.
texts.en: Wanting to help people is what characterizes Jimmy. For that reason, he is studying psychology. He is almost finished with his degree and will become a successful professional. His father is his greatest support and he wants his son to get to the top of his career. Jimmy has to do different assignments that are given to him by the university. For this reason, he is requesting a loan to buy a computer and turn in the assignments more quickly.  He wants to get to the top of his career and find a job where he can perform and get better experience.

loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Milton Francisco

texts.es: Milton de 42 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, el se dedica a la venta de variedad de zapatos para dama, caballeros y niños. El negocio lo tiene ubicado en el mercado de la zona donde habita y de esta forma se gana la vida y lleva el sustento a su familia. Ha tomado la decisión de ampliar su negocio ya que ha notado un aumento en las ventas y desea aprovechar esta temporada navideña y fin de año que es cuando las ventas tienden a crecer. Por lo anterior esta solicitando este crédito para invertir en la compra de variedad de zapatos y sandalias, de esta forma espera mejorar sus ingresos y así dar mejores condiciones de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Milton is 42 years old and lives in his own home with his family group. He works selling a variety of shoes for ladies, gentlemen and children. His business is located in the market of the area where he lives and that's the way he earns a living and provides sustenance for his family.
He has decided to expand his business because he has noticed an increase in sales and wants to take advantage of the Christmas and end of year season which is when sales tend to increase. For that reason he is requesting this loan to invest in the purchase of a variety of shoes and sandals, in which manner he hopes to increase his income and provide better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to buy a variety of shoes and sandals.

loans.name: La Milagrosa Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama La Milagrosa está en su ciclo número 3, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan las unas a las otras por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus familias.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Luz, ella se dedica a la venta de postres, la señora misma se encarga de hacer los postres desde muy temprano en la mañana, y luego sale a venderlos de manera ambulante por su barrio, ella está poniendo todo de sí para poder crecer y mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
La Sra. Luz solicita de este préstamo para la compra de productos variados, tales como leche, azúcar, arroz, pan para realizar postres como arroz con leche, cremas, miel con maní entre otros. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus seres queridos.
texts.en:
This group is called “La Milagrosa” (The Miraculous). It is in its third loan cycle, where everyone works and helps each other to get ahead. They are participating in the “Poverty Spotlight” program to eliminate poverty, to be able to improve their living conditions and that of their families.

One of the group members is Señora Luz. She makes a living selling desserts. She herself is responsible for making the desserts, beginning very early in the morning, and then for going to sell them as a street vendor in her neighborhood. She is putting all of herself into this business so as to grow and improve her living conditions.

Sra. Luz requests this loan to purchase various products, such as milk, sugar, rice, and bread to make desserts such as rice pudding, cream, honeyed peanuts, and other products. She gives thanks for the opportunity to be enabled to improve her living conditions and those of her loved ones.

loans.use: to buy supplies for making desserts, such as: milk, sugar, rice, bread and other supplies.

loans.name: Humera

texts.en: Humera is a youth of 28, married and lives with her husband in a populated area in Lahore. Her husband makes different types of furniture. He makes intricate carvings on the furniture. He uses cardboard, ply boards, oak and shisham wood. Traditional eastern furniture is very famous in Pakistan. He is still in the process of learning more skills. He recently got an order for making furniture but does not have sufficient funds. Humera has therefore requested a loan to help him buy wood, boards, paint, grease etc.

loans.use: to help her husband buy raw material to make furniture.

loans.name: Nasser

texts.en:
Nasser is a 46-year-old married father of three children and a Palestinian refugee. He has worked as a painter for twenty-six years to cover the needs and expenses of his beloved family. Nasser is trying hard to satisfy his family's increasing living costs and at the same time expand his business. He already bought a car from his previous loan, but it is not serving his expanding business very well.

Thus today he is again acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy a larger car which will better facilitate his work by allowing him to shift between the workshops and transport his equipment in an easy way. Nasser hopes to expand his business more in the future to increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a larger car which will facilitate his work.

loans.name: Khatija

texts.en: Khatija is a housewife who lives with her husband in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is a very hardworking man and is capable of affording three children by running a fruit shop in the area near his home where he is residing. However, for a couple of weeks he has been unable to make both ends meet because of a shortage of stock and also because all of his savings has been spent. Therefore, to stabilize the economic cycle of the family, his wife Khatija applied for the loan amount of 30,000 PKR. Khatija is happy with the Kiva platform and gives her thanks to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to invest in her husband's fruit shop.

loans.name: Joumana

texts.en:
Joumana is a 47-year-old Lebanese, married woman. She’s living with her husband and three school aged children. She cooperates with her husband and has started to work, hoping she could bring added income to the family. She has been working as a hairdresser and beautician since 2008, and she has customers from all over the neighboring area.

Today, she has the intention of borrowing a loan from Kiva's partner, Vitas s.a.l. to buy additional beauty products. This will be her first loan, and it will help her boost her earnings and therefore improve her family’s way of living. One of her greatest dreams is to better develop her business and gain the biggest number of clients she can.

loans.use: to buy additional beauty products

loans.name: Umoja Pamoja Women Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photo is Rose. She is a member of the Umoja Pamoja Group. She is 31 years old, married and blessed with two children, who are both in primary school.

Rose joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2015, and through them she has gained experience and acquired skills on enterprise development and financial management which have further helped her to operate her business.

Rose is borrowing from Kiva to purchase quality fertilizer for her potato farming business. This will enable her to get high yields which will increase her income and enable her to meet basic needs such as food, clothing, a modern shelter and school fees for her children.

She is grateful to Kiva and its lenders, and she promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to purchase quality fertilizer for her potato farming business. This will enable her to get high yields which will increase her income so she can meet basic needs with ease.

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris is a married woman with 3 children who describes herself as determined.

Doris operates a retail business selling tomatoes and other vegetables, and she has been involved in this business for 6 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more stock of tomatoes.

This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tomatoes.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall. She has been in this business for 10 years, and she also earns more income from making hollow blocks.

Gloria has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
The person appearing in the photo is Florence. She is 29 years old, married and blessed with five children. Florence joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2013 to benefit from courses on enterprise development and financial management. This improved her knowledge in business management.

Florence is able to advance her tree nursery business by proper recording keeping and using the profits prudently.

Florence is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy a water tank and pipes to support her farming activities. She looks forward to more income that she will use to help cover family expenses.

She appreciates Kiva for the support and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy a water tank and pipes to support her farming activities. She looks forward to more income that she will use to help cover family expenses.

loans.name: Marjorine

texts.en:
Marjorine is in her first loan cycle. She believes that she will be heard, and that you can definitely help her. With great confidence and hope in her eyes, she applied for a loan to buy more clothes to sell.

Marjorine is a single parent and a mother of two, one in the tertiary and the other at the JHS level.

Marjorine decided to bring in new goods and renew the products in her store. To realize this operation, she requests you to participate and help her to provide and sustain her family too. She will bring in new clothes and will be even happier.

Through faithfulness I will always abide by the terms and conditions applied for the repayment of the loan, she says.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Akilu

texts.en:
Akilu is a maize farmer from Dandoka village. As a Babban Gona member, Akilu is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Akilu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member, Akilu can store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Akilu no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Akilu hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Eunice is a Kiva borrower. She has four children. She describes herself to be trustworthy. She operates a farm where she keeps cows and also grows tea and vegetables. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy seeds, agrochemicals and other farm inputs. She hopes that in the future, she will expand the business. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy seeds, agrochemicals and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Jovencianita

texts.en:
Jovencianita is 50 years old and married with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Jovencianita has a food vending business in the Philippines. Jovencianita requested a PHP 11,500 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients and materials like hotdogs, tempura, bamboo sticks, etc. for her food vending business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Jovencianita has been in this business for 16 years. In the future, Jovencianita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and materials like hotdog, tempura, bamboo sticks, etc. for her food vending business

loans.name: Kiuukuni Women Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand in the photo is Reginah, a member of Kiuukuni Women group. She is 32 years old, married and a mother of four children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2013 to benefit from the trainings, especially enterprise development. Courtesy of the training, she now keeps proper business records and tracks business expenses and profits.

She is involved in poultry farming and she is now borrowing a Kiva loan to rent a shop where she will be selling the eggs among other farm produce. This will increase sales and hence earn more income to enable her to meet family expenses, e.g. school fees, food and clothing.

Reginah is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: to rent a shop for selling eggs from her poultry farming business and earn more income to pay family expenses e.g. food, clothing and school fees.

loans.name: Don Max Group

texts.es:
Cierta comunidad mexiquense tiene como características su origen mazahua, sus tradiciones y sus habitantes quienes son amables, responsables y, sobretodo, muy alegres. Ante cualquier celebración realizan una gran fiesta llena de colorido, música y sana convivencia; como ejemplo está el día de muertos donde todos acostumbran colocar ofrendas y visitar los panteones para adornar las tumbas de sus seres fallecidos.  
   Don Eligió es un fiel representante de su comunidad ya que es una persona muy alegre cuyo gran espíritu emprendedor contagia a sus conocidos. Tiene un único compromiso que lo hace trabajar diariamente: su familia integrada por su esposa Yolanda y sus cuatro hijos los cuales estudian en las escuelas de la comunidad. 
   En el momento en que decidió formar una familia también se vio obligado a solventar los gastos de su hogar, para ello se empleó en una carpintería adquiriendo una experiencia considerable al grado de convertirse en maestro del oficio. Posteriormente se independizó y abrió su propio negocio donde gradualmente adquirió mejores herramientas y con las ganancias obtenidas pudo ampliar su taller. 
    Por otro lado, parte fundamental de su éxito lo amerita al apoyo que obtuvo con VFMéxico pues comenta,  "gracias a los prestamos ahora tengo más materia prima y mi negocio ha crecido; sobretodo mis hijos están mejor". Con este nuevo apoyo compraría madera, pintura y herramientas para elaborar el producto que lo ubica como uno de los carpinteros de su región. Asimismo una de sus metas es incrementar su producción para posteriormente abrir una nueva carpintería en otro punto de su comunidad lo que le brindaría empleo a más personas entusiastas.
   Los otros integrantes del grupo son Teresa quien invertirá en la compra de cerdos; Máximo, en artículos de ferretería; Gilberta y Esteban, en ovejas y Benito, en el servicio de carpintería.
*La fotografía fue tomada en las escaleras del quiosco del centro municipal.
texts.en:
There is a certain Mexican community characterized by its Mazahua origins, its traditions and its friendly people. These same people are also responsible and above all, very cheerful. They celebrate any festival filling the streets with color, music and camaraderie. One such festival is the "Day of the Dead" in which the locals make offerings and decorate the tombstones of their loved ones who have passed away.

Eligio represents his community to the fullest, with his cheerful manner and entrepreneurial spirit, which rubs off on those around him.

When he decided to form a family, he saw the need to pay the household expenses as well, so he started work for a carpenter, where he gained enough experience to be able to start up as a professional.

He set up his own business and bit by bit, started to accumulate the best tools for the job. With the profits he made, he was able to expand his workshop.

He also benefitted immensely from the support of VFMexico: "thanks to their loans, I now have more raw materials and my business has grown. This has improved life for my children a great deal."

He will use this new loan to buy wood, paint and tools so he can make products that allow him to stand out as one of the main carpenters in his region.

He also aims to increase productivity so he can open a new workshop in another part of town, which will provide employment opportunities for other people who share his enthusiasm.

The other members of the credit group are Teresa, who raises pigs; Maximo, who has an ironmongers'; Gilberta and Esteban, who raise sheep; and Benito, who also has a carpenters'.

The photo was taken on the steps of the kiosk in the centre of town.

loans.use: to buy wood and tools.

location.town: San Miguel La Labor, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Henriette Florentine

texts.fr:
Henriette est une femme courageuse et travailleuse de 40 ans. Elle est veuve et mère de six enfants dont l'ainé ne vas plus à l'école mais tient une petite boucherie pour l'aider à entretenir et soutenir la famille: ses sœurs et frères. Deux sont scolarisés et les trois derniers pas encore car encore petits (2, 4 et  5 ans).
Elle est marchand de fruits et des maniocs secs et c'est elle même qui cuit le manioc. Elle est dans ce commerce, il y a maintenant 11 ans. L'activité est prospère mais son problème est l'insuffisance de fonds de roulement. Elle a un client dont la livraison est journalier or le paiement est hebdomadaire.
L'objectif est de pouvoir construire un jour une maison.
texts.en:
Henriette is a courageous and hardworking 40-year-old woman.  She is a widow and the mother of six children.  Her oldest child no longer attends school; he runs a small butcher shop and helps his mother to take care and support the family (his younger brothers and sisters).  Two of Henriette's children are in school and the other three are still very young (2, 4 and 5 years old).

Henriette sells fruits and dry cassava.  She cooks the cassava herself.  She's been involved in this activity for the past 11 years.  Her business is doing well but her major problem is the lack of working capital.  She has a customer to whom she sells on a daily basis but who pays her once a week.  Henriette's goal is to be able to build a house one day.

loans.use: to buy mangos, papayas, bananas, pineapples and strawberries.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is a single woman with 2 children. She describes herself to be focused. She operates a farm where she keeps cows and grows maize and bananas. Her business is located in a fertile area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of water. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy farm inputs. Her business goal is to have a large farm within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children to university level. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Marcia

texts.en:
Marcia is 41 years old and married with five children, four of whom are in school.

She is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Marcia has requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

She has been in the pig fattening business for 4 years now, and has borrowed 10 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Marcia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Donara

texts.en: This is Donara's second loan from Kiva. While continuing her education at the State University's Ijevan branch, Donara is asking for lenders to support her with paying university tuition. This will help her to cover her 4th year tuition fee and graduate with a Bachelor's degree. Donara hopes for the lenders' support one more time.

loans.use: to pay  tuition for university.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is in the third cycle of her loan requirement. She is single with no children. This hard working woman says a heart full thank you to ID-Ghana, a partner of Kiva for helping her boost her capital.

Janet sells second hand clothes at the market in Chorkor. She is requesting a 200 GHS loan from Kiva through ID-Ghana. Janet has been in this business for 8 years and also earns additional income from hawkers who sell for her.

She is working tirelessly towards achieving her dream which is to save enough money to help her sellers establish their own business too.

loans.use: to buy more clothes and sell to her regular customers.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Bouba est celui qui tient la corde de bœuf  dans ses mains.
Malien marié, âgé de 40 ans et père  de 7 enfants dont 3  fréquentent l’école .
Il fait ses achats et ventes de bœufs dans les marchés environnants.fait l’élevage depuis des années de cela ayant une parfaite maitrise de son activité d’élevage ce qui lui permet toujours de faire des profils chaque cycle de prêt.
Il a fait recourt à l’IMF  R.M.C.R  car son fond de commerce  ne suffisaient pas. il a une bonne réputation dans le village et rembourse bien les prêt qu'on l'octroi.
Très dévoué et courageux Il  souhaiterait  avoir suffisamment de fond afin  d’accroitre ses activités d'élevage et devenir  le plus grand  éleveur de la localité ou il se trouve.
texts.en:
Bouba is the man holding the bull's rope.  Bouba is from Mali; he is 40 years old and the father of seven children, three of whom go to school.  Bouba buys and sells cattle at the local markets.  He has been involved in animal husbandry for many years and and he has a perfect command of his activity, which allows him to make a profit at each loan cycle.

He has turned to Kiva's partner, the R.M.C.R. because his working capital was insufficient.  He has a good reputation in the village and he fully repays his loans.

Bouba is very devoted and courageous.  He would like to have enough capital to be able to develop his animal husbandry business.  His goal is to become the biggest cattle breeder in town.

loans.use: to raise cattle.

loans.name: La Gloria Group

texts.es:
En el límite territorial entre dos estados se encuentra una comunidad donde se puede respirar aire libre; el cerro rodeado de vegetación ofrece un hermoso paisaje. El producto que más se cosecha allí es la caña de azúcar siendo uno de los principales productores a nivel nacional. En dicha comunidad se integró un grupo cuyo nombre es La Gloria ya que éste es el nombre que recibe uno de los dulces típicos de la región. 
   Los integrantes son: Sandra y Zuleima quienes venden zapatos; Rolando e Irma, comida; José, Elvira y Ruth, dulces típicos; Ana, cosméticos, ropa interior y dulces; María, dulces y refrescos y Antonio, pescado.
   José es un hombre muy amable, conocido por su buen humor y entrega a su trabajo; en su comunidad es llamado “Wuicho” de cariño. En su familia existe la tradición de elaborar y vender dulces típicos, “con tan solo 7 años de edad salía con mis padres a vender dulces en diferentes comunidades” expresó contento. Actualmente tiene 38 años de experiencia tras su negocio, “la necesidad me ha llevado a explotar la actividad que aprendí de niño” expresa. 
   Tras elaborar a detalle cada producto se dedica a recorrer las calles de su comunidad donde muchos de sus clientes ya lo esperan para disfrutar de un delicioso dulce. El proceso de elaboración inicia por la mañana cuando, entre otras cosas, raya coco, pela semillas, muele, coloca cacerolas de barro al fuego y mezcla agua, azúcar, queso, etc. para crear los tradicionales jamoncillos. Su objetivo siempre ha sido el cumplir con las demandas de sus clientes ofreciendo la mejor calidad a un precio accesible; “toda mi familia sabe hacer dulces, eso es lo mejor pues ha prevalecido durante generaciones la receta familiar que nos ha brindado el éxito” agrega.
   Después de descansar dos ciclos se ha integrado nuevamente al grupo, el préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de semilla de pipián, coco, piña, azúcar, aceite, longaniza y tortillas para comenzar con la venta de tacos.
*La fotografía fue tomada en “La novia del sol”, sobre un pozo de agua inactivo, José  viste camisa de manga larga a cuadros, sobre las piernas tiene una canasta donde trasporta diariamente los dulces.
texts.en:
Between two states there is a community where you can breathe fresh air and enjoy the lush green scenery. The most harvested product here is sugar cane, making this area one of the biggest producers in the country.

In this community there is credit group called "La Gloria" who take their name from one of the typical desserts of the region. The group is made up of Sandra and Zuleima, who sell shoes; Rolando and Irma, who sell food; Jose, Elvira and Ruth, who sell typical cakes; Ana, who sells cosmetics, underwear and cakes; Maria, who sells cakes and soft drinks; and finally Antonio; who sells fish.

Jose is a friendly man, well-known for his sense of humor and his dedication to his work. He goes by the nickname "Wuicho" in his community.

He comes from a family with a great tradition of making and selling typical cakes and sweet things. "I started going out with my parents when I was only seven, to sell our products around the neighboring communities" he cheerfully tells us. He now boasts 38 years' experience in this line of work. "I started a business using the skills I learnt as a boy out of necessity."

Once he has carefully prepared his products, he sets out to sell them on the streets where his customers are waiting to buy his delicious cakes. He starts making them in the morning. His typical tasks include grating coconut, shelling nuts and grinding them, placing his earthenware pans on the heat and mixing water, sugar, cheese, etc to make the traditional fudge.

He always aims to satisfy his customer demand, with the best quality product possible at an affordable price. "Making these sweet treats runs in the family. These recipes have been passed down from generation to generation and have given us success."

After two loan cycles away, he has reincorporated in the group and he will use this new loan to buy seeds, coconut, pineapple, and sugar; as well as oil, sausages and tortillas so he can also start to offer tacos.

The photograph was taken at "La novia del sol" sitting on a unused well. Jose is wearing a long-sleeved checked shirt. He has a basket in his lap which he uses to carry his products.

loans.use: to buy food ingredients.

loans.name: Ihsan

texts.en: Ihsan is a 52 year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and four children. Some of her children are still studying. She cooperates with her husband in order to satisfy their daily needs. Ihsan works in selling homemade foods to her neighbours. Currently, with the aim to buy books for the new school year, she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. She says that with her Kiva loan, she will be able to help her children to pursue a good education which makes her very happy.

loans.use: to buy books for the new school year.

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.en: Eugenia is a married woman with 4 children. She operates a farm where she grows bananas. Her business is located in a fertile area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be transport. She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy farm inputs. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful. This is her fifth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Tomasi

texts.en: Tomasi is an old hardworking married man with six children and lives in Kamwenge, Uganda. He rears livestock to earn a living. However, he also grows crops to earn an extra income and provide for his family. He faces the challenge of inadequate land which limits the grazing space for his animals.  He has intentions of buying more land to allow him to expand his animal farm and with the profits, educate all his children to a minimum qualification of a degree so as to have a bright future.  He is requesting for a loan to buy more cows to add in the farm.

loans.use: to buy more cows to add to his farm.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is 48 years old and married with two children. With one child currently in school, Elma works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like canned goods, snack foods, candies, coffee, detergent soap, shampoo and milk to sell.

Elma has been in this business for 20 years and sells a variety of items.

Elma would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like canned goods, snack foods, candy, coffee, detergent soap, shampoo and milk to sell.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is a married woman with three children. When asked to describe herself in a word, she said, “Prayerful.”

For the past 10 years, Pauline has farmed maize and bananas. Her farm is located in a fertile region, and she sells her produce to local people. She says her biggest challenge as a farmer is insufficient water.

Pauline has taken out and successfully repaid a prior loan through Kiva's field partner SMEP Microfinance Bank. She has now applied for a 15,000 KES loan to buy farm inputs. She is determined that in the future, she will be successful.

loans.use: to buy inputs to use on her maize and banana farm.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Eunice is a married woman. She has one child. She operates a beauty salon where she offers beauty services. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of beauty products. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of beauty products.

loans.name: Rabha

texts.en: Rabha is a 36-year-old married Lebanese woman living with her husband and two children who are both attending school.  Her husband is the main income source in the family. Today, given that her children will enter school very soon, she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to pay the school fees. The parents’ only wish is to provide their children with a respectable educational path until they graduate.

loans.use: to pay school fees.

loans.name: Tamarindo Group

texts.es:
Existe una gran extensión de agua que cubre la mayor parte del territorio de cierto municipio oaxaqueño. Es conocido como la represa y es el mayor atractivo turístico de la zona; también hay pequeñas islas formadas en erupciones de tierra en donde aún prevalecen rasgos de la cultura mazateca. Entre las actividades de sus habitantes se encuentra la elaboración de trajes típicos por parte de las mujeres quienes se sienten orgullosas de sus raíces.
   Allí mismo se formó un grupo llamado Tamarindo ya que en esta región es muy común el árbol del que se obtiene dicho fruto. Los integrantes son: Cristina y José quienes se dedican a la venta de pescado; Esperanza, refresco; Thalía, ovejas; Juana, pescado y plátanos; Julita, tamales y tortillas; Saturnina, pescado y tamales; Crecencia, comida. 
   Doña Juana es una de las integrantes más entusiastas del grupo, ya que tiene 6 hijos por los cuales seguir dando lo mejor de sí día con día. Su esposo Tomas proviene de una familia de pescadores es por eso que le enseñó todo lo necesario para realizar dicha labor por su propia cuenta desde hace 20 años. Desde entonces viajan juntos hasta la represa donde se adentran sobre una chalupa o balsa de remos; al terminar la jornada regresan con suficiente pescado mojarra que al día siguiente, por la mañana,  entregan a sus clientes. En promedio pescan de 15 a 20 kilos por día lo que representa ingresos favorables. 
   Por otro lado, se dedican a la siembra de plátano llamado “macho” el cual venden en el mercado de su comunidad junto con su hoja que es ocupada para realizar tamales. “Trabajamos felizmente juntos” expresó doña Juana a quien sus hijos ayudan a dar mantenimiento a las herramientas de trabajo, la barca incluida. No obstante, no descarta la posibilidad de adquirir una lancha a motor aunque para su familia, la chalupa es una manera de preservar la tradición de la pesca.
   Para continuar con su éxito, invertiría el préstamo que VFMéxico  le ofrece en la compra de malla, línea, plomo y corcho para elaborar nuevas redes..
*La fotografía fue tomada en un pozo de agua inactivo, Doña Juana viste blusa roja y está ubicada detrás de Crecencia quien también viste blusa color rojo.
texts.en:
A great body of water covers most of the territory in a certain municipality in Oaxaca. It is known as the "represa" (dam) and is one of the largest tourist attractions in the area; there are also small islands formed by land eruptions where there are still signs of Mazatecan culture. One of the activities of the locals here is women making typical clothing because they are proud of their heritage.

This is where the community bank group called Tamarindo was formed since it is a very common tree and fruit in the area. The members are: Cristina and Jose who sell fish; Esperanza, soft drinks; Thalia, sheep; Juana, fish and bananas; Julit, tamales and tortillas; Saturnina, fish and tamales; Crescencia, food.

Juana is one of the most enthusiastic members of the group. She has six children and wants to give them the best she can every day. Her husband Tomas comes from a family of fishermen and taught her everything she needed to learn to carry out the fishing business which she has been doing for 20 years. Since then they have been traveling together to the dam where they take a boat or raft out in the water. At the end of the day they return with sufficient mojarra fish to sell the next morning to customers. The average is 15 to 20 kilos a day which provides a good income.

They also raise a variety of banana called "macho" which they sell at the community market with leaves to make tamales. "We work together happily" says Juana whose children help maintain the work tools and boats. Although she is thinking about acquiring a motor boat, the family thinks the row boat is a way of preserving the fishing tradition.

To continue with her success, Juana will invest the VF Mexico loan in buying netting, rope, lead and cork to make new nets.

* The photo was taken at an inactive well. Juana is wearing a red blouse and is behind Crescencia who is also wearing a red blouse.

loans.use: to buy netting, lead and cork.

loans.name: Gulhinamo

texts.ru: Женщину на фотографии зовут Гулхинамо. Она добрая и гостеприимная. Ей 41 года. Она замужем и имеет 5 детей. Гулхинамо вместе с семьей проживает на районе Хамадони. Гулхинамо большую часть своей жизни проводит с детьми и занимаясь домашними делами. Но она находит время и для шитья. Гулхинамо принимается заказы на шитье женской одежды. Сейчас чтобы продолжить швейную деятельность Гулхинамо необходимо купить другую машинку. Она хочет купить швейную и вышивальную машинки.  Гулхинамо планирует сама сделать вышивки на платье. Новая машинка ускорит процесс работы и повлияет на качество шитья. Гулхинамо надеется на кредит и на Вашу поддержку.
