texts.en: Meet Gulhinamo, the kind and friendly woman featured in the photo.  Gulhinamo is 41, married, and she has five children.  She lives with her family in the Hamadoni district of Tajikistan.  She spends most of her time taking care of her children and the housework, but she also finds some time to sew.  She takes orders from her customers and sews women's dresses.  At the moment, she needs a new sewing machine in order to continue her sewing activity.  She actually wants to buy a sewing machine and an embroidery machine, as she's planning to do all embroidery work by herself.  A new sewing machine will allow her to work faster, which will have an influence on the quality of her work.  Gulhinamo is relying on this loan and on your support.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and an embroidery machine.

loans.name: Nadou

texts.fr: Nadou est une femme mariée résidant à Adidogomé avec deux enfants à charge. Nadou est âgée de 29 ans et est une revendeuse de charbon de bois et des chaussures qui s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché et le revend à domicile et dans les quartiers environnant. Pour financer son achat, Nadou nécessite ce prêt pour commander des sacs de charbon de bois et des unités de paires de chaussures en vue de bien revendre et de réaliser plus de bénéfice puis pouvoir aussi relancer son activité afin de soutenir au mieux son mari dans les charges de la famille et permettre une bonne éducation scolaire à leurs enfants.
texts.en:
Nadou is a married woman who live in Adidogomé with her two child dependants. She is 29 years old and is a retailer of charcoal and shoes. She gets her supplies twice a month from the market and resells them at home and in the surrounding neighborhoods.

Nadou needs this loan to finance the order of sacks of charcoal and pairs of shoes, which she hopes to sell at a good price to make more profit, so she can boost her business, help her husband out more with the family expenses and assure a good education for their children;

loans.use: to buy 15 sacks of charcoal and 10 pairs of shoes.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: la joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 27 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riego, posee un taller de calzado, repara y elabora calzado, su taller lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia posee mucha clientela por la calidad del producto, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra salir adelante con los gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, la joven vive en casa propia con su compeñero de vida, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de cuero, hilo, pega, tela, etc. para seguir con su elaboración ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo  y así tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
This young woman's face is pixelated because she is 27 years old and lives in a high risk area. She has a shoe shop where she repairs and makes shoes. Her shop is set up at home and she has many customers because of the qualty of her products. With the income she makes from sales she is able to get ahead and cover household expenses.

She lives in her own home with her life partner and is requesting a loan to buy leather, thread, glue, fabric, etc. to continue her work which is her only source of income. This is so she can have a better quality of lfie.

loans.use: to buy leather, thread, glue, fabric, etc.

loans.name: Abra

texts.fr: Abra est une veuve femme âgée de 51 ans résidant à Adidogomé. Avec deux enfants à charge, Abra est une restauratrice d’ignames frit et des patates douces qui s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché et le revend au bord de la route en face d’une école. Abra sollicite ce prêt pour commander la calebasse d’ignames, des sacs de patates douces et de charbon de bois. Abra désire gagner plus de bénéfice suite à une bonne vente afin de venir en aide à  ses enfants dans leur éducation scolaire puis à prendre à charge les diverses dépenses quotidiennes qu’elle éprouve.
texts.en:
Abra is a 51-year-old widow, who lives in Adidogomé with her two child dependants. She has a restauration activity selling fried yams and sweet potatoes, and she gets her supplies twice a month from the market to resell them on the side of the road opposite a school.

Abra is requesting this loan so she can order a calabash of yams, sacks of sweet potatoes and charcoal. She would like to make more profit from good sales so she can help her children with their education and also cover the various daily expenses she has.

loans.use: to buy a calabash of yams, two sacks of sweet potatoes and a sack of charcoal.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: la joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 26 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riego, vive con su abuela en casa propia, la joven  posee una sala de belleza ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace 8 años, es gracias  a ese trabajo como ha podido salir adelante, la joven solicita por tercera ocasion un crédito para la compra de mas shampoo, uñas acrílicas, tintes para cabello, gelatina para cabello, esmaltes, acondicionadores, etc. todo por mayor ya que la va muy bien en su trabajo y asi pude aumentar mas sus ingresos economicos.
texts.en:
This young woman's face is pixelated because she is 26 years old and lives in a high risk area with her grandmother in her own house. She has a beauty salon set up at home and has been in business for eight years. Thanks to her work she is able to get ahead.

She is requesting her third loan in order to buy more shampoo, acrylic nails, hair color, hair gel, nail polish, conditioners, etc. wholesale. Work is going well for her and she wants to increase her income with the purchase.

loans.use: to buy more shampoo, acrylic nails, hair color, hair gel, nail polish, conditioners, etc. wholesale.

loans.name: Alicia Esperanza

texts.es: Alicia de 45 años de edad vive en casa propia con su madre y sus dos hijos, ella se dedica a la elaboracion de recuerdos y centros de mesa para todo tipo de fiestas tiene 15 años de dedicarse a esa actividad de la cual a podido salir adelante con su familia, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de materiales como: papel fomi, brillantinas, moldes para figuras, entre otras cosas y asi poder continuar con su trabao que le genera buenos ingresos economicos.
texts.en:
Alicia, 45, lives in her own house with her mother and two children. She makes favors and party decorations and has been in business for 15 years, being able to support her family this way.

She is requesting a loan to buy supplies such as construction paper, glitter, figure molds and other items to continue her work which generates a good income.

loans.use: to buy construction paper, glitter, figure molds, and other items.

loans.name: Carmen Marlene

texts.es: Carmen de 49 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa para damas y caballeros su negocio lo tiene ubicado en el mercado municipal desde hace 20 años tiene mucha clientela por la variedad de ropa que comercializa con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas ropa por mayor para poder continuar con sus ventas y tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en:
Carmen, 49, lives in her own house with family. For 20 years she has been selling women's and men's clothing at the municipal market where she has many customers because of the variety she sells. With her earnings she is able to cover some of the household expenses.

She is requesting a loan to buy more clothing wholesale to continue her sales activity and earn more income.

loans.use: to buy clothing wholesale.

loans.name: Elmer Antonio

texts.es: Elmer de 30 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, el posee un taller de reparacion, compra y venta de aparatos electronicas inicio hace 12 años con capital propio y su taller esta ubicado en su lugar de residencia tiene muchos clientes por su buen trabajo, el esta solicitando un credito para la compra de herramientas para su taller como taladros, pulidoras, repuestos entre otras cosas y asi poder continuar con su trabajo que le genera buenas ganancias.
texts.en: Elmer is 30-years old and lives in his own home with his family. He owns a repair shop which he started 12 years ago with his own money, buying and selling electronic appliances. His shop is located in his home and he has many customers due to his good work. He is asking for a loan to buy tools for his shop such as drills, polishers, parts and other things. This way he can continue with his job that gets him a good income.

loans.use: to buy tools for his shop such as drills, polishers, parts and other things.

loans.name: Jose Secundino

texts.es: Jose de 56 años de edad se dedica desde hace 21 años a la agricultura siembra maíz y hortalizas, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, vive con su esposa y sus cuatro hijos en casa propia, Jose está solicitando nuevamente un crédito para la compra de mas semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. para poder continuar con su trabajo y tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en: Jose is 56-years old and has worked for 21 years in agriculture, planting corn and vegetables. He sells his products in the different markets found close to his house. He lives with his wife and four children in his own home. Jose is asking for a new loan to buy more seeds, fertilizer, manure, pest control, etc. to be able to continue with his work and have a better income.

loans.use: to buy more seeds, fertilizer, manure, pest control, etc.

loans.name: Elías Francisco

texts.es: Elías es un microempresario habitante de San Jacinto un municipio del departamento de Bolívar en donde funciona su negocio de venta de refrescos y cervezas, actividad que inició en el año 2000, motivado por generar recursos para el sostenimiento de su numerosa familia; su cónyuge y diez hijos. Él consideró que en las cercanías del lugar no existía un establecimiento que comercializara estos productos y emprendió su negocio con un enfriador y canastas surtidas de bebidas entre ellas gaseosas, maltas, jugos naturales, agua y cervezas. Sus compras las realiza en depósitos del municipio y cancela inmediatamente recibe la mercancía.  Para Elías es importante mantener una buena variedad de productos es por ello que para incrementar sus inventarios y aprovechar mejores precios, realizó una solicitud de crédito, su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para comprar canastas de cervezas y gaseosas, de este modo sus clientes podrán encontrar todo tipo de bebidas bien frías y servir su paladar.   A futuro Elías se proyecta como propietario de un kiosco muy bien surtido y en lo personal con mejores condiciones de habitabilidad.
texts.en:
Elías is a small-businessman and resident of San Jacinto, a town in the department of Bolívar. This is where he does his business selling soft drinks and beer, a job that he started in the year 2000, motivated by getting an income to support his large family--his partner and ten children. He took into account that in the outskirts of the area there wasn't an establishment that commercialized these products and he started his business with a cooler and baskets stocked with drinks, including soft drinks, malts, juices, water and beer.

He does his purchases in the town stores and immediately pays them off when he receives the merchandise. For Elías, it is important to keep a good variety of products. For that reason, in order to increase his inventory and take advantage of better prices, he is asking for his first CrediKiva loan through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation to buy baskets of beer and soft drink. This way, his customers will be able to find all types of good cold drinks that serve their palate.

In the future, Elías sees himself as the owner of a well-supplied kiosk, and to personally have better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy baskets of beer and soft drink.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: Carlos de 47 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus cuatro hijos, el se dedica desde hace mas de 15 años a la agricultura a la siembra de maiz, comercializa sus prodcutos en los pueblos aledaños y con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el esta solicitando un credito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía para poder continuar con su trabajo y tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Carlos is 47-years old and lives in his own home with his wife and four children. He has worked for more than 15 years in agriculture, growing corn. He sells his products in the nearby towns and with the earnings that he gets from his sales, he manages to resolve some household expenses. He is asking for a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, manure, pest control, etc. and improve the land that is shown in the photo, to be able to continue with his work and have a better income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, manure, pest control, etc. and improve the land.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es: Maria de 35 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida, sus dos hijos y su nuera, ella se dedica desde hace 15 años a la elaboración y venta de tortillas, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de maíz por quintales y cal para poder continuar con la elaboración de las tortillas y así poder tener mejores ingresos para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Maria is 35-years old and lives in her own home with her husband, her two children and her daughter-in-law. She has worked for 15 years making and selling tortillas. Her business is located in her home and she has a lot of customers. She is asking for a loan to buy quintals of corn and lime to be able to continue making tortillas and thus be able to have a better income to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy quintals of corn and lime.

loans.name: Maria Alicia

texts.es:
María Alicia con 24 años de edad ,de estado civil conviviente,vive en casa propia,junto a su cónyuge y su hijo,en el distrito de Oyotún,provincia de Chiclayo,departamento de Lambayeque,país Perú, en una zona rural. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

María Alicia se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte en su mototaxi, con una experiencia en el rubro hace 01 año,su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio. Solicita préstamo para invertir en activo fijo,para el mantenimiento de su moto,para poder brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.

María Alicia es socio recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
María Alicia is 24-years old. She has a partner and lives in her own home with her partner and her son, in the district of Oyotún, Chiclayo province and department of Lambayeque, in Peru. It is a rural area and the people who live here mainly work in agriculture, business and livestock.

María Alicia loans her services in motorcycle taxi transportation and has one year of experience. Her business is located in her home. She is asking for a loan to invest in fixed assets, for the maintenance of her motorcycle in order to give her customers a better service.

María Alicia is a recurring member of Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to invest in fixed assets, for the maintenance of her motorcycle in order to give her customers a better service.

loans.name: Yenifer Del Carmen

texts.es: Yenifer es una ama de casa que emprendió su negocio motivada por generar ingresos y aportar a la economía de su hogar. Ella asistió a una charla, invitada por una consultora de ventas por catálogos y quedo convencida que esta actividad la podría ejercer sin descuidar sus roles, así que tan pronto como pudo se inscribió y empezó a promover ventas entre sus amigos y conocidos.  Ella reside en Cartagena de Indias en compañía de su cónyuge y su única hija de 10 años de edad, y desde que se encuentra ejerciendo esta labor comercial la calidad de vida de su familia es mucho mejor, es por ello que se encuentra muy comprometida con este negocio y diariamente coordina con sus clientes citas o simplemente deja el catalogo en sus viviendas para que escojan la referencia que se ajuste a sus necesidades y tan pronto como reúne la meta de ventas solicita el pedido.  Los principales productos que comercializa son ropa interior, sin embargo cuenta con una gran participación la ropa exterior y accesorios. En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para responder a los encargos de sus clientes; blusas, vestidos, brasieres, pantys entre otros. Esta inversión permitirá aumentar sus ventas y a futuro desea incorporarse a nuevos catálogos que complementen su oferta.  Yenifer desea culminar sus estudios técnicos y  continuar trabajando para que su hija acceda estudios de calidad.
texts.en:
Yenifer is a housewife who started her business motivated by getting an income and contributing to the economy of her house. She attended a chat, invited by a catalog sales consultant and was left convinced that she could do this job without neglecting her roles. She lives in Cartagena de Indias with her partner and her 10-year old daughter. Since she has been doing this business job, her family's quality of life is much better. For that reason, she is very dedicated to this business and coordinates meetings with her customers every day, or simply leaves them a catalog in their homes so that they can choose the things that fit their needs. As soon as she meets the sales target, she places the order.

The main product that she sells is underwear, however she has a good crowd for other clothing and accessories. Currently, she is applying for her first CrediKiva through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation to respond to her customer's orders with blouses, dresses, bras, panties and more. This investment will allow her to increase her sales and in the future she wants to incorporate new catalogs that complement her offers. Yenifer wants to finish her technical schooling and to continue working so that her daughter can access quality schooling.

loans.use: to respond to her customer's orders with blouses, dresses, bras, panties and more.

loans.name: Ana Luz

texts.es: Doña Ana de 50 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hija, ella posee una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace 15 años, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos, ella quiere mejorar su vivienda poniendo puertas de balcon, pero como no posee de suficiente capital esta solicitando un credito para la compra de puertas, balcones y pago de mano de obra y asi poder tener una vivienda mas segura.
texts.en: Ana, 50 years old, lives in her own house with her daughter. She has owned a small shop located in her place of residence for 15 years. From that which she obtains from her sales, she manages to pay some bills. She wishes to improve her home installing balcony doors but since she does not have enough capital she is requesting a loan to buy doors, balconies and pay for the labor and thus be able to have a more secure home.

loans.use: to buy doors, balconies and to pay laborers.

loans.name: El Que Persevera Alcanza Group

texts.es:
Grupo ¨El que persevera alcanza¨, es un grupo mixto constituido por 2 mujeres y 1 hombre. Coordinado por Ana, de 50 años, quien tiene 1 hijos de la edad 22 años a su responsabilidad. Solicita el crédito para seguir aumentando sus productos y así mejoraran sus ventas, ella se dedica a las ventas de  frutas y verduras desde hace muchos  años con la ayuda de su esposo. Con el crédito comprara en grandes cantidades frutas como papaya, cálala y pipián, para luego comercializarlas al detalle.
Los otros miembros son Darvin, de 23 años, se dedican a la venta de frutas y verduras  de manera ambulante en la comunidad. E Irsia, de 22 años se dedica a la preparación y venta de comida fritanguera como pollo, tajada con queso y tortas. Para cada gusto su clientela.
texts.en:
The "He who perseveres, achieves" Group is a mixed group made up of two women and one man. It is coordinated by Ana, 50, who is responsible for a 22 year old son. She is requesting the loan to keep expanding her products and thus improve her sales. She has been dedicated to selling fruits and vegetables for many years with the help of her husband. With the loan, she will buy fruits like papaya, passion fruit and squash in bulk to then sell for profit.

The other members are Darvin, 23, who sells fruits and vegetables on foot in the community and Irsia, 22, who is dedicated to preparing and selling fried food like chicken, "Tajada con queso" (fried plantains with cheese) and cakes for her customers' every taste.

loans.use: to buy fruits like papaya, passion fruit and squash in bulk.

loans.name: Ayaovi

texts.fr: Mariée, Ayaovi est une femme âgée de 51 ans qui vit avec ses trois enfants à charge à Adidogomè. Pour vivre et venir en aide aux besoins de ses enfants, Ayaovi est une revendeuse du bois de tecks qui s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché et le revend au bord des rail puis réalise une bonne marge bénéficiaire grâce ce commerce. Ayaovi désire ce crédit pour commander des unités de bois de tecks petits et moyens en vue de bien revendre afin de maximiser son profit et aider son mari à bien s’occuper de leurs enfants et favoriser ainsi leur éducation scolaire.
texts.en:
Ayaovi is a 51-year-old married woman who lives with her 3 dependent children in Adidogomè. In order to earn a living and support her children, Ayaovi sells teak wood which she gets once a month at the market. She resells it near the tracks and her business makes a good profit margin.

Ayaovi would like this loan so that she can order some small and medium-sized teak logs for resale, in order to maximise her profit margin and support her husband with the care of their children and ensure that they get a good education.

loans.use: to buy 50 small and 65 medium-sized teak logs.

loans.name: Las Maravillas Cofradía Group

texts.es: ¨Las Maravillas Cofradía¨, es un grupo solidario, laborioso y proveniente de un área rural. Estas 3 mujeres emprendedoras solicitan han demostrado ser personas capaces y cumplidas con sus metas y deberes. Ahora solicitan  a ADIM y a los socios de Kiva financiamientos para sus negocios. Coordinado Juana, de 32 años, soltera y con un hijo, tiene su pequeño negocio de preparación y venta de comidas como enchiladas, tacos y carnes asadas. El crédito lo desea para la compra de arroz, aceite, leña, frijol, pollo, carne y carbón. Las demás integrantes son Deyanira, 24 años vende cosméticos y bisuterías de manera ambulante. Yaimi de 30 años, a la preparación y venta de comida.
texts.en: ¨Las Maravillas Cofradía¨ is a hard-working, united group coming from a rural area. These three enterprising women have shown themselves to be capable and accomplished people with goals and duties. Now they are requesting from ADIM and the members of Kiva loans for their businesses. Coordinator Juana, 32, is single and has one child. She has a small business preparing and selling food like enchiladas, tacos and roasted meats. She wants the loan to buy rice, oil, wood, beans, chicken, meat and coal. The other members are Deyanira, 24, who sells cosmetics and costume jewelry on foot and Yami, 30, who prepares and sells food.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, wood, beans, chicken, meat and coal.

loans.name: Talula Group

texts.es:
La coordinadora del grupo ¨Talula¨, es Soraya, ella es una mujer casada, emprendedora, trabaja con los préstamos de ADIM. Es un ejemplo de lucha para muchas personas, a sus 33 años, ella se dedica a la preparación y venta de sopas en los días de mayor demanda por parte de su clientela. Con el crédito requiere para la compra de carne mondongo, leña, verduras, arroz y otros ingredientes básicos para la preparación de calidad. 
Las otras socias son Maria de 52 años, tiene su pequeño taller de costura y ofrece servicios de taxi; y Jeysi de 46 años se dedica a la venta de pan, café, fresco, frijoles cocidos
texts.en:
The coordinator of the "Talula" group is Soraya. She is a married, enterprising woman who works with the ADIM loans. She is an example of hard work for many people at 33 years of age. She is dedicated to preparing and selling soups on the days of greater demand on the part of her customers. She needs the loan to buy tripe, wood, vegetables, rice and other basic ingredients for the preparation of quality.

The other members are Maria, 52, who has a small seamstress shop and offers taxi services and Jeysi, 46, who is dedicated to selling bread, coffee, cooked beans and refreshments.

loans.use: to buy beef tripe, wood, vegetables, rice and other basic ingredients for the preparation of quality.

loans.name: Jumaboy

texts.ru: Чумабой 35 летный мужчина аз района Бохтар. Он женат и отец троих детей. Детям 2, 4 и 7 лет. У него 2 сыночек и одна дочка. Чумабой спокойный, энергичный и трудолюбивый отец. Он занимается земледелием на районе. Чумабой начал работать на земле 11 лет назад. Он еще свободное время занимается перевозом товаров. У него имеется грузовой мотоцикл марки "MOTOROLA", на ней Чумабой перевозить товар клиентов. Чумабой каждый год во время осеню, делает парник и в нем выращивает растение. Он хочет купить кленку для парника и минеральные удобрение для обработки земли.  Чумабой по этой причине спрашивает кредит. Чумабой верит в Вас и на Вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Jumaboy is a 35-year-old man from the Bohtar region. He is married and has three children aged two, four and seven, two sons and one daughter. He is a peaceful, energetic and hardworking father who works in agriculture, a trade he began 11 years ago. He also works transporting goods in his free time. He has a "Motorola" brand cargo motorcycle with which he transports customers' goods.

Every year in the fall, Jumaboy makes a greenhouse to grow plants in. He wants to buy plastic film for his greenhouse and fertilizer to amend the soil. For this reason he is looking for a loan. He trusts in you and your kindness.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizer and plastic film for his greenhouse

loans.name: Sokhna's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 20 membres fait partie du banc villageois qui a été crée en décembre 2012. Il est constitué de femmes du même village et des environs. Elles ont de bonnes relations et s’activent dans le commerce, l’agriculture et l’embouche. Une bonne ambiance anime les réunions de groupe.
MAIMOUNA  debout à droite de la photo et levant la main gauche est l’emprunteuse vedette, elle  est âgée de 31 ans. Elle est mariée et mère d’une fille et de 3 garçons. Elle s’active dans le commerce de jus.
Avec le prêt reçu, elle va acheter 1 sac de sucre à 25 000 FCFA,  3 bassines de pain de singe  l’unité à 5 000 FCFA.  Elle achète du sucre vanille, des fraises pour un montant de 2500 FCFA. Elle achète aussi de l’oseille 3 bassines l’unité à 7500 FCFA.  Après transformation, elle achète des sachets pour un montant de 5 000 FCFA pour y mettre le jus et le revendre.
Les bénéfices vont servir à rembourser son prêt mais aussi aider son mari dans les charges familiales en assurant la scolarité des enfants.
texts.en:
This group of 20 people is a part of the "banc villageois" created in December of 2012. It is made up of women who come from the same village and the surrounding area. They get along well and work in retail, farming and livestock-fattening. Group meetings benefit from a good atmosphere.

Maimouna, standing on the right of the picture and raising her hand, is the featured borrower. She is 31 years old, married and the mother of one girl and three boys. She sells juice.

She will use her loan to buy one bag of sugar (at 25 000 francs), 3 baskets of monkey bread (at 5 000 francs per basket), and 2 500 francs worth of vanilla sugar and strawberries. She will also buy 3 baskets of sorrel (at 7 500 francs per basket). When she has made the juice, she will buy 5 000 francs worth of small bags to put the juice in for resale.

Her profits will go towards repaying her loan and supporting her husband with the family expenses by ensuring that their children get a good education.

loans.use: to buy monkey bread, sugar, vanilla sugar, strawberries, and sorrel.

loans.name: Flor De Dalia Group

texts.es:
El grupo "Flor de Dalias" esta coordinado por Yadira, 54 años,  unida y con un hijos. Se dedica a la producción y venta de nacatamales,  de manera ambulante en el sector. Tiene 12 años de experiencia en el negocio, y su esposo le ayuda en la producción, con el crédito invertirá en la compra cerdos, maíz y leña.  Ahora tiene pensando seguir incrementando su producción y así seguir brindándoles a sus hijos mejoras económicas.
Las demás integrantes son  Isaura, de 23 años, dedicada a la venta de ropa y ofrece brazziers, blusas, sabanas de manera ambulante. Jeraldina, 24 años a la venta de ropa y a la venta de otros productos como golosinas, meneítos y galletas
texts.en:
The "Flor de Dalias" group is coordinated by Yadira, who is 54, married and a mother. She makes and sells nacatamales as a street vendor in the area. She has 12 years' experience in the business and her husband helps her with production. She will invest the loan in buying pigs, corn and firewood. Now she is planning on continuing to increase production and thus offer her children financial improvement.

Isaura is 23. She sells clothes and offers bras, blouses, and sheets as a street vendor. Jeraldina is 24 and she sells clothes and other products such as snacks and cookies.

loans.use: to buy pigs, corn and firewood.

loans.name: Maira De Los Santos

texts.es: Maira de 45 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus tres hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de mariscos (cocteles de conchas y camarones) desde hace mas de 12 años vende de manera ambulante por las diferentes colonias y ya tiene muchos clientes, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunso gastos de su hogar, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas mariscos por mayor para poder continuar con sus ventas que le generan buenas ganancias.
texts.en: Maira, 45, lives in her own house with her three children. She has been dedicated to selling seafood (cocktails of shells and shrimp) for more than 12 years. She sells on foot through the different neighborhoods and already has a lot of customers. With the earnings she obtains, she manages to pay some household expenses. She is requesting a loan to buy more seafood at wholesale to be able to continue with the sales that generate good income for her.

loans.use: to buy seafood at wholesale.

loans.name: Bikamo

texts.ru:
Бикамо жизнерадостная и трудолюбивая женщина. Она замужем и имеет троих детей. Живёт она в небольшом сельском посёлке. Бикамо работает в архиве. Её муж работает в хлопковом заводе. У неё очень дружная семья. 
Для того, чтобы иметь дополнительный доход на пропитание Бикамо вместе со своим мужем начали свой бизнес. Они занимаются животноводством. Бикамо выращивает скот, затем продаёт полученное от скота мясо и молоко. От этого бизнеса Бикамо получает небольшой доход.  Их совместного дохода хватает на проживание среднего уровня. И пока у них недостаточно средств, чтобы покрывать все имеющиеся нужды. В данный момент Бикамо с мужем хотят купить ещё несколько голов скота для откармливания, но у неё не хватает собственных среств. Поэтому она обратилась в Арванд и хочет взять кредит на покупку скота. Бикамо заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку, вследствие которой  улучшится качество жизни её семьи.
texts.en:
Bikamo is a cheerful and hard-working woman. She is married and has three children. She lives in a small rural village. Bikamo works in an archive. Her husband works in a cotton factory. She has a very close family.

In order to have additional income for food, Bikamo and her husband started their own business. They rear animals. Bikamo raises cattle, then sells the meat and milk that she gets from them. Bikamo receives a good income from this business. Their combined income suffices to live at an average level, though they do not have enough funds to cover all their needs. 

At the present time Bikamo and her husband want to buy a few more head of cattle for fattening, but she doesn't have the necessary money. For this reason she has applied to Arvand and wants to take out a loan to buy some cattle. Bikamo thanks Arvand in advance for its support as a result of which her family's quality of life will improve.

loans.use: to buy some cattle.

loans.name: Blanca Telma

texts.es: Doña Blanca de 57 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hijo, ella posee un comedor y venta de pupusas ubicado en su lugar de residencia y con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella quiere mejorar su vivienda construyendo un muro perimetral en el lugar que muestra la fotografia pero como no posee de suficiente capital esta solicitando un credito para la compra de todos los materiales de construccion necesarios y asi poder tener una vivienda mas segura.
texts.en: Blanca, at 57 years old, lives in her own house with her son. She has a dining room and sells pupusas from her residence and with the money she makes, she is able to pay some of her home expenses. She wants to better her residence by building a wall around the perimeter in the place shown in the picture. However, since she doesn't have enough capital, she is asking for this loan to buy the construction materials she needs so she can have a safer home.

loans.use: to buy necessary construction materials.

loans.name: Diouma's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 2 membres fait partie du banc villageois qui a été crée en 2014. Il est constitué de femmes du même village et des environs. Elles ont de bonnes relations et s’activent dans le commerce, l’agriculture et l'embouche. Une bonne ambiance anime les réunions de groupe
DIOUMA  debout à droite de la photo et levant la main gauche est l’emprunteuse vedette, elle  est âgée de 58 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 4 filles et de 4 garçons. Elle s’active dans l’embouche.
Avec le prêt reçu, elle va acheter deux  bœufs à 150 000 FCFA l’unité, et les revendre après élevage au bout de 4 mois à 250 000 FCFA l’un. Avec le reste de l’argent, elle achète de l’aliment de bétail.
Les bénéfices serviront  à solder son prêt mais aussi à épargner d’une part, et d’autre part à répondre aux dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
This group of two people is part of the "banc villageois" which was created in 2014. It is made up of women who come from the same village and the surrounding area. They get along well and work in retail, farming and livestock-fattening. The group meetings benefit from a good atmosphere.

Diouma, standing on the right of the picture and raising her left hand, is the featured borrower. She is 58 years old, married and the mother of four girls and four boys. She practices livestock-fattening.

She will use her loan to buy 2 head of cattle (at 150 000 francs per head) and resell them for 250 000 francs each after she has fattened them for 4 months. She will use the rest of the loan to buy cattle feed.

The profits will be used in part to pay off her loan and build her savings, and in part to cover the family's daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy 2 head of cattle.

loans.name: Las Tres Cruces Group

texts.es:
En una comunidad pintoresca del Estado de México se integró un grupo llamado Las Tres Cruces, sus integrantes decidieron dicho nombre ya que en su comunidad se ubican tres cruces que dan identidad a los habitantes. Estas representaciones son celebradas el mes de mayo, especialmente por las personas que se dedican a la construcción ya que encomiendan su actividad a este símbolo religioso. 
  Marisol es una persona muy trabajadora, su carácter jovial la hace una de las integrantes más alegres y entusiastas del grupo. Sus dos hijos, quienes estudian la educación primaria, son la motivación que la ha llevado a emprender una actividad productiva. 
   Sol, como le dicen de cariño, tiene 6 años dedicados a la compra y venta de ropa; la idea surgió al percatarse que las personas de su comunidad necesitaban una manera accesible de adquirir las prendas. “Mi mamá fue parte fundamental para iniciar con este negocio ya que ella adquiere la mercancía a un precio más accesible y yo la ofrezco en la comunidad obteniendo buenas ganancias" comentó. Una de las razones por la cual su actividad se ha enriquecido es el plazo que ofrece a sus clientes para que puedan pagar la ropa; que va desde dos pagos hasta cuatro. Una vez que adquiere los fondos necesarios reinvierte en el negocio y aumenta la cantidad de mercancía para tener variedad y calidad.
   Por otro lado, se encuentra muy contenta con los beneficios que VFMéxico ofrece pues comprará chamarras, pantalones, sudaderas, polos, bufandas y especialmente prendas para el frío debido a la temporada venidera. Su meta actual es enriquecer su negocio al grado de poder abrir un local al que todos puedan reconocer dentro de su comunidad.
   Las demás integrantes del grupo son Martina, Carolina y Erika quienes invertirán en materiales para realizar bordados artesanales.
*La fotografía fue tomada en el lugar donde se reúnen, Sol es quien viste una sudadera negra; también se pueden observar algunos bordados de Doña Martina.
texts.en:
The group called Las Tres Cruces ["The Three Crosses"] is found in a picturesque community in the State of México. The members decided on this name because there are three crosses located in their community that give identity to the inhabitants. These symbols are celebrated in the month of May, especially by the people who make a living in construction since they dedicate their work to this religious symbol.

Marisol is a very hardworking person. Her jovial personality makes her one of the most joyful and enthusiastic members of the group. Her two children, who attend primary school, are the motivation that prompted her to launch a productive business.

Sol, as she is called with affection, has been buying and selling clothes for six years. Her idea arose when she realized that the people in her community needed an affordable way to buy clothing. "My mamá was a fundamental part of starting this business since she buys the merchandise at a more affordable price and I offer it in the community and make a good profit," she comments. One of the reasons that her business has been profitable is that she allows her customers to pay in installments, in anywhere from two to four payments. Once she earns the necessary funds, she reinvests in the business and increases the amount of merchandise so that she can offer variety and quality.

In addition, Sol is very happy with the benefits that VisionFund México offers since she can buy jackets, pants, sweatshirts, t-shirts, scarves, and especially clothing for upcoming cold season. Her current goal is to grow her business to the point that she will be able to open a store where everyone in her community can come to shop.

The rest of the members of the group are Martina, Carolina, and Erika, who will buy materials to make handcrafted embroideries.

*The photograph was taken where the group meets. Sol is wearing the black sweatshirt. Some of Martina's embroideries can also be seen.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

location.town: Guadalupe Cote, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Amy Diop's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 21 membres fait partie du banc villageois qui a été crée en février 2014. Il est constitué de femmes du même village et des environs. Elles ont de bonnes relations et s’activent dans le commerce, l’agriculture et l'embouche. Une bonne ambiance anime les réunions de groupe.
KHADY  debout à droite de la photo et levant la main gauche est l’emprunteuse vedette, elle  est âgée de 26 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 3 filles et d'un garçon. Elle s’active dans le commerce d'encens et de foulards.
Avec le prêt reçu, elle va acheter 1 seau d'encens à 20 000 FCFA et le revendre à 27500 FCFA. Elle achète 2 douzaines de foulards à 8 000 FCFA la douzaine et la revend à 12 000 FCFA. Elle paye 1 000 FCFA pour le transport des marchandises. Le reste du prêt constitue son fond de roulement. Le cycle de l'activité est trimestriel.
Les bénéfices serviront à  satisfaire les besoins personnels et familiaux d'une part, et d'autre part à épargner et à rembourser son prêt.
texts.en:
This group of 21 people is part of the "banc villageois" which was created in February of 2014. It is made up of women who come from the same village and the surrounding area. They get along well and work in retail, farming and livestock-fattening. Group meetings benefit from a good atmosphere.

Khady, standing on the right of the picture and raising her left hand, is the featured borrower. She is 26 years old, married and the mother of three girls and one boy. She sells incense and scarves.

She will use her loan to buy 20 000 francs (1 bucket's) worth of incense which she will resell for 27 500 francs. She will buy 2 dozen scarves (at 8 000 francs a dozen) and resell them for 12 000 francs. She also has to pay 1 000 francs to transport her merchandise. The rest of the loan will be added to her working capital. She has a quarterly business cycle.

The profits will be used in part to cover her personal needs and those of her family, and in part to repay her loan and build her savings.

loans.use: to buy incense and scarves.

loans.name: Diarra's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 22 membres fait partie du banc villageois qui a été crée en février 2014. Il est constitué de femmes du même village et des environs. Elles ont de bonnes relations et s’activent principalement dans le commerce, l’agriculture et l'embouche. Une bonne ambiance anime les réunions de groupe.
SOKHNA debout à droite de la photo et levant la main gauche est l’emprunteuse vedette, elle  est âgée de 29 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 3 filles et 3 garçons. Elle s’active dans le commerce.
Avec le prêt reçu, elle va acheter des tissus pour une valeur de 50 000 FCFA et a un bénéfice de 20 000 FCFA après la vente. Elle achète aussi de l'encens pour 20 000 FCFA et le revend à 40 000 FCFA. Elle achète des parfums pour 15 000 FCFA et les revend à 35 000 FCFA. Elle achète enfin du lait de corps pour une valeur de 20 000 FCFA et a un bénéfice de 20 000 FCFA après écoulement. Elle paye 3 000 FCFA pour le transport des marchandises et le reste du prêt constitue son fond de roulement.
Les bénéfices serviront à rembourser son prêt, épargner et aussi répondre aux charges familiales.
texts.en:
This group of 22 people is part of the "banc villageois" which was created in February of 2014. It is made up of women who come from the same village and the surrounding area. They get along well and work principally in retail, farming and livestock-fattening. Group meetings benefit from a good atmosphere.

Sokhna, standing on the right of the picture and raising her left hand, is the featured borrower. She is 29 years old, married and the mother of three girls and three boys. She is a retailer.

She will use the loan she receives to buy 50 000 francs worth of fabrics, which should earn a 20 000 franc profit when she sells them. She will also buy 20 000 francs worth of incense which she will resell for 40 000 francs. She will buy 15 000 francs worth of perfumes and resell them for 35 000 francs. Finally, she will buy 20 000 francs worth of body lotion which should make a 20 000 franc profit when it is sold. She also has to pay 3 000 francs to transport her merchandise, and she will add the rest of her loan to her working capital.

The profits will be used to repay her loan, build her savings, and cover her family's expenses.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, incense, perfumes, and body lotions.

loans.name: Fiorella Group

texts.es:
En “La novia del sol”, comunidad ubicada en el estado de Veracruz, nueve personas comparten un mismo objetivo: brindarle las mejores oportunidades a su familia. Para lograr dicho propósito integraron un grupo llamado Fiorella con el cual solicitan el apoyo de VFMéxico para enriquecer sus actividades.
   Actualmente el grupo está integrado por: Yesica, Gustavo y Teresita quienes venden comida; Yuliana, ropa y zapatos; Gloria y Johanna, ropa; Elda, ropa y bolsos; Eva, pan y Luis, repostería. 
   Gustavo es mejor conocido como Tavo por todos sus amigos, junto con su esposa Liz procrearon una pequeña a quien llaman bebé Mari Jo y que es su motor de vida. Desde hace dos años la pareja abrió una fonda mexicana donde atienden a sus clientes de manera amable, cuentan, además, con excelentes precios, entrega a domicilio y un sazón inigualable en los platillos. Hoy en día Tavo brinda empleo a dos personas más, así mientras él realiza las compras y entregas a domicilio, su esposa toma las ordenes y las empleadas elaboran la comida.
   Como cualquier negocio, ha sufrido altibajos desde el inicio sin embargo los dos últimos años ha logrado el éxito esperado y desea continuar hasta alcanzar sus metas. Espera ampliar la fonda e incorporar la venta de comida rápida, no obstante, su objetivo principal es abrir un restaurante para forjar así un patrimonio familiar. Sabe que con base en el trabajo, la dedicación y el esfuerzo podrá sortear cualquier obstáculo que se le presente. ”Me apasiono mucho, ayudo a las empleadas con la preparación de la comida, las salsas o el agua de frutas” expresó muy contento.
   El préstamo que ha solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de carne, queso, masa, tortillas, verduras, aceite y gas ya que quiere satisfacer el paladar de cualquier cliente, por exigente que éste sea.
*La fotografía fue tomada en “La novia del sol”, Tavo viste playera azul y se encuentra cargando a su pequeña hija; los demás niños en la fotografía son sus sobrinos, hijos de otros integrantes del grupo.
texts.en:
In "La novia del sol", a community located in the state of Veracruz, nine people share the same objective: to provide the best opportunities to their families. To achieve said goal, they joined a group named "Fiorella" with which they are requesting support from VFMexico to enrich their work.

Currently, the group is made up of Yesica, Gustavo and Teresita who sell food; Yuliana, clothing and shoes; Gloria and Johanna, clothing; Elda, clothing and bags; Eva, bread and Luis, cakes.

Gustavo is better known as Tavo by all of his friends. Along with his wife, Liz, he has a small daughter who they named baby Mari Jo and who drives his life. Two years ago, the couple opened a Mexican inn where they tend to customers in a friendly way. They also have excellent prices, home delivery and dishes of unparalleled flavor. Today, Tavo provides employment to two more people. While he makes the purchases and home deliveries, his wife takes the orders and the employees make the food.

Like any business, it has suffered ups and downs since the beginning. Nevertheless, the last two years have seen the success he hoped for and he wishes to continue until he achieves more goals. He hopes to expand the inn and incorporate selling fast food. Still, his main objective is opening a restaurant to forge a family legacy. He knows that with a foundation of work, dedication and effort, he will be able to overcome any obstacle in his way. "I am passionate about a lot. I help my employees preparing the food, the salsas or the fruit juices," he said very happily.

The loan that he has requested will be invested in the purchase of meat, cheese, corn flour, tortillas, vegetables, oil and gas since he wants to satisfy the palate of any customer, demanding though it may be.

*The photograph was taken in "La novia del sol". Tavo is dressed in the blue T-shirt and can be seen holding his small daughter. The other children in the photo are his nephews, children of other members of the group.

loans.use: to buy meat, cheese, corn flour, tortillas, vegetables, oil and gas.

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie works hard to support her family. Rosie is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Rosie requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store. Rosie has been in this business for 17 years now. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Rosie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana es habitante del municipio de Cartagena y es una empresaria independiente de 36 años de edad que con su propio esfuerzo y dedicación, logró captar un pequeño capital a través de la venta de postres elaborados por sus propias manos.  Esta ama de casa es un claro ejemplo de que con escasos recursos se puede entablar un negocio y que poco a poco se puede llegar a donde se quiere y su propósito era vender artículos que le garantizaran un mayor ingreso y tan pronto como pudo invertir su capital en prendas de vestir, calzado e imitaciones de fragancias no lo dudó ni un instante. Hoy en día trabaja en conjunto con su cónyuge, ellos promueven ventas a empleados de empresas del municipio y gracias a su buen servicio y productos de calidad cuentan con el respaldo de su clientela quienes les recomiendan a muchas más personas.  Juana desea viajar a Medellín la capital de la moda en Colombia para poder comprar prendas de vestir y calzado a la vanguardia con precios de oportunidad, para ello realizó una solicitud de crédito, su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo con lo que financiará este proyecto. A futuro Juana se proyecta comercializando más variedad de productos y ampliando su cobertura. Su meta personal es adquirir su vivienda y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Juana is living in the municipality of Cartagena and is an independent businesswomen at 36 years of age. With her own effort and dedication, she was able to obtain some capital thanks to the sale of some homemade desserts. This homemaker is a clear example that even with scarce resources, one can start a business and slowly be able to arrive where he or she wants. Her goal is to sell articles that will guarantee more income and then invest this money in articles of clothing, footwear and imitation fragrances.

As of today, she works together with her spouse, who both have promoted sales to employees of government businesses. Thanks to their good service and product quality, they have the support of their client base who recommend them to many other people. Juana wants to travel to Medellín, the fashion capitol of Colombia, so she can buy more articles of clothing and footwear that are cutting edge with good prices. For this reason she is asking for this loan, her first Kiva loan via the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, with which she will finance this project. In the future Juana plans to market a greater variety of products and increasing her range. Her personal goal is to acquire her house and better her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy articles of clothing and footwear.

loans.name: Samaila Nigger

texts.en:
Samaila is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Samaila is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

Traditionally, Samaila would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs, such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Samaila will store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a date later in the season when he can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price.

With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Samaila now has the opportunity to actualize his dream to grow his agriculture business for himself and family members and would like to use this additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Rabi

texts.en:
Rabi is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Rabi has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Rabi would have had to sell her maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet her immediate cash needs, such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Rabi can store her maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Rabi will benefit from marketing support that could see her generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Rabi is thankful that she now has the opportunity to improve the life of her children and family and looks forward to using her additional earnings to diversify her farm and grow other crops.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Jose Leonidas

texts.es: Jose de 34 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus tres hijos, el se dedica a la venta de pan frances vende en su moto por las diferentes colonias que se encuentran cerca de su casa desde hace 12 años con las ganancias que realiza de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas pan frances por mayor para continuar con sus ventas y asi tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en: Jose, 34 years old, lives in his own house with his wife and their three children. He has worked for 12 years selling French bread from his motorcycle in the different colonies that are near his house. With the earnings that he gets from his sales, he manages to cover some of the household expenses. He is asking for a loan to purchase more French bread in bulk to continue with his sales and, so, to have better income.

loans.use: to purchase more French bread in bulk.

loans.name: Ndeye's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 22 membres fait partie du banc villageois qui a été crée en février 2014. Il est constitué de femmes du même village et des environs. Elles ont de bonnes relations et s’activent principalement dans le commerce  et l’embouche. Une bonne ambiance anime les réunions de groupe
MARIEME  debout à gauche de la photo et levant la main droite  est l’emprunteuse vedette, elle  est âgée de 41 ans. Elle est mariée et mère De 4 filles et de 2 garçons. Elle s’active dans l’embouche et l’aviculture.
Avec le prêt reçu, elle va acheter une brebis et son agneau à 45 000 FCFA. Elle les élève et les revend au bout de 5 mois à 110 000 FCFA. Elle achète aussi 10 poussins à 600 FCFA l’unité. Avec le reste du prêt, elle achète de l’aliment pour les poussins.
Les bénéfices serviront  à entretenir sa famille notamment les dépenses  quotidiennes.
texts.en:
This group of 22 people is part of a "banc villageois" which was created in February of 2014. It is made up of women who come from the same village and the surrounding area. They get along well and work in retail and livestock-fattening. Group meetings benefit from a good atmosphere.

Marieme, standing on the left of the picture and raising her right hand, is the featured borrower. She is 41 years old, married and the mother of four girls and two boys. She practices livestock-fattening and poultry farming.

She will use the loan she receives to buy a ewe and its lamb for 45 000 francs. She will raise them and resell them after 5 months for 110 000 francs. She will also buy 10 chicks at 600 francs each. She will use the rest of the loan to buy feed for the chicks.

The profits will be used to support her family, notably with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy one ewe and its lamb, and 10 chicks.

loans.name: Walaa

texts.en:
Walaa is a Lebanese married woman. She’s 24 and she lives with her husband and two children who are still in school. Her husband represents the main income source to help her family to meet the needs of life and to be able to enhance their way of living.

Today, she is requesting to borrow a loan from Kiva's partner, Vitas s.a.l., to pay for school supplies and to buy her children books. This is her first loan, and she plans to take more Kiva loans in the future and help them continue their education.

loans.use: to pay for school supplies and to buy her children books.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is a married woman. She has two children. She operates a farm where she sells bananas and cereals. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a fertile area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge as lack of water.

She will use the 30,000 KES loan to buy more farm inputs. Her business goal is to have a large farm within five years. She hopes that in the future she will be successful. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more farm inputs

loans.name: Juan Angel

texts.es:
Juan es un agricultor de 69 años dedicado hace 40 años a la producción de café, ahora Juan produce café con valores agregados como ser sellos de certificación(Comercio Justo, Amigable con los pájaros y Rainforest) y métodos especiales de preparación del café . Juan está casado con Mercedes y tiene de 17 hijos de los cuales 4 están bajo su cargo, El sueña con poder proporcionar todo lo necesario para que sus hijos tengan una vida digna, además sueña con formar un patrimonio familiar para que sus hijos tengan tierras para trabajar.
La producción de café bajo sellos de certificación es una novedad en el rubro del café ya que hace el cultivo más sostenible y ayuda a mejorar enormemente la calidad del café y hace el cultivo amigable con el ambiente, es por esta razón que Juan quiere certificar sus cafetales con el sello de orgánico, la producción orgánica garantiza un mercado especial para el café además de colaborar con el cuido de la rica biodiversidad de la zona. 
Juan está solicitando un crédito para poder llevar a cabo las labores de certificación, con las ganancias obtenidas por el café orgánico vendido en mercados especiales por medio de COCAFCAL de la cual es socio espera poder mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia e incrementar el patrimonio familiar para que sus hijos tengan tierras para trabajar.
Un crédito ayudara a Juan a obtener mejores mercados para su café y a mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia así como también a prepararse para poder brindarle una buena educación a su hija.
texts.en:
Juan is a 60-year-old farmer who has worked for 40 years producing coffee. Now, Juan produces coffee with added value such as certification seals (Fair Trade, Bird Friendly and Rainforest) and special methods of coffee preparation. Juan is married to Mercedes and has 17 children, of whom 4 are in his care. He dreams of being able to provide everything necessary so that his children have a dignified life. In addition, he dreams of creating a family legacy so that his children have land to work.

Coffee production under certification seals is a novelty in the field of coffee and it makes the crop more sustainable and helps improve the quality of the coffee enormously and it makes the crop environmentally friendly. For this reason, Juan wants to certify his coffee crop with the organic seal. Organic coffee guarantees a special market for the coffee in addition to caring for the right biodiversity of the area.

Juan is asking for a loan to be able to carry out the work of certification. With the earnings gotten for the organic coffee sold in special markets through COCAFCAL, of which he is a member, he expects to be able to improve his family's quality of life and increase his family legacy so that his children have land to work.

A loan will help Juan to get better markets for his coffee and to improve his family's quality of life and also to prepare himself to be able to offer his daughter a good education.

loans.use: to purchase organic manure,  coffee plants, and make the conservation barriers necessary to convert to organic production for his coffee plantation.

loans.name: María Del Socorro

texts.es: María es una microempresaria de 52 años de edad que en compañía de su familia reside en un barrio ubicado en Cartagena de Indias y en este municipio comercializa una gran variedad de productos de uso doméstico, personal, alimentos e incluso prendas de vestir, actividad que emprendió luego de haber sido exclusivamente consumidora de varias líneas de productos, promovidos por una amiga que posteriormente la incorporó a esta forma masiva de comercio.  Lo que más le gusta a María de su trabajo es poder continuar con sus labores en el hogar, velar por la crianza de su hijo y el compromiso con su cónyuge sin tener contratiempos puesto que impulsa la oferta de los catálogos en sus tiempos libres. María lleva 17 años en esta actividad y cuenta con una clientela fidelizada a quienes desea siempre ofrecerles un excelente surtido es por ello que está aplicando a una solicitud de crédito, su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para financiar las ventas que genera a crédito y encargos de sus clientes; perfumes, productos de belleza, alimentos y demás. A futuro María se proyecta con mucha más clientela y variedad de productos.  Su principal meta es lograr que su hija sea profesional en la carrera de su preferencia.
texts.en: María is a micro-entrepreneur, 52 years old, who lives with her family in a neighborhood located in Cartagena de Indias and in this municipality she sells a large variety of products for domestic and personal use, food and even clothing, work that she undertook after having been exclusively a consumer of various product lines sold by a friend who later took her into this massive form of sales. What María likes most about her work is being able to continue with her household tasks, watch over raising her daughter and the commitment to her spouse without having setbacks because she promotes her catalog sales in her free time. María has been doing this work for 17 years and has a loyal customer base to whom she always wants to offer an excellent assortment. For this, she is applying for a loan, her first Kiva loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to finance the sales that she generates on credit and by her customers' orders: perfumes, beauty products, food, and more. In the future, María sees herself with many more customers and more variety of products. Her primary goal is to manage to have her daughter become a professional in the career of her choice.

loans.use: to finance the sales that she generates on credit and by her customers' orders: perfumes, beauty products, food, and more.

loans.name: Coral Group

texts.es:
La “prieta linda” es una locomotora de vapor considerada como la primera en recorrer la región, actualmente es símbolo de orgullo para los habitantes ya que impulsó el desarrollo de la comunidad. Lo que anteriormente era sólo una villa ahora es una ciudad que día con día ofrece mayores oportunidades a sus pobladores.
   En una de las colonias de dicha ciudad se formó un grupo llamado Coral cuyos integrantes se esfuerza diariamente para brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. Ellos son: María, Sofía y Nelly quienes venden comida; Vicenta, zapatos; Yari, ropa; Ana, abarrotes; Maribel, comida y ropa; Abigail, zapatos y cosméticos por catálogo y Juana, comida típica. 
   Doña Juana se separó desde hace trece años de su pareja y desde entonces decidió iniciar con la venta de comida típica motivada por la necesidad de ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida a su pequeño hijo. En un inicio vendía en un corredor de su casa donde colocaba dos mesas grandes y un anafre de carbón que le servía para cocinar distintos platillos. No obstante comenta, “en mi casa no vendía lo suficiente por eso decidí irme a un local en el centro de la localidad”. Al día de hoy cuenta con cinco años en dicho espacio y brinda servicio de lunes a sábado desde las 7: 30 y hasta las 17: 00; horario en que sus clientes pueden disfrutar de unas ricas empanadas, gorditas, tacos, plátanos fritos, café, atole o agua.
   Para doña Juana lo más satisfactorio es solventar los gastos de su hogar, la educación de su hijo y haber podido establecer su propio negocio en el cual brinda empleo a una persona más. En tanto al préstamo requerido lo invertirá en la compra de queso media crema, verdura, masa, tortillas, aceite, carne y refresco de diferentes sabores para brindar un excelente servicio. Su nuevo objetivo es abrir otro local o bien ampliar el que tiene para generar más ganancias y empleos para las personas de su comunidad.
*La fotografía fue tomada en  “La novia del sol”, sobre los columpios se encuentran los hijos de las integrantes quienes decidieron el lugar para la foto; Doña Juana es quien viste blusa café con lunares blancos y pantalón azul.
texts.en:
The Prieta Linda is a steam engine considered to be the first to travel in the region. Currently, it is a symbol of pride for the inhabitants since it boosted the development of the community. What had previously been only a villa, now is a city which day by day offers better opportunities to its population.

In one of the colonies of this city, a group called Coral was formed, whose members work hard every day to offer a better quality of life to their families. They are: María, Sofía and Nelly who sell food; Vicenta, shoes; Yari, clothing; Ana, groceries; Maribel, food and clothing; Abigail, shoes and cosmetics from catalogs and Juana, traditional food.

Juana was separated from her partner thirteen years ago and since then decided to begin selling traditional foods, motivated by the need to offer her young son a better quality of life. At the beginning, she sold from an outdoor hallway at her house where she set up two big tables and a charcoal brazier which served her to prepare different dishes. However, she says "I didn't sell enough at my house, so I decided to go to a space in the center of the locality." To date, she has been in this space for 5 years and offers service from Monday to Saturday from 7:30 to 17:00, a schedule in which her customers can enjoy some delicious empanadas, gorditas, tacos, fried plantains, atole or water.

For Juana, the most satisfying is to cover the household expenses, her son's education and to have been able to establish her own business which offers a job to another person. As to the needed loan, she will invest it in the purchase of cream, media crema, vegetables, dough, tortillas, oil, meat and soft drinks of different flavors to offer excellent service. Her new goal is to open another location or to expand the one she has to generate more earnings and jobs for people in her community.

*The photo was taken in "La novia del sol." The children of the members, on the swings, decided where to take the photo. Juana is wearing a brown blouse with white dots and blue pants.

loans.use: to purchase cheese, media crema, vegetables, dough, tortillas, oil, meat and soft drinks.

loans.name: Safiya

texts.en:
Safiya is a 50-year-old, married woman living with her husband and her two children. Some of her children are still studying at the university. Her husband is the main source of income to satisfy the family's needs and live in a good lifestyle. As for her, she is dedicated only to her family. 

Today, in order to pay her daughter’s university fees, she is applying for a new loan. She said that she is very happy and satisfied as she is able to pay the fees and help her daughter continue her education.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter’s university fees

loans.name: Caramelos Group

texts.es:
Durante el recorrido en terracería hacia cierta comunidad oaxaqueña se pueden apreciar sembradíos de caña de azúcar, frijol y maíz además de árboles de roble y de mango.  Si se observan con detenimiento  las grandes extensiones de siembra de caña se puede percatar de las mangueras de riego las cuales, al estar enrolladas, parecen caracoles gigantes.
   En dicha comunidad existe un grupo llamado Caramelos, nombrado así ya que la mayoría de sus integrantes saben elaborar dulces típicos del país; actualmente el grupo lo integran: Laura quien vende tacos; Marisela, dulces típicos, calzado, cosméticos y tamales; Eustorgia, pollo, dulces y refresco; Ana, zapato por catálogo; Dulce, perfumes; María del Rosario; cosméticos y artículos para el hogar; Juan, zapatos; María M., ropa y Micaela, tamales y comida.
   Doña Marisela es conocida por todos como Chela y también por su carácter amigable y trabajador. Desde hace seis años decidió trabajar independientemente e inició con la venta de cosméticos y calzado por catálogo con el fin de apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. Posteriormente, las ganancias obtenidas le permitieron comenzar con la venta de tamales, aumentando así sus ingresos. Por otro lado, aprender hacer dulces tradicionales siempre había sido uno de sus sueños y gracias a doña Josefina logró hacerlo realidad; desde hace más de un año elabora y vende cocadas, ajonjolí, jamoncillo y pepitorias (dulces típicos). Además de vender en distintas comunidades, hace lo propio con un prestigiado restaurante en donde le han sugerido crear su propia marca dulcera. “Me gusta recorrer las calles para llegar a casa de mis clientes y ver la cara de los niños mientras disfrutan uno de mis dulces, esa es la motivación principal para continuar” comenta con una enorme sonrisa.
   Para continuar con su actividad productiva desea emplear la oportunidad del préstamo en la compra de semilla de pipián, coco, azúcar, canela, piña, ajonjolí, leña y bolsas de plástico. Cabe mencionar que para la celebración del día de muertos los clientes le solicitan mucho producto  para colocar en las ofrendas.
*La fotografía fue tomada en el patio de Ana, una integrante del grupo; Doña Marisela viste playera blanca, short a cuadros y en las manos sostiene un catálogo de  zapatos.
texts.en:
While traveling on the dirt trace to a certain community in Oaxaca, one can appreciate the fields of sugar cane, beans and corn, in addition to the oak and mango trees. If one looks carefully at the large extensions of sugar cane, one can spot the irrigation hoses which, when rolled up, look like giant snails.

In this community, there is a group called Caramelos, named this since the majority of the members know how to make the country's traditional sweets. Currently, the group is made up of: Laura who sells tacos; Marisela, traditional sweets, shoes, cosmetics and tamales; Eustorgia, chicken, sweets, and soft drinks; Ana, shoes from catalogs; Dulce, perfumes; María del Rosario; cosmetics and household items; Juan, shoes; María M., clothing and Micaela, tamales and food.

Marisela is known by everyone as Chela and also for her friendly and hard-working character. Six years ago, she decided to work independently and began a business selling cosmetics and shoes from catalogs, with the end of supporting her husband with the household expenses. Later, the earnings she got allowed her to begin to sell tamales, increasing her income in this way. On the other hand, to learn how to make traditional sweets had always been one of her dreams and, thanks to Josefina, she managed to make it come true. For over a year, she has made and sold cocadas, ajonjolí, jamoncillo and pepitorias (traditional sweets). In addition to selling in different communities, she makes her own with a prestigious restaurant where they have suggested that she make her own brand of sweets. “I like to go around the streets to get to my customers' houses and see the children's faces when they enjoy one of my sweets, this is my primary motivation to continue," she says with an enormous smile.

To continue with her work, she wants to take the opportunity of the loan to purchase pumpkin seeds, coconut, sugar, cinnamon, pineapple, sesame seeds, firewood and plastic bags. It is worth noting that for the celebration of the Day of the Dead, the borrowers asked for a lot of products to put in their offerings.

*The photo was taken on Ana's patio, she is a member of the group. Marisela is wearing a white t-shirt, plaid shorts and has a shoe catalog in her hands.

loans.use: to purchase pumpkin seeds, coconut, sugar, cinnamon, pineapple, sesame seeds, firewood and cellophane bags.

loans.name: Everlyne

texts.en:
Everlyne is a Kiva borrower. She has four children. She describes herself as honest. She operates a restaurant. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. 

She will use the 30,000 KES loan to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Thelma is 45 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Thelma has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Thelma requested an 11,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy more variety of fish to sell to her customers.

Thelma has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Thelma would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more variety of fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Jinaidu

texts.en:
Jinaidu is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Jinaidu has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Jinaidu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Jinaidu can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 

As a Babban Gona member, Jinaidu will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Jinaidu is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the lives of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en:
Sandra, age 32, sells second-hand clothes to earn an income. She has operated this business for seven years in the busiest market of Chorkor.

She and her husband live in an apartment in Shaibin Cop within the city of Chorkor with two children.

This will be Sandra's third loan, and her loan funds will allow her to buy a stock of popular clothes that will help her meet customer demand.

"As usual, I am very grateful for the the help Kiva has been offering to sustain my business and family," she says.

loans.use: to buy a stock of popular clothes that will help her meet customer demand.

loans.name: Iktimal

texts.en:
Iktimal is a 40-year-old married mother of three children.

She has been working since 2000 at her house, selling homemade foods to help her family to meet the needs of life and to improve their lifestyle.

Today, she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to improve her business merchandise and to buy food provisions in order to give the best product to her clients.

She has a good reputation in her hometown by giving the best products to her clients. She is very certain that she will sell all products and expand her business area. She hopes that in the near future, she might open her own store.

loans.use: to improve her business merchandise and to buy food provisions.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is a married housewife residing in a small area of Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Razia is making efforts to make the both ends meet together with her husband.

Her husband is a rickshaw driver and very hardworking and works in extra shifts to earn more. But for several days his rickshaw has not been working properly.

For that reason, Razia applied for the loan to ease the load on her husband's shoulders. Further, she is much thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to get her husband's rickshaw repaired.

loans.name: Los Ángeles De Granada Group

texts.es:
El grupo ¨Los Ángeles de Granada¨, solicitan crédito para impulsar sus micro negocios. La líder del grupo es Eveling de 21 años, casada, tiene  a su responsabilidad un hijo. Dedicada ala venta de cerdos y con el crédito comprar cerdos para poderlos criarlos luego poder venderlos en mejores condiciones. Para el destace de cerdo y poder sacar mas derivados comestibles para la población.  
Los otros integrantes lo conforman, Jenny  28 años, dedicada a la venta de cerdos y venta de cosechas. Yelba 45 años, vende cosméticos de la marca Avon, recargas para móviles,, hielo, gelatina y Marchela, de 28 años dedica ala venta de cosméticos, ropa y calzado.
texts.en: The "Los Angeles de Granada" group is asking for a loan to help boost their micro businesses. The leader of this group is Eveling, age 21, married, and who is responsible for one child. She works selling pigs and with the loan she wants to buy pigs to raise them and then sell them under better conditions for slaughtering to obtain better derived edible products for the community. The other members are Jenny, age 28,  who also sells pigs and vegetables; Yelba, age 45, who sells Avon cosmetics, prepaid cell phone cards, ice, jello, and Marchela, age 28, who sells cosmetics, clothing and footwear.

loans.use: To buy pigs to raise them and then sell them under better conditions.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is a Kiva borrower. He has four children. He describes himself as optimistic.

He operates a retail business where he sells sugar, flour, rice, bread, soap and other items. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge as inadequate working capital.

He will use the KES 25,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, bread, flour, soap and other items. His business goal is to have a stable business within five years. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, bread, flour, soap and other items.

loans.name: Efrina

texts.en:
Efrina works hard to support her family. Efrina is married and has a internet cafe business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years now.

Efrina requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her computers.

Efrina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her computers.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Ibrahim has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.
