Before joining Babban Gona, Ibrahim would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Ibrahim can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Ibrahim will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Ibrahim is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Deyling Group

texts.es: Deyling, es la coordinadora del grupo, ella de 26 años, casada, se dedica a su negocio de venta de queso. Inicio su negocio hace 3 años  con la ayuda de su mama quien siempre la apoyado para que salga adelante.  Ella desea el crédito para la compra 4 quintales de quesos,  Con esto ella aumentara la venta de productos y ofrecerá su productos a su cliente. Las otras integrantes son Aurora , 56 años, quien comercializa soya y queso. Darlin, 34 años dedicada a la comercialización de manera ambulante de leche y leche agria.
texts.en: Deyling, the group coordinator is 26 years old, married and makes a living selling cheese. She started her business three years ago with the help of her mother who has always supported her to help her get ahead. She wants this loan so she can buy 400 pounds of cheese. With this she will sell more and will be ale to offer more products to her clients. The other members are Aurora, at 56 years old who also sells cheese, and Darlin at 34 years old who sells normal and soured milk.

loans.use: to buy 400 pounds of cheese.

loans.name: Jiyongul

texts.ru:
Большинства сельских женщин работает в поле, рукоделием  и по хозяйству. Жители сельской местности имеют уникальную возможность каждый день соприкасаться с живой природой. Чиёнгул жительница Фархоского района. Её 35 лет. Она мать троих детей. У нее 2 дочери и один сын. Муж Чиёнгул находится на заработках в Российской Федерации. 
Сельская местность – хорошее  место для открытия своего бизнеса по животноводство. Разведение крупнорогатого скота, на сегодня очень перспективное дело. Чтобы начать бизнес по разведению крупнорогатого скота, необходимо изучить все особенности этой отрасли сельского хозяйство. Чиёнгул научилась выращивать скота у своего отца. Она хочет начать свой бизнес по разведению крупнорогатого скота. У Чиёнгул нет коровник для выращивания скота. Она хочет построить коровник, чтобы беречь своих животных от холода и дождя, потому что уже наступил осень и скоро зима. Чиёнгул обратилась за кредитом для купли стройматериалы. Запрашиваемый кредит поможет ей построить коровник и начать свой бизнес. Чиёнгул после старта бизнеса имеет возможность обеспечить детей. Она верит в Вас и на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en:
Most village ladies work in the fields, as seamstresses, or do housework. The residents of the country area have unique opportunities every day to come into contact with living nature. 

Jiyongul is a resident of Farkhor region. She is 35 years old. She is mother to three children. She has two daughters and one son. Jiyongul's husband is working in Russia. The country area is a good place to open her animal husbandry business. Rearing large cattle is a very promising business today. In order to start her business rearing large cattle, she must learn all the ins and outs of this sphere of farming. 

Jiyongul does not have a cowshed for rearing cattle. She wants to build a cowshed in order to protect her animals from the cold and the rain, because autumn has already arrived and it will soon be winter. Jiyongul has applied for a loan in order to buy building materials. The request loan will help her to build a cowshed and start her business. Jiyongul will be able to provide for her children after starting her business. She believes in you and your support.

loans.use: to buy construction materials and start a new business.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is a married woman. She has six children.

She operates a retail business where she sells cereals. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge as inadequate working capital.

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of cereals. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cereals.

loans.name: Phoeby

texts.en:
Phoeby is a married woman. She has one child. She describes herself as optimistic.

She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to have a stable business within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She will use the anticipated profits to purchase additional stock.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a married man. He has six children. He describes himself as honest.

He operates a retail business where he sell sugar, bread, flour, soap and other items. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge as inadequate working capital.

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, bread, soap, rice and other items. His business goal is to have a wholesale business within five years.

This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. He will use the anticipated profits to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, bread, soap, rice and other items.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma works hard to support her family. Emma is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years now.

Emma requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, fish, beans, vegetables, etc. for her food production business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Emma would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, fish, beans, vegetables, etc. for her food production business.

loans.name: Luiza

texts.en:
In the photograph is Luiza and Xhemal, her husband. They are both in their late 50s and parents of two adults.

She's been operating a photography studio during these past 25 years, and it's the place where the photograph was taken.

The reason Luiza is requesting this loan is to buy a cash register and apply for the license. Kindly note that the previous government had allowed very few activities like this one to be exempted from the taxes. Recently, things changed, and they now need proper licenses.

Luiza suffered kidney failure eight years ago and her sister donated one for her. "I became very sick then and there were -- and there are still -- no donors of any organs in Albania. I was panicked and so was my family. But, I was lucky enough to have a sister who came forward to donate one of her kidneys," said Luiza. "During that time my husband operated the studio."

loans.use: to pay for license papers and buy a cash register for the photography studio.

loans.name: Sani

texts.en:
Sani is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Sani is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty, renewing his dreams of gaining wealth someday.

Traditionally, Sani would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a member of Babban Gona, Sani can store his maize at harvest and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Benefiting from Babban Gona’s marketing support, Sani has the opportunity to generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land.

Sani is thankful that he no longer has to worry about having no money to purchase better inputs to improve his yield, and he looks forward to using his additional earnings to move into a better home with his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Hugo Oswaldo

texts.en:
Hugo is a fisherman of 26 who lives in an area rich and mostly dedicated to fishing. Fishing is the principal income of the zone’s people.

He didn't finish high school. He started to work at the age of 13 with his father. His father fell ill a year ago and he stopped working, so now Hugo is working to support his family. He has an older brother and a younger one. The older brother lives in another city. His mother works too, guarding a school.

His day starts early in the morning, around 5 a.m. and finishes at the middle of the afternoon. The house where they live is small and barely has electricity. It has no drinking water and the bathroom is outside the house.

Some months in the year the business is poor and Hugo dedicates himself to odd jobs.

He is young yet and he would like finish high school and go to university or be a policeman.

He will use the loan to raise chickens and buy chicken feed. He wants to start a new activity because he needs a new income for his family.

loans.use: to raise chickens and buy chicken feed.

loans.name: Saul Omar

texts.es:
Saúl Omar es un joven de 21 años que junto con su padre se dedica al cultivo de diferentes productos de origen agrícola sus principales cultivos son el café y productos de hortaliza como ser: tomates, lechugas y repollos, Saúl Omar es técnico en agronomía y producción agrícola y tiene experiencia tanto técnica como de campo en el cultivo de estos productos su meta es poder producir diversidad alimentos para tener diversas fuentes de ingreso y además darle a las personas la opción de comprar alimentos 100% naturales producidos en la localidad.
Saúl está interesado en la construcción de un invernadero para cultivar tomates orgánicos y de esta manera presentar una opción más saludable a las personas, Saúl quiere llevar a cabo el proyecto bajo el apoyo técnico de COCAFCAL de la cual es socio, Saúl ya tiene un mercado objetivo para su producto por lo cual quiere iniciar con el trabajo lo antes posible.
Saúl solicita un crédito para iniciar las labores en su invernadero y de esta manera empezar a cosechar tomate lo más pronto posible, con las ganancias obtenidas por el producto vendido Saúl espera iniciar su propio patrimonio para estar preparado a la hora de formar su propia familia.
Un crédito ayudara a Saúl a tener un invernadero propio para trabajar y obtener ingresos suficientes para ayudar a las necesidades de sus padres y sobre todo a iniciar su propio patrimonio.
texts.en: Saúl Omar is a young 21 year old man who, along with his father,  works raising different agricultural products. His main crops are coffee and vegetables such as tomatoes, lettuces, and cabbages. Saul Omar is an agronomy technician and agricultural producer. He has experience in agricultural technology  as well as field work in growing these products. His goal is  to be able to produce diverse products to have diverse sources of income and also give clients the opportunity to buy 100% natural products grown locally. Saul is interested in building a green house to grow organic tomatoes and thus offer a healthier option to people. Saul wants to develop this project under the technical supervision of COCAFCAL, where he is a member. Saul has a target market for his product, thus he would like to start as soon as possible. Saul is asking for a loan to begin his work in the greenhouse, so that he can begin growing tomatoes as soon as possible. With these earnings, he will begin saving to be prepared for the time to begin a family. A loan will help Saul have his own greenhouse to work and obtain enough earnings to help his parents and,  most importantly, to begin his own investment.

loans.use: To buy wood, antivirus blanket, tomato plants, organic fertilizer, and other necessary materials to build a green house.

loans.name: Thais

texts.pt:
Thais tem 26 anos e é casada com 1 filha de 4 anos. Ela mora com 5 parentes na comunidade de Maua em São Paulo. Ela e uma pessoa excelente, animada, trabalhadora. Thais se juntou com Banco do Povo Crédito Solidário (BPCS) para ter acesso aos serviços financeiros e este é o seu 9  empréstimo com BPCS.
Thais tem uma quitanda onde vende frutas, legumes e temperos. Ela e muito conhecida em sua comunidade onde trabalha para se sustentar. Ela tem 7 anos de experiência com este negócio. Começou trabalhar nesta  atividade desde pequena quando a sua família tinha uma pequena roça.  Aonde plantavam legumes e verduras. Junto de sua mãe ela saia para vender de porta em porta. Então, futuramente decidiram alugar um espaço onde abriu uma quintana. Começou a vender também fruta e temperos. Hoje em dia ela falou que gosta ser seu próprio patrão. Ela sempre gostou de fruta especialmente melancia e manga. A atividade dela e especial porque ela cresceu antes  vendia de porta a porta e hoje tem sua própria loja.  
Thais precisa de um empréstimo para a compra de mais frutas, legumes e temperos, uma balança e uma nova maquina de moer tempero. A renda extra deste empréstimo permitirá que ela utiliza para manutenção de carro que ela utiliza para buscar as suas mercadorias. 
Thais gostaria falar para os investidores que “me sinto feliz pela confiança em mim.” No futuro ela gostaria de ter a sua casa própria pois no momento mora com sua mae. Se sente feliz e orgulhosa porque sua atividade cresceu e hoje ajuda no sustento da família.
texts.en:
Thais is 26 years old, married, and has one 4-year-old daughter. She lives with five relatives in Maua community in São Paulo. She is an excellent, lively, hardworking person. 

Thais joined Kiva Partner BPCS to have access to financial services, and this is her ninth loan with BPCS. Thais has a grocery store where she sells fruits, vegetables and spices. She has 7 years of experience with this business. 

She started working in this activity in childhood when her family had a small farm where they planted vegetables. Together with her mother she starting selling door-to-door. Later on, they decided to rent a space where she opened a store. She began to also sell fruit and spices. 

Today she says she likes being your own boss. She always liked fruit, especially watermelon and mango. Her business is of special importance to her because she grew from selling door to door and now has her own shop. 

Thais need a loan to buy more fruits, vegetables and spices, a scale and a new machine to grind spices. The extra income from this loan will enable her to pay for maintenance of the car she uses to get her goods. In the future, she plans. 

Thais wants to say to lenders that, ""I feel happy for the confidence you have in me."" In the future she would like to have her own home, as she currently lives with her mother. She feels happy and proud because her activity has grown to help support the family.

loans.use: to buy more fruits, vegetables and spices, a scale and a machine to grind spices

loans.name: Valorosos Group

texts.pt:
O grupo do Banco do povo crédito Solidário Valorosos, se conheçem desde a infância, porque moram muito próximos no mesmo bairro. O grupo já solicitou 8 empréstimos com o Banco do Povo Crédito Solidário (BPCS).
 Ligia é o líder do grupo. Ela tem 30 anos e é casada com 2 filhos de 12 anos e 7 anos, ambos estão frequentando a escola atualmente. Atualmente ela esta gestante com 8 meses com o terceiro filho. Ela mora na comunidade de Maua em São Paulo. Ela e uma pessoa engraçada, determinada e trabalhadora.
 Ligia vende roupa na sua casa em sua comunidade para se sustentar. Ela tem 12 anos de experiência com este negócio. Começou trabalhar nessa área por causa dos filhos. A atividade dela e especial porque e uma fonte de renda para sua família.
 Ligia precisa de um empréstimo para a compra de mais roupas. A renda extra deste empréstimo permitirá que ela sustente a família. Os outros membros do grupo pretendente  usar o empréstimo para o seguinte:João paulo pretende reformar o salão de cabeleireiro. Jaquelini pretende comprar produtos de beleza. Claudete pretende comprar estoque para o bar e restaurante.
Ligia gostaria falar para os investidores que se sente agradecida e pretende no futuro ajudar outras pessoas e da um futuro melhor para seus filhos.
texts.en:
This group, the Valorosos, have known each other since childhood, because they are from the same neighborhood. The group has already taken out eight loans with Banco do Povo Crédito Solidário (BPCS)

Ligia is the leader of the group. She is 30 years old, married, and has two children of 12 and 7 years, who are currently both in school. Currently she is pregnant 8 months with the third child. She lives in Maua community in São Paulo. She and a funny, determined and hardworking person. 

Ligia sells clothes in her home in her community to support herself. She has 12 years of experience with this business. She started working this area to support her children. Her business is important to her because it is a source of income for her family. Ligia need a loan to buy more clothes. The extra income from this loan will enable her to support her family. 

The other members of the group plan to use the loan for the following: João Paulo wants to reform the hair salon. Jaquelini intend to buy beauty products. Claudette plan to buy stock for the bar and restaurant.

Ligia wants to say to Kiva lenders that she feels grateful and wants to help others in the future, and give a better future for her children.

loans.use: to buy clothing for re-sale at her self-run store

loans.name: Rosilene

texts.pt:
Rosilene Ferreira da Silva tem 40 anos e é solteira com 2 filhos de 18 e 15 anos, os dois filhos estão frequentando a escola atualmente. Ela mora com seus filhos na comunidade de Mauá pertinho da sua loja. Ela e uma pessoa linda, trabalhadeira e honesta. Rosilene se juntou com Banco do Povo credito solidário (BPCS) para ter acesso aos serviços financeiros e este é o seu 14 empréstimo.
Rosilene vende roupa na sua loja, em sua comunidade, Mauá, para se sustentar. Ela tem 15 anos de experiência com este negócio. Antes ela era camelô na rua e vendia cosméticos. Começou trabalhar essa área porque sempre gostou de moda e prefere trabalhar por conta própria. 
Rosilene precisa de um empréstimo para investir na sua loja e comprar roupas. A renda extra deste empréstimo permitirá que ela possa vender nas feiras. No futuro, ela planeja continuar vendendo e expandir. 
Rosilene gostaria falar para os investidores que “São muito corajosos em investir no povo do Brasileiro me sinto muito feliz.vamos crescer juntos!” Ela é orgulhosa da sua atividade porque ela e sua próprio patrão. No futuro ela gostaria ver sua filha frequentando  a faculdade e expandir a loja e continuar vendendo roupas.
texts.en:
Rosilene is 40 years old, single, and has two children of 18 and 15, who are both currently attending school. She lives with her children in Mauá, close to where she has her store. She's a lovely, hardworking and honest person. Rosilene joined with Kiva Partner BPCS to have access to financial services,and this is her 14th loan with BPCS.

Rosilene sells clothes in her store, RGT fashion, in her community, to support herself. She has 15 years of experience with this business. Before this, she was a street vendor, and sold cosmetics. She started working this area because she always liked fashion and prefer to work for herself.

Rosilene needs a loan to invest in her shop and buy clothes. The extra income from this loan will enable her to sell in the markets. In the future, she plans to continue selling and expand.

Rosilene would like say to Kiva lenders that, "You are very brave to invest in the Brazilian of the people, it makes me feel very happy that we will grow together!" She is proud of her business because she is her own boss. In the future she would like to see her daughter attending college, and expand the store and continue selling clothes.

loans.use: to invest in her store and buy more clothes

loans.name: La Nueva Esperanza De Corcona Group

texts.es: Estela es viuda con 5 hijos independientes. Ella se dedica a la elaboración de chompas chalecos para niños y adultos a base de lana. Hace muchos años. Ella elabora sus tejidos a pedido de sus clientes y ofrece algunos de sus productos. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de mas lana botones agujas e hilo. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Estela es la tercera persona parada del lado derecho viste chompa negra.
texts.en:
Estela is a widow with 5 independent children. She has earned a living for many years making wool-based sweaters and vests for children and adults. She offers several of her products and makes her knitted goods to her clients' orders.

She will invest the loan in buying more wool, buttons, knitting needles, and thread.

The group is grateful to the Kiva investors for the given loan. Estela is the third person standing on the right side, wearing a black sweater.

loans.use: to buy wool, thread, and buttons.

loans.name: Lama

texts.en:
Lama is 31 years old, married, and has four children. She works hard to help her husband with the household expenses ‎and to provide a good life to her children. Lama's husband operates a barber shop, which he has been doing ‎for five years. He gained experience from his father and is now well known in Marka City.

Lama decided to help her husband improve his barber shop and requested a loan, which will be used to help him buy new tools and materials such as hair cut tools, hair dryer, and hair spray. This loan will help Lama's husband improve his business ‎and make his barber shop more attractive. Lama`s husband appears in the photo instead ‎her because she is conservative woman

loans.use: to purchase new tools and materials for her husband's barber ‎shop such as hair cut tools, hair dryer, and hair spray.

loans.name: Alhaji

texts.en:
Alhaji. M is maize farmer from Karofi village. As a member of Babban Gona, Alhaji. M is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support he has the chance to attain yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria.

Before joining Babban Gona, Alhaji. M would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Alhaji. M can store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Alhaji. M is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family and in the end hopes to use his increased earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Doris Nathalie

texts.en:
Doris is a hopeless 21-year-old woman who recently married and who lives in an urban slum city. She has three younger brothers who are currently studying and her father is sick. Her house is small and belongs to a big property. Doris takes care of the property and the owners let her raise rabbits. Rabbits are in great demand because they are an essential protein in Andean gastronomy. Doris needs to invest some money into her business to improve it and make it workable.

Doris is requesting a loan to purchase rabbit food and medicine to provide good nutrition for her rabbits. In the future, she looks forward to building a family and giving them good values and a better future. Doris will use her loan to improve her family's lifestyle.

loans.use: to purchase food and medicine to provide good nutrition for her rabbits

loans.name: Alh. Rabiu

texts.en:
Alhaji Rabiu is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, he is thankful that the days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, Alhaji Rabiu has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to eight metric tons of maize per hectare of land, which is 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.
 
Traditionally, Alhaji Rabiu would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate needs for essentials such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, he will be able to store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a later date when he can obtain a significantly higher price. By waiting, Alhaji Rabiu could sell his harvest at a premium of up to 37% more than the price at harvest.
 
Alhaji Rabiu will use his loan to buy food and clothing at the time of harvest, allowing him to store his maize to sell at a greater profit. With the opportunity to earn up to 2,000 USD per hectare, he now has the chance to actualize his dream of expanding his agriculture business for himself and family members.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Douaa

texts.en:
Douaa is a 20-year-old single lady who works as a tutor to cover her needs and expenses. She started four years ago and is loved by her students for her professional skills and patience. Douaa is also continuing her own university studies too. 

Douaa is requesting a loan from the Kiva field partner Al Majmoua to pay for her university tuition fees for her beauty care major. In the future, she hopes to finish her studies successfully and start her own business.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees for her beauty care major

loans.name: Bunena Vision  Group

texts.en:
Middress is a 41-year-old hardworking married woman with four children, all of whom attend secondary school. They live in Kamwenge, Uganda.

Middress is a member of Bunena Vision Group where members guarantee each other to acquire loans from financial institutions. She buys and sells coffee alongside the growing of tomatoes to increase the income of her family. She has been a farmer for over four years and works six days per week.

She dreams of educating her children and expanding her business to a bigger coffee store but her major challenge is bad weather.

She is requesting a loan to buy more coffee to sell.

loans.use: to buy more coffee to sell.

loans.name: Hala

texts.en:
Hala is a 46-year-old married mother of three children. Due to the financial situation of her husband, she opened a grocery shop three years to help him provide for the needs and expenses of their family. Hala is a hard worker and an ambitious woman who is working hard to develop her business and improve her family's living conditions. 

Hala is requesting a loan from the Kiva field partner Al Majmoua to pay for her son's university tuition fees. He is in his third academic year and studying computer engineering. In the future, Hala hopes to expand her business, increase her income, and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for her son's university tuition fees

loans.name: Abdulsalam

texts.en:
Abdulsalam is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, he is thankful that the days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, Abdulsalam has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to eight metric tons of maize per hectare of land, which is 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.
 
Traditionally, Abdulsalam would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate needs for essentials such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, he will be able to store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a later date when he can obtain a significantly higher price. By waiting, Abdulsalam could sell his harvest at a premium of up to 37% more than the price at harvest.
 
Abdulsalam will use his loan to buy food and clothing at the time of harvest, allowing him to store his maize to sell at a greater profit. With the opportunity to earn up to 2,000 USD per hectare, he now has the chance to actualize his dream of expanding his agriculture business for himself and family members.  Abdulsalam would like to use this additional income to build a house for his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Buhanda Bakyara Tutunguke Group

texts.en:
Medius is a 47-year-old, hardworking, married woman with five children living in Kamwenge, Uganda. She is a member of Buhanda Bakyara Tutunguke Group, where members guarantee each other to help them get financial support in the form of group loans.

Medius grows and sells coffee alongside the growing of other food crops to increase the income of her family. She has been a farmer for over 10 years and has a vision of expanding her coffee-selling business to a reasonable coffee store, but her main challenge is bad weather and seasonality changes.

She is requesting a loan to buy more coffee to sell.

loans.use: to buy more coffee to sell.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is married. He has been dealing in the produce business for 10 years now. He has the responsibility of paying his children's school fees. He faces a challenge of price fluctuations in his business; however, he manages it by selling a variety of produce like beans and coffee, among others.

Daniel now wants to add stock of maize in his shop, it being selling like hotcakes because of the favorable good season. The capital at hand is not enough. He requests credit to buy stock of maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy stock of maize to sell.

loans.name: Black

texts.en:
Black is a widow and a mother of three children. She is their sole provider and lives in Kasese district. She has owned a boutique for six years now. She faces a challenge of competition, but manages to move on by trying to be creative and moving at the pace of her customers' demands.

She has a responsibility of paying her children’s school fees, feeding them, and providing for all their needs. She also has a desire to own a land tittle and secure her children's property as a loving mother.

She is now requesting money to buy new clothes to sell ahead of the Christmas season.

loans.use: to buy new clothes to sell ahead of the Christmas season.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a hardworking, 45-year-old woman. She is single. She lives in Ghana, in Accra-chorkor. In order to improve in life, Margaret works hard.

She is in her third cycle of loans with ID-Ghana. She used her previous loans to buy more cloth and sold it to successfully repay her loan. She receives a good income from the sale of cloths (draped over her arms in the photo).

Now, she would like to increase her business by buying more cloths to earn a bigger profit. She is requesting 800 GHS.

loans.use: to increase her business by buying more cloth to earn a bigger profit.

loans.name: Zailani

texts.en:
Zailani is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Zailani has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Zailani would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Zailani can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Zailani will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Zailani is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell his maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Inuwa

texts.en:
Inuwa is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Inuwa has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Inuwa would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Inuwa can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Inuwa will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Inuwa is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell his maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Por Fe Group

texts.es: El grupo está integrado por tres socias exitosas en sus trabajos, coordinado por la señora Blanca de 33 años de edad, casada y madre de un hijo, se dedica a vender cosméticos, este negoció lo impulsó hace tres años contando  con la liquidación de su trabajo anterior, el crédito lo requiere para la compra de productos cosméticos como perfumes, cremas, labiales, bodys, sombras, vanidades, delineadores de las marcas Scential, Avon y vogue. Las otras socias son la señora Luisa  de 42 años la cual vende cosméticos como cremas humectantes y perfumes;  y la señora Luz de 24 años quien comercializa frutas y verduras de manera ambulante para así poder ayudar al sustento familiar. Y salir adelantes
texts.en: This group is made up of three members with successful businesses. Blanca who is 33 years old co ordinates the group. She is married with a son and makes a living by selling cosmetics. She started this business up three years ago using the proceeds of the sale of her prior business. She needs the loan to buy cosmetics such as perfume, creams, lip balm, body creams, eye shadow, make up and eye liner by Avon, Vogue and Essential. The other members are Luisa who is 42 years old and sells cosmetics including moisturizer creams and perfume. Luz, aged 24 sells fruit and vegetables door to door to provide for her family and get ahead.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics including perfume, creams, lip balm, body creams, eye shadow, make up and eyeliners by  Avon, Vogue and Essential.

loans.name: Rapail

texts.en:
Rapail, a 31-year-old, married man, lives in the village Ponichala. He is a hairstylist and also has a small agribusiness, growing and selling greens at the local market. He has two children, a wife and parents.

The family's living condition is poor, and because of that, Rapail decided to be involved in another business. He sought credit among local financial institutions, but his attempts were unsuccessful because of his poor living conditions.

The startup program that is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo enables rural poor people to get a loan for starting or re-starting businesses. His application was approved under the framework of this program to get a loan of 6,000 GEL.

Rapail will purchase a second-hand car and will start serving local people as a taxi driver. The new business will become the significant source of income for the family, and Rapail will meet all family expenses more easily. He awaits support and kindness.

loans.use: to purchase a car and start serving local people.

loans.name: Jemima

texts.en:
Jemima is a 26-year-old entrepreneur who took advantage of the large number of people in her area to begin her own business. She sells gizzard and turkey tail, which she prepares in person and promotes through social communication. She makes her purchases at a wholesale shop in the city. She is also involved in specialized exhibition for parties.

This young entrepreneur lives in a neighborhood of Chorkor Amaami, and has six years working at this job, with which she has managed to pay part of her household expenses.

She wants to continue her business in a much more established manner. That is why she seeks Kiva credit in her fourth financing through ID-Ghana, to buy more meats, with the goal of taking advantage of the increase in demand. Her goal is to enlarge the business in order to create employment opportunities in her society.

loans.use: to buy more meats, with the goal of taking advantage of the increase in demand.

loans.name: Samia Sabaya Group

texts.en:
Hala is the featured borrower for samia Sabaya Group. She joined with her other group members to take this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. They are working hard to develop their businesses and living at the same time.

Hala is a 28-year-old single lady who works as a teacher to cover her needs and expenses. She is loved by her students for her professional skills and patience. Hala's salary is not enough to cover any additional expenses, thus today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay for her necessary medical treatments. Hala is the lady sitting in the middle.
With respect to the other group members, Aline is the first lady on the right, and Manal is the first lady on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to pay for her necessary medical treatments

loans.name: Manushak

texts.en:
Manushak is a student living in Talin town of Aragatsotn region with her parents. Currently her father works abroad as a migrant worker, to support family's living. Manushak herself is a student in the State College of Fine Arts and all her time is devoted to the studies.

Manushak asks lenders to support her with her university tuition. The loan will enable her to cover her 4th years' tuition fee, for the first semester, and enable her continue her studies.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition for her 4th year studies in Fine Arts

loans.name: Tea

texts.en:
Tea is 26 years old and from the village Skindori. She has a husband, a pensioner father and two children. Sadly, for lack of economic resources, she was unable to study for a professional career.

Tea works hard on family-owned agricultural land, growing maize, which is sold to local retailers. Her husband is employed and has also a fixed income. However, the whole income is hardly enough, and the family members find it hard to make financial stability.

Tea decided to start a stable activity and somehow increase her family's living conditions. According to the above-mentioned situation, she lacks the access to capital markets and financial institutions to obtain credit for starting a business. The Start Up program created by Kiva and Credo enabled Tea to get a loan of 1,200 GEL to open a buffet in the local school. Tea will sell the food products among pupils and will get her own income.

The Start Up credit will be a great support for the family, as their income will be significantly increased. In regards to Kiva lenders, Tea and her family members will be very thankful for the assistance.

loans.use: to start her own business and open a buffet in the local school.

loans.name: Ekaterine

texts.en:
Ekaterine is 45 years old. She is married and lives in Senaki with her husband, son and pensioner parents-in-law. The family is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have pigs, hens, cows and calves. Ekaterine produces cheese to sell with eggs and piglets from home. They also cultivate 0.4 hectare family-owned agricultural land, where they grow vegetables for family feed.

The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables her to get a loan. With the received credit she will purchase a car and her husband will work as a taxi driver to get income. This will significantly increase the family income. Ekaterine awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase a car for her husband to start a taxi business

loans.name: Luan

texts.en:
Luan is a 35-year-old married father of two children, 15 and 11 and they live in a village where they have been practicing livestock for these past five years. Kindly note that his elderly parents are more in charge of the livestock, since Luan does distribution of haberdasheries to stores in a little town nearby. From this, he earns a very minimum pay and his wife works as a waitress in a nearby restaurant for a pay lower than the minimum.

On the land that they own, they plant mostly feed for their animals and if they cannot plant anything, they leave it as pasture for the animals. So far they have six dairy cows selling about 25 liters of raw milk/day most of the year and also six calves/year.

The reason for this loan is to stock up on animal feed for the winter.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for the winter

loans.name: Nino

texts.en:
Nino, who is 44 years old and from Tbilisi, lives with her husband. The couple is temporarily unemployed and has no source of income. They live under poverty and require financial assistance to generate some income. Nino couldn’t receive a loan from the local financial institutions because of their requirements to have business experience or stable revenue, until the Start Up program began, which is a joint product of Kiva and Credo. The program allows rural poor like Nino to get a chance for starting or restarting a business.

With the loan, she plans to open a mini store of fruits and vegetables and start trading. She will work as a sales lady and get the only income for her family's well-being.

This credit will be a great support for the family. Nino and her husband are thankful to Kiva lenders for giving them a chance to generate income.

loans.use: to start a trading business with fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hasan was born in 1997. He is single and lives with his parents. Hasan is a student of the first course. He studies well and he dreams to be a good specialist in the future. Hasan’s parents have been busy with their agriculture business. They grow crops and vegetables.

Hasan is asking for a loan to pay for the university tuition because his parents have not money. Hasan awaits your support.

loans.use: to pay for his university tuition .

loans.name: Donald

texts.en:
Donald is 28 and a married father of a 7 month-old. About two years ago he bought a motel/hotel type along the national road, Tirana-Korca-Greece and now he wants to make some basic improvements to it. He will pay for the cost of renovations with the loan he is requesting from you. This is the only source of income for the family.

The monthly rent he's receiving from the motel is $310. " I looked at some other activities, yet, they were not possible in the area where I reside. Hence, I ended up buying this place and no regrets. Since it is located along the road, there are people who spend the nights here because they don't want to drive for long hours. Some others come here to get a drink as well," said Donald to the loan officer.

loans.use: to make some basic repairs to the hotel/motel he has rented out

loans.name: Samar

texts.en:
Samar is a 37-year-old married mother of two. Fifteen years ago, she started selling clothes to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their family. She is a hard worker and ambitious lady who has a good reputation among her region. Samar is trying desperately to develop her business, thus today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with new collection of winter clothes to satisfy her customers' requests.
Samar hopes to expand her business more in the future to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise with new collection of winter clothes to satisfy her customers' requests

loans.name: Ghazi

texts.en:
Ghazi is a 34-year-old married father of four and a Palestinian refugee who lives in a Palestinian refugee camp. Due to the low social and financial situations of Palestinians in Lebanon, especially those who live in camps, he started six years ago working as a taxi driver where he transports employees and students.

Lately he opened a grocery shop, as a second source of income, to better cover his family's needs and expenses.

Today, Ghazi is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to develop his business, through increasing his merchandise with new items and products to satisfy his customers' requests.
Ghazi hopes to keep on expanding his business in the future to increase his income and improve his family's living conditions inside the camp.

loans.use: to develop his business through increasing his merchandise with new items and products

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit lives with her family in Yerevan town. She is a mother of one daughter, Karine. Anahit is a dancing teacher by profession and together with her husband works hard to sustain the family's living.

Anahit asks this loan to cover her daughter's tuition fee and enable her to continue studies in Yerevan State University.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition costs for her daughter.

loans.name: Afnan

texts.en: ‎ Afnan is 22-year-old single lady, living with her family in Mafraq. She is in her second year for a ‎bachelor's degree, majoring in Software Engineering. Afnan`s father is retired and his ‎retirement salary is not enough to meet all of the education fees of his children.  Because of ‎that she requested an education loan to cover her semester fees, and that will help her ‎graduate faster and find a job. She hopes to find a job after she graduates immediately, to ‎help her family with the household expenses. ‎

loans.use: to cover her semester fees in Software Engineering

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is single and has two children. For the past nine years, she has been selling cooking oil at her residence to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation.

Glaydys requested a loan from ID-Ghana for 1,200 GHS, which she will use to purchase more oil to sell. She decided to join ID-Ghana to access loans to boost her business. She dreams of expanding her business to become a wholesale supplier of cooking oil in her township. She is living in a family house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

loans.use: to purchase oil to sell.

loans.name: Karamkuvar's Group

texts.en:
Karamkuvar, standing to the left hand side in the photograph, is a differently abled lady. Tailoring has been a family craft that was practiced by her mother and grandmother for ages.

However, what differentiates Karamkuvar from her ancestors is that she does this for a living, and the money she earns from her business goes straight into the family kitty. Not every woman in this distant village of Koraput in Odisha, India has this claim to fame of working shoulder to shoulder with her husband. The icing on the cake is the long list of clients, from wholesale merchants and retailers to individual women, who queue up at her shop just to get their orders fulfilled.

Karamkuvar, along with her group member, is requesting a loan amount of 30,000 INR from Kiva's partner People's Forum. Karamkuvar will use her portion of the loan amount to invest in buying quality thread and tailoring equipment, and, if possible, hire an extra pair of hands to deal with the huge rush of orders she has received. We see a solid investment opportunity here.

loans.use: to invest in buying quality thread, tailoring equipment, and, if possible, hire an extra pair of hands to deal with the huge rush of orders she received.

loans.name: Jewel Group

texts.en:
This group is made up of four members who live in the same neighborhood and have been together for many years. They belong to a group called Jewels and are into the sale of drinks, cassava and plantains, rice and slippers.

Kwadwo (the man in the photo) is the featured borrower of the group; he is an elementary school leaver and has been selling provisions for nine years now. He enjoys doing this job because it is profitable and has earned him many customers. Together with her friend, they will need a total amount of GHS 6700.00 to expand their businesses.

loans.use: to expand his grocery retail sales business.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en:
Sandra is an 18-year-old single young lady who works as a tutor to cover her needs and expenses. She is still continuing her university studies. Sandra studies Physics and she is planning to reach a PHd degree.

Her limited income is not enough to cover any additional expenses, so today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy a laptop which she needs to facilitate her studies. Sandra is an ambitious and clever lady who has many dreams to achieve in the future.

loans.use: to buy a laptop for her university studies in Physics.

loans.name: Diturie

texts.en: Diturie wants to prepare the land for planting fodder, wheat and beans and this is where your loan will go to. Her son and daughter-in-law sell recycled clothes in the villages around while her husband receives a retirement pension.

loans.use: to pay for preparation of the soil where she will plant

loans.name: Leonilda

texts.es:
Leonilda con 51 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rústico,junto a su esposo y su hijo, en el distrito de Colasay,provincia de Jaén,departamento de Cajamarca,país Perú. Ella cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona.Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

Leonilda se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad. Adicionalmente se dedica a la cría de animales menores. El destino del crédito será para invertir en la compra de mercadería para surtir más su negocio con ello le generará mayores ingresos y así poder mejorar su calidad de vida. Para este rubro no hay mayor competencia en la zona y con ello obtiene mejores precios.

Leonilda es socia recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa. Ella firma con su esposo.
texts.en:
Leonilda is 51 years old and lives with her husband and son in her own house made from rustic materials, in Colasay district, Jaén province, Cajamarca department, Peru. She has very good personal and working references from the people who live there. Most of the inhabitants of this region work in agriculture, trade and raising cattle.

Leonilda works selling basic necessities. She also breeds small animals.

The loan will be used to invest in buying goods as more supplies for her business. This will generate greater income and so she will be able to improve her quality of life. There is no major competition in the region for this type of business, so she can get better prices.

Leonilda is a repeat member of Edpyme Alternativa. She is applying with her husband.

loans.use: to invest in buying goods as more supplies for her business.

loans.name: Argelia Nohemy

texts.es: Argelia, tiene 39 años de edad, es casada, tiene 2 hijos y vive en una aldea del municipio de Macuelizo, Santa Bárbara. Su esposo realiza trabajos de sastrería y de agricultura. Hace 8 años que la señora Argelia decidió tener su propia fuente de ingresos para aportar a los gastos del hogar. Ella estableció en su casa una pulpería donde vende productos de la canasta básica familiar como ser: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, embutidos, carnes, lácteos, dulces, churros, cereales, refrescos, huevos, etc. Está solicitando el cuarto ciclo de préstamo en ODEF que es por 20,000 Lempiras y lo utilizara para surtir el negocio de productos alimenticios como granos básicos, carnes, embutidos, refrescos, pan, harina, condimentos, productos de limpieza etc, para cubrir la demanda de sus clientes y aumentar las ventas. Su deseo es que el negocio crezca y se convierta en un mini súper o una abarrotería fuerte.
texts.en:
39-year old Argelia is married and has two children. She lives in a neighborhood in the municipality of Macuelizo, Santa Bárbara. Eight years ago Argelia decided she needed income of her own to pay for household expenses. She started a grocery store in her home where she sells everyday necessities such as rice, beans, sugar, cold meats, meat, milk products, doughnuts, soft drinks, eggs etc.

She is now seeking a fourth loan with ODEF for 20,000 lempiras which she will use to buy groceries such as basic grains, meat, cold meats, soft drinks, bread, flour, condiments, cleaning products etc. With these purchases she will satisfy her customers' demands and increase sales. Argelia would like to see her business grow and become a mini-supermarket or a successful grocery store.

loans.use: buy groceries such as basic grains, meat, cold meats, soft drinks, bread, flour, condiments, cleaning products etc.

loans.name: Samar

texts.en:
Samar is a 40-year-old married Syrian mother of five, who started eight years ago working in the tailoring field to cover the needs and expenses of her family, as she is their only breadwinner. She has professional skills in tailoring and is well-known among her region. She is working hard to develop her business.

Today Samar is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy an updated sewing machine which will facilitate her business and allow her to provide her customers with better and quick service.
Samar hopes to keep on expanding her business to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy an updated sewing machine which will facilitate her business.

loans.name: Mergen

texts.en:
Mergin is 50 years old and a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Mergin has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Mergin requested a PHP 29500 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more variety of fish to sell to her customers.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Mergin has been in this business for 26 years. In the future, Mergin would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more variety of fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Buana

texts.en:
Buana is an artisan from Indonesia who specializes in handmade jewelry. He would like to invest in a bulk purchase of silver and purchase new silversmithing tools. Buana has been selling through NOVICA since 2006. This is his story:


"I've been surrounded by handicrafts all my life. I am thankful to God for giving me such a great gift so I can make a living for my family. Not much, perhaps, but enough for our simple way of life."

"I just moved to a new workshop and have been training more silversmiths. I need to buy new tools and more silver so we can prepare for the holiday season. For all of you who always support me, thank you so much! It really means a lot and benefits many silversmiths and their families."

Use the link below to view Buana's handmade jewelry on the NOVICA site:

http://www.novica.com/kiva/5503

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of silver and purchase new silversmithing tools

loans.name: Annik

texts.en:
Annik lives in Yerevan with her husband and son Vardan. Vardan is a student at university, in his 2nd year of study. Both Annik and her husband work hard to sustain their family's living and to cover Vardan's university costs.

Annik asks this loan to pay for Vardan's university tuition and give him an opportunity to continue his studies in the Bachelor's program. This family will be very grateful to lenders for their support.

loans.use: to pay for her son's university tuition

loans.name: Floridalmy

texts.es: Floridalmy, de 41 años, está casada, es madre de 2 hijos, vive en una de las aldeas del Municipio de Azacualpa, Santa Bárbara, junto a su esposo y sus hijos. Ella se dedica a la venta de productos de la canasta básica desde hace 12 años en su vivienda donde ofrece productos como lácteos, granos básicos, azúcar, arroz, harina, huevos, refrescos, pan, churros, jugos y otros productos. Está solicitando el tercer ciclo de préstamo en ODEF que es por la cantidad de 30,000 Lempiras, los que invertirá en la compra de más productos para surtir su pulpería como arroz, frijoles, manteca, azúcar, pan, refrescos, churros, productos de limpieza, huevos, productos enlatados, etc.  Para conseguir aumentar su clientela y sus ventas. Su meta es crecer como microempresaria y generar más ingresos que ayuden al bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Floridalmy is 41 years old, married, and the mother of two children. She lives in a village in the municipality of Azacualpa, Santa Barbara, with her husband and children. She has made a living for the past 12 years selling basic goods from her home, offering products including dairy, grains, sugar, rice, flour, eggs, drinks, bread, churros, and juices, among others. 

Floridalmy is requesting her third loans from ODEF for 30,000 Lempiras, which she will invest in the purchase of more products to stock her store, such as rice, beans, butter, sugar, bread, drinks, churros, cleaning products, eggs, canned goods, etc. With this she hopes to increase her clientele and her sales. Her goal is to grow as an entrepreneur and generate more income which will help the well-being of her family.

loans.use: to buy more products to stock her store, including rice, beans, butter, sugar, bread, drinks, churros, cleaning products, eggs, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Mikheil

texts.en:
Mikheil is a 27-year-old artisan, who repairs trucks and has a variable monthly income. He has a wife and small son. His existing income is barely enough for the family, and Mikheil planned to start another business to help him to deal with the financial instability.

After several unsuccessful attempts, Mikheil applied for credit from MFO Credo. His request was approved in the framework of the Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva to help poor people to start or re-start businesses. He needs money to pay rent, purchase a cash register, and stock food products in order to open a bakery. He will use the money for working capital and to make the business profitable, after baking various kinds of delicious pastry dishes.

He is a very enthusiastic and hard-working person, with a great desire to ensure that his son gets a good education so that he can progress in life. This credit will offer great support for the family. Mikheil is thankful to Kiva Lenders for giving him a chance to generate additional income.

loans.use: to open a bakery.

loans.name: Samaila

texts.en:
Samaila is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Samaila is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer. 
Traditionally, Samaila would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Samaila will store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a date later in the season when he can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price. 
With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per Hectare of land, Samaila now has the opportunity to actualize his dream to grow his agriculture business for himself and family members and would like to use this additional income to build a house for his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Ikirama

texts.en:
Ikirama is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Ikirama has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Ikirama would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as for food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Ikirama can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Ikirama will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Ikirama is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to ensure that all his children get a post-secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Suwidi

texts.en:
Suwidi is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Suwidi has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Suwidi would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Suwidi can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Suwidi will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Suwidi is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to ensure that all his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.en:
Juan is a 26-year-old man living with his girlfriend under the marital law of Free Union. They have a 1-year-old son.

Juan is the main economical support of his house. Nevertheless, his wife likes to play a contributing role in their income, so she works at a local elementary school to make a living. Juan works for an enterprise in the area of networks and systems.

Juan enjoys his work and spending time with his family, but he worries about the future. He would like to have a business that provides for him when he decides to retire, along with his wife. This business is not only a retirement plan, but "something" that his kid may inherit one day.

In order to start this new business of his own, he has been in touch with some rough materials providers and has been looking for places. He is really close to achieving his goal, yet he is still missing the money to start. In order to start it, Juan is looking for a 10,527 MXN loan that will allow him to get the capital he needs.

This is a huge project for Juan and his family because, if he succeeds, Juan and his family won't be struggling with money for the next years.

loans.use: to start a coffee shop of his own

loans.name: Alh. Nura

texts.en:
Alh. Nura is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Alh. Nura has the opportunity to attain yields of up to eight metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Alh. Nura would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Alh. Nura can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Alh. Nura will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Alh. Nura is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family, and looks forward to using his additional earnings to ensure that all his children get a post-secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Tijjani

texts.en:
Tijjani is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Tijjani has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Tijjani can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Tijjani will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Tijjani is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the lives of his children and family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Buena Esperanza Group

texts.es:
Está conformado por tres mujeres luchadoras que se organizaron hace 2 meses, con el propósito de acceder a financiamiento para sus pequeños negocios, mejorar sus ingresos y condiciones de vida, poder cubrir las necesidades básicas de su hogar, asegurar la educación de sus hijos y ampliar sus negocios.

AUDELIA: Es la Coordinadora del grupo solidario, es una señora de 27 años de edad, con cualidades de líder, pertenece a la etnia miskita, originaria del Municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Casada con 6 hijos: 4 adolescentes que estudian su primaria y 2 menores de edad. Su esposo trabaja como agricultor. Con el propósito de apoyar con los gastos del hogar y tener su propia fuente de ingresos, estableció su pequeña pulpería en su vivienda de tambo y madera, donde vende productos básicos que demanda la población. Está solicitando financiamiento para comprar: granos básicos, jabón, detergentes, sopa instantánea, gaseosas, carbón, entre otros productos. Su sueño es ser una comerciante exitosa y tener un negocio próspero.
texts.en:
This group is made up of three hardworking women who formed a group two months ago so they could access credit for their small businesses, increase income, improve their standard of living, pay for household necessities, ensure their children would get an education, and expand their businesses.

Audelia is coordinator of this committed group. She is 27 years old and has the qualities of a leader. She is of Miskita background and a native of the municipality of Puerto Cabezas. Aurelia is married and has six children: four teenagers who attend primary school and two toddlers. Her husband is a farmer.

With the goal of helping with household expenses and having her own source of income, she started a small grocery store in her wooden home built on stilts where she sells everyday supplies as required by the local people. She is seeking a loan to buy basic grains, soap, detergent, instant soups, soft drinks, charcoal, etc. Her greatest wish is to be a successful businesswoman and have a prosperous business.

loans.use: buy basic grains, soap, detergent, instant soups, soft drinks, charcoal, etc

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 46 years old and a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Lolita has a selling portable stove business in the Philippines. Lolita requested a PHP 15000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more portable stove to sell.

Lolita has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Lolita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more portable stoves to sell.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca works hard to support her family. She is married and has a pig fattening business in the Philippines.

Rebecca requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed, vitamins and other supplies for her business.

Rebecca has been in this business for 11 years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Rebecca would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vitamins and other supplies for her business.

loans.name: Rosila

texts.en:
Rosila is 59 years old and is married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Rosila runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

Rosila has been in this business for 12 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, coffee, detergent soap, fabric conditioners, juice, milk, etc.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Rosila would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Ruth is 46 years old and has three children who are in school.

Ruth has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell.

Ruth has been in this business for four years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is a single woman. She has one child. She describes herself to be focused and determined.

Vivian operates a retail business where she sells bags. She has been involved in this business for 20 years. Her business is located in a fast-growing area, and her primary customers are individuals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

She will use the loan to buy more bags for adequate supply.

Her business goal is to open a wholesale shop within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children to university level.

This is her first loan with ID-Ghana. She promises to repay successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her child.

loans.use: To buy more bags for adequate supply.

loans.name: Susuana

texts.en:
Susuana is a Kiva borrower. She has 2 children and describes himself to be committed. She operates in the sale of Milo, milk and sugar. Her business is located at Chorkor white house in the greater Accra region of Ghana. Her primary customers are the people in the area.

She will use the GHS 2400 loan to buy more stocks to boost her capital.She hopes that in the future, she will enlarge her business to create employment opportunities for the youths in the locality. This is her sixth loan with ID-Ghana. The previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more milk product stocks to boost her capital.

loans.name: Umar

texts.en:
Umar is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Umar has the opportunity to attain yields of up to eight metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Umar would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Umar can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Umar will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Umar is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family, and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Alhassan

texts.en:
Alhassan is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Alhassan has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

Samaila is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Magaji

texts.en:
Magaji is a maize farmer from Pawa village. As a member of Babban Gona, Magaji is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support, he has the chance to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria.

Before joining Babban Gona, Magaji would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Magaji can store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Magaji is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Yakubu

As a Babban Gona member, she has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

Traditionally, Halima would have had to sell her maize for low prices at harvest to meet her immediate cash needs, such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Halima will store the maize she harvests and delay it’s sale until a date later in the season when she can obtain a significantly higher price for her maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Lawal

texts.en:
Lawal is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Lawal is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty, renewing his dreams of gaining wealth someday.

Traditionally, Lawal would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a member of Babban Gona, Lawal can store his maize at harvest and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Benefiting from Babban Gona’s marketing support, Lawal has the opportunity to generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land.

Lawal is thankful that he no longer has to worry about having no money to increase his farmland and looks forward to using his additional earnings to move into a better home with his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Ma. Elisa

texts.en:
Ma. Elisa is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Ma. Elisa is 49 years old and has four children who are in school.

Ma. Elisa has a fishing business in the Philippines. Ma. Elisa requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies.

Ma. Elisa has been in this business for two years. In the future, Ma. Elisa would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is 50 years old and married. She has two children. With one child in school, Rosa works very hard to provide for them.

Rosa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, snack foods, home care products, and other groceries.

Rosa has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items. In the future, Rosa would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, snack foods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is a married woman with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Betty is 52 years old and has one child in school.

Betty has a fishing business in the Philippines. Betty requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish nets and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Betty has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Betty would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fish nets, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Kokies Group

texts.es:
Está conformado por  3 mujeres luchadoras (Jenny María, Esmeralda y Elvia) que se organizaron hace 3 años, con el propósito de acceder a financiamiento para mejorar sus condiciones de vida, poder cubrir las necesidades básicas de su hogar, asegurar la educación de sus hijos y ampliar sus negocios.

JENNY MARIA: Es coordinadora del grupo solidario, es una mujer alegre,  con cualidades de líder y deseos de superación, pertenece a la etnia miskita del municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Tiene 29 años de edad, es casada, tiene 3 hijos: El mayor de 13 años cursa sexto grado de primaria y 2 menores de edad. Con el propósito de tener su propia fuente de ingresos, vende mariscos y pescados de manera ambulante. Gracias a los créditos otorgados por PANA PANA y financiados por KIVA, le han permitido crecer y establecer una pequeña pulpería. Está solicitando financiamiento para comprar más productos: granos básicos, chiverías, entre otros productos, lo que le permitirá vender más y generar más ingresos. Ella sueña con vender ropa nueva.
texts.en:
This group is comprides of three hardworking women (Jenny María, Esmeralda and Elvia). They came together three years ago with the purpose of applying for a loan to improve their living conditions, be able to cover their families' needs, guarantee their children's education, and expand their businesses.

JENNY MARÍA: She is the group's coordinator. She is a joyful woman, with leader skills and self-improvement goals. She belongs to the Miskita people from the municipality of Puerto Cabezas. She is 29 years old, married, and the mother of three children: the oldest one is 13 and is in sixth grade. The remaining two are still very young.

With the purpose of having her own source of income, she started selling seafood and fish as a street vendor. Thanks to the loans offered by Pana Pana, and financed by Kiva, she has been able to grow and open a small grocery store.

She is requesting a loan to buy more products, such as groceries and snacks. This will help her to sell more and increase her income. She dreams of selling new clothes.

loans.use: to buy more products, such as groceries and snacks.

loans.name: Abril Group

texts.es:
Está conformado por 3 mujeres de la etnia miskita de Bilwi, municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Son mujeres emprendedoras que tienen núcleo familiar, que las motiva luchar para mejorar sus ingresos y hacer crecer sus pequeños negocios. Decidieron nombrar al grupo solidario Abril, porque fue el mes que recibieron su primer financiamiento.

BIRDET LIZZETE: Es coordinadora del grupo solidario, es una mujer amable de 27 años de edad, con cualidades de líder, está casada, tiene 2 hijos: El mayor de 10 años cursa su quinto de educación primaria y un pequeño de 1 año de edad.
