Elabora nacatamales de viernes a domingo, de esta manera genera ingresos propios y contribuye con los gastos del hogar y los estudios de su hijo. Gracias a los créditos otorgados anteriormente por PANA PANA y financiados por KIVA, le han permitido diversificar su negocio y establecer una pequeña pulpería. El  préstamo que está solicitando es para incrementar la mercadería de productos básicos y otros para su venta de nacatamal, de manera que pueda mejorar sus ingresos y atender a más personas. Su sueño es tener un negocio próspero y construir su vivienda de concreto, ya que es de mayor durabilidad.
texts.en:
This group is made up of three women of Miskita ethnicity from the municipality of Puerto Cabezas. They are hardworking women with families that are their motivation for improving their income and growing their small businesses. They decided to call their group 'April' as that is when they received their first loan.

Birdet Lizzette is coordinator of this dedicated group. She is a friendly woman of 27 with the qualities of a leader. She is married and has two children; the older one is 10 and in grade 5, the younger one is one year old.

Birdet makes nacatamales (maize, meat and rice wrapped in a banana leaf) from Friday to Sunday. In this way she contributes to household finances and her son's education. Thanks to previous loans from PANA PANA and Kiva, Birdet has been able to diversify her business and start a small grocery store.

The loan she is seeking will be used to buy more merchandis such as basic supplies for the store and ingredients for the nacatamales. Then she will be able to increase her income and serve more customers. Her greatest wish is to have a prosperous business and also to build a more durable house made of concrete.

loans.use: buy more stock for her store and supplies for her nacatamales

loans.name: Isyaku

texts.en:
Isyaku is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Isyaku has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Isyaku would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Isyaku can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Isyaku will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Isyaku is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family, and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a maize farmer from Rumi village. As a Babban Gona member, Daniel is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Daniel would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member, Daniel can store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize, at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Daniel no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Daniel hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Fresa Roja Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario está conformado por 3 mujeres emprendedoras (Dora Rosario, Rosa Maricela y Cindy Alsira) de la ciudad de Bilwi, Municipio Puerto Cabezas, se unieron hace 8 meses, para acceder a financiamiento mediante crédito para incrementar el inventario de sus pequeños negocios de venta de  frutas y pulpería, para mejorar sus ingresos y poder cubrir las necesidades básicas de sus hogares, asegurar la educación de sus hijos, mejorar sus viviendas. Decidieron nombrar al grupo solidario FRESA ROJA, porque es una fruta exquisita y rica.

CINDY ALSIRA: Es integrante del grupo solidario, es una joven alegre y sonriente de 23 años de edad, con deseos de superación, casada con 2 hijos menores de edad. Con el propósito de contribuir con los gastos del hogar, vende tortillas, frijoles cocidos, queso, cuajadas y chicharrón en un tramo que alquila en uno de los mercados del municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Ella está solicitando financiamiento para comprar más productos. Sueña con establecer una abarrotería.
texts.en:
The three members of our community bank, all women--Dora Rosario, Rosa Maricela and Cindy Alsira--live in the city of Bilwi.  They started their group 8 months ago to access credit for funding their small businesses and, in turn, increasing their incomes.  The women hope this means of borrowing will help them to better cover household expenses, ensure their children can go to school and make improvements to their houses.  They call their community bank FRESA ROJA ["Red Strawberry"] for that attractive fruit.

Our member, Cindy Alsira, 23, is a friendly young woman.  She is married and has 2 young children.  She very much wants to get ahead in the world and started a food sales business in order to help with the family's expenses.  She sells tortillas, beans, cheese, curds and other foods from a stand that she rents in one of the markets at Puerto Cabezas.  She will use her share of this loan to stock her business with the supplies she needs and adds that she hopes to open a grocery one day.

loans.use: to stock her food sales business.

loans.name: Manzana Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario está conformado por 3 mujeres alegres y sonrientes (Perla, Patricia y Yaoska Angélica), pertenecen a la etnia miskita del municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Hace 4 años se organizaron como grupo solidario con el propósito de trabajar de manera solidaria para acceder a préstamos en Pana Pana y tener la oportunidad de mejorar sus pequeños negocios de venta de mariscos y pescados, incrementar sus ingresos.

PATRICIA: Es integrante del grupo solidario, es una señora de 49 años de edad, luchadora, con cualidades de líder, madre soltera de 4 hijos: 2 son mayores y 2 adolescentes que estudian su secundaria. Se dedica a la venta de pescado y mariscos que compra en la comunidad miskita Lamlaya, de esta manera ha sacado adelante a sus hijos. Está solicitando financiamiento para comprar más mariscos y pescados para vender más, incrementar sus ingresos y tener más clientes que demandan este producto que constituye uno de los alimentos básicos en Bilwi. Su sueño es llegar a tener una pulpería.
texts.en:
This group is comprised of three joyful and smiling women (Perla, Patricia and Yaoska Angélica). They belong to the Miskita people from the municipality of Puerto Cabezas. They started this group four years ago, with the intention to work together and apply for loans from Pana Pana, have the opportunity to improver their small seafood and fish businesses, and increase their income.

PATRICIA: She is a member of this group. She is 49 years old, a fighter and a skillful leader. She is a single mother and has four children: two are adults, and two teenagers who go to secondary school. She sells fish and seafood she buys in Lamlaya, a Miskita community. This is how she has made headway for her children.

She is requesting a loan to buy more seafood and fish to sell more, increase her income, and attract more customers interested in her products, which represent an essential food for people in Bilwi. Her dream is to one day have a grocery store.

loans.use: to buy more seafood and fish.

loans.name: Intesar

texts.en: Intesar is a married woman from Ramallah, West Bank. She lives with her family in a small, old house. She is the only breadwinner for her family and they depend on her for support. Intesar has a grocery store in the city . It is a good business and provides her a good income, but the economic situation in the West Bank is bad because of the latest conflict. Intesar took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development. This loan will help her to buy a new inventory to sell at her store. She hopes that this new inventory will enable her to increase her sales and customers, and eventually save enough income to cover school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy a new inventory to sell at her store

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is a young man who has a barber shop which has been open for the past seven years. He has now good experience and he is well known in his city, Deir Al-Balah. Mohammad loves his job and always thinks how to improve it. Mohammad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy new tools and make some decorations for his barber shop. This will improve his business and make his barber shop more attractive. Mohammad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy new tools and make some decorations for his barber shop.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is a married man from Rafah, Gaza Strip, which is both a city and a refugee camp. He lives with his family in a small, old house. He is the only breadwinner for his family and they depend on him for support. Ahmad has a grocery store in the city. It is a good business and it provides him with a good income, but the economic situation in the Gaza Strip is bad because of the latest conflict. Ahmad took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development. This loan will help him to buy a new goods and inventory to sell at his store. He hopes that this new inventory will enable him to increase his sales, customers, and, eventually, save enough income to cover school fees for his children.

loans.use: to buy a new goods and inventory to sell at his store.

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
Dina is a 45-year-old married mother of three. Five years ago, she started working in a bakery to help her husband in covering the increasing needs and expenses of their family. She has professional skills in baking "Saj" bread. 
Dina's family income is not enough to cover any additional expenses, thus today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay her daughter's school tuition fees. She hopes to open her own bakery in the future to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to pay her daughter's school tuition fees

loans.name: Shania Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario está conformado por 3 mujeres (Marlene, Niska Ivannia y Emely) de la etnia miskita,  de Bilwi, municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Son mujeres emprendedoras que continúan luchando día a día por hacer crecer sus pequeños negocios de venta de ropa usada, pulpería y ropa nueva. Con el préstamo que le brindo Kiva lograron incrementar sus inventarios en sus pequeños negocios, Niska ahora vende vestidos, camisetas y blusas.   

EMELY: Es integrante del grupo solidario, es una joven de 21 años de edad, sonriente y luchadora, madre soltera de un pequeño de 4 años de edad. Con el propósito de sacar adelante a su familia, genera sus propios ingresos vendiendo ropa usada de manera ambulante y en el corredor de su casa también exhibe las ropas que vende. Con el préstamo que está solicitando quiere comprar pacas de ropa mixta usada de mejor calidad para realizar las ventas más rápido.  Ella sueña con tener su propio tramo y vender ropa nueva.
texts.en:
This group is comprised of three women (Marlene, Niska Ivannia, and Emely) from the Miskita people from Bilwi, municipality of Puerto Cabezas. They are enterprising women who continue fighting every day to make their used clothes, grocery store, and new clothes businesses grow. With the loan they received from Kiva, they increased their stock levels in their small businesses. Niska is now selling dresses, shirts, and blouses.

EMELY: She is a member of this group. She is a 21-year-old woman. She is smiling and persistent. She is a single mother; her son is four years old. With the purpose of making headway for her family, she earns an income selling used clothes as a street vendor. She also exhibits and sells her clothes in her home's corridor.

She is requesting a loan to buy bales of mixed used clothes of better quality to sell her products more rapidly. She dreams of having her own establishment and selling new clothes.

loans.use: to buy bales of mixed used clothes of better quality.

loans.name: Sa L V Aje Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario está conformado por 3 mujeres luchadoras (Cristina, Katheen Bianka y Delita Richard) que se integraron hace aproximadamente año y medio, para gestionar  financiamiento mediante créditos con garantía solidaria, para comprar mercadería para sus pequeños negocios de venta de mariscos, repostería y pulpería respectivamente, y de esta manera mejorar sus ingresos. Todas ellas quieren mejorar sus condiciones de vida, para cubrir las necesidades básicas, asegurar la educación de sus hijos, mejorar sus viviendas.

KATHEEN BIANKA: Es integrante del grupo solidario, es una joven alegre y sonriente de 28 años de edad, originaria de Puerto Cabezas, casada, tiene 2 hijos en edad escolar que estudian su primaria. Con el propósito de tener su propia fuente de ingresos y contribuir con los gastos del hogar y educación de sus hijos, elabora pan artesanal en su vivienda de tambo y sus productos los vende de manera ambulante.  El préstamo que está solicitando es para  comprar más ingredientes e insumos para poder ofertar más cantidad de pan de coco, queque de yuca, arroz, banano y quequisque. Ella sueña con llegar a construir un anexo en su vivienda, para utilizarlo como local para su negocio y mejorar sus ingresos y así poder también contribuir en mejorar la calidad de vida de sus hijos y brindarles un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
The three members of our community bank, all women--Cristina, Katheen Bianka and Delita Richard--started their group a year-and-a-half ago to access credit for growing their small businesses: seafood sales, bread-making and grocery sales, respectively.  They hope this means of borrowing will help them to increase their incomes and, in turn, better cover household expenses, ensure that their children can go to school and make improvements to their houses.

Our member, Katheen Bianka, 28, is a friendly young woman.  She lives in Puerto Cabezas with her husband and 2 children, both of whom are in elementary school.  She started a bread-making business in order to help with family expenses and her children's schooling.  She operates the business from her modest house and goes from street to street to sell what she makes.  She is applying for a loan that she will use to buy the supplies she needs to make more pan de coco, yucca cakes and other pastries that she will resell.  For the future, she wants to add a space to her house that she can use for a shop.  She hopes to grow her business and build a better life for her children.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her bakery business.

loans.name: Belen - Quero Group

texts.es: Este es el grupo “Belen - Quero” y está formado por 06 integrantes responsables. Mayra de 27 años de edad es conviviente con 02 hijos menores de edad. Mayra se dedica a la Ganaderia. Desde muy pequeña se dedica  a la Ganadería junto a sus padres, gracias a su constante dedicación puede darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. Ella solicitó el crédito para la compra de vacunos y alimentos balanceados para sus ganados. El grupo “Belen - Quero” agradecen a los inversionistas Kiva por darles la oportunidad de conseguir sus metas. Mayra es la tercera que esta a la mano derecha chompa de color rosada y pantalón negro.
texts.en:
This is the "Belen - Quero" group.  It consists of 6 responsible members . 

Mayra is 27 years old, lives in a common law relationship and has 2 children under age. 

Mayra works with livestock. Since  she was very little, she has worked with livestock along with her parents.  Thanks to her constant dedication she is able to give her family a better quality of life. 

She is requesting a loan for the purchase of cattle feed and balanced food. 

The group "Belen - Quero" is grateful to Kiva lenders for the opportunity to achieve their goals.

Mayra is the third one to the right, wearing a pink colored sweater and black pants.

loans.use: to purchase cattle fee and balanced feed.

loans.name: Kamilia

texts.en: Kamilia is 37 years old and a mother of seven kids. She lives in Jenin. Her husband is a farmer, while she is a baby-sitter inside her house. Kamilia wants to earn more income in order to provide a better life for her kids, in their education and social life. So, she wants to improve her business. Therefore, she is requesting $1,500 from Kiva’s partner, ALIBDAA. Kamilia’s dream is to have a kindergarten in her village.

loans.use: to improve the sitter room and provide more materials, such as Lego and educational materials, etcetera.

loans.name: Samar

texts.en:
Samar is a 29-years-old married woman from Dier Al-Balah city. She lives with his husband and four kids in a simple house. Samar’s husband works as an employee in a local company where he gets a low income. This is the only source of income to the family. She would like to improve the family living conditions and buy some necessary items.

Samar took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy solar system and a water purification machine for the family house. By taking this loan, Samar will be able to provide clean water especially for his kids.
Samar appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy solar system and a water purification machine for the family house.

loans.name: Las Amigas Unidas Group

texts.es: Norma es una socia de la alcancía comunal "Las Amigas Unidas", el préstamo obtenido lo invirtió en la compra de productos lacteos al por mayor para así implementar su negocio, con eso ha podido aumentar su capital en su negocio, sus metas ahora es ampliar su pequeño puesto en el mercado vendiendo otros productos mas, además darle una mejor educación a sus hijos y así mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Norma está muy agradecida por todo el apoyo económico que se le ha dado, al igual que a los demás integrantes de la alcancía comunal "Las Amigas Unidas". Norma es la que esta con una al medio del grupo con mandil blanco y cruzada una cartera. Martha no se muestran en la fotografía porque no pudo asistir el día de la reunión por problemas personales.
texts.en:
Norma is one of the members of the "Las Amigas Unidas" [The United Friends] communal bank. She used the previous loan to buy dairy products in bulk to start her business. She has been able to increase her capital, and her goal is now to expand the small stall she has at the marketplace by selling more products. She also wants to give her children a better education, and improve her family's living conditions.

Norma is grateful for all the financial support she has received, and so are the other members of the "Las Amigas Unidas" communal bank. Norma is the one standing in the middle of the picture. She is wearing a white apron and has a purse crossed over her chest. Martha was not present when the picture was taken because she was going through some personal issues.

loans.use: to buy dairy products.

loans.name: Las Amigas Del Sector 12 Group

texts.es: Asunción es una socia de la alcancía comunal “Las Amigas del Sector 12”, el préstamo obtenido lo invirtió en la compra de mercadería de prendas de vestir al por mayor, con eso ha podido aumentar su capital en su negocio, sus metas ahora es ampliar su puesto para vender zapatos, además darle una mejor educación a sus hijos y así mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Asunción está muy agradecida por todo el apoyo económico que se le ha dado, al igual que a los demás integrantes de la alcancía comunal "Las Amigas del Sector 12". Asunción es la que esta con una casaca marrón y pantalón negro con cartera beige.
texts.en:
Asunción is one of the members of the "Las Amigas del Sector 12" [Friends from Sector 12] communal bank. She used the previous loan to buy clothes in bulk, which helped her to increase her capital. Her goal is now to enlarge her stall to sell shoes. She also wants to give her children a better education, and improve her family's living conditions.

Asunción is grateful for all the financial support she has received, and so are the other members of the "Las Amigas del Sector 12" communal bank. Asunción is the one wearing a brown coat and black pants. She also has a beige purse.

loans.use: to buy clothes in bulk.

loans.name: Buenos Aire Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario BUENOS AIRES está conformado por 3 mujeres (Alicia, Maggy y Lumeriana), todas son indígenas  miskitas de la ciudad de Bilwi, municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Son mujeres emprendedoras que  venden mariscos y bastimentos, con cuyos ingresos aportan para las necesidades básicas de sus hogares. Se organizaron hace dos meses para acceder a préstamos con garantía solidaria en Pana Pana.

LUMERIANA: Es integrante del grupo solidario, es una señora amable de 45 años de edad, casada con 3 dos en edad escolar que estudian su primaria. Se dedica a la venta de bastimentos y elaboracion pan artesanal en su vivienda de tambo y sus productos los vende de manera ambulante.  El préstamo que está solicitando es para  comprar más ingredientes e insumos para poder ofertar más cantidad de pan de coco, queque de yuca, arroz, banano, quequisque y comprar frutas y verduras, de esta manera genera ingresos propios que le ayudan a solventar  la alimentación de sus hijos y luchar para brindarle los estudios a sus hijos. Ella sueña con llegar a contar con suficiente capital para establecer una pulpería.
texts.en:
The members of the BUENOS AIRES community bank, all women--Alicia, Maggy and Lumeriana--are native Miskitas who live in the city of Bilwi.  These enterprising women run businesses that provide incomes for supporting their families.  They started their group two months ago to access credit from Pana Pana for supporting their businesses.

Our member, Lumeriana, 45, is a friendly woman.  She is married and has 3 children, two of whom are in elementary school.  She operates a bakery business from her small house and works as a street vendor, going from street to street to sell what she makes.  She is applying for a loan that she will use to buy the supplies she needs to make pan de coco, yucca cakes and the other pastries she sells.  The investment will allow her to support her children and continue fighting for their educations.  For the future, she would like to pull enough money together to open a corner grocery.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her bakery business.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is a young man who has a barber shop which has been open for the past seven years. He has now good experience and he is well known in his city, Gaza City. Mohammad loves his job and always thinks how to improve it. Mohammad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new steam machine to clean skin for his barber shop.This will improve his business and make his barber shop more attractive. Mohammad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new steam machine to clean skin for his barber shop.

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en:
Jesusa raises hogs to support the needs of her entire family. She has been engaged in hog raising for many years now. She hails from the town of Bilar, Bohol. She is married and has four grown children.

Aside from raising hogs, she also sells firewood to her neighbors. She needs funds to support her existing businesses. She has requested a loan to invest in feed and piglets. These could boost her income and slowly enable her to expand, which will enable her to support her family and provide better living conditions.

Jesusa is hoping that, some day, she will be financially stable and sustainable.

loans.use: to  invest in feed and piglets.

loans.name: Chhort's Group

texts.en:
Chhort is 42 years old and a resident of Battambang province. She is married and blessed with five dependent children, one of whom is in school while the other four are under school age. She has been growing rice for years to earn her main source of income. Moreover, she works for others for a fee to supplement her income. The daily income of this family is about $9 per day and she can save about $6 each day for future needs. Drought is the main challenge to the rice growing business.
 
In a group of five members, Chhort is the leader. This is the first loan cycle for her with VisionFund. She is planning to use her loan portion to buy rice seeds and organic fertilizer to increase more yields, and to cover the expense of plowing and harvesting. She hopes that she will earn more income to expand her current business and to keep sending her child to school.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds and organic fertilizer to increase her rice outputs as well as her income to keep supporting on her child's studying.

loans.name: Sary's Group

texts.en: Sary’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Sary makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Bronce Group

texts.es:
Es un grupo solidario mixto, conformado por un varón y 2 mujeres emprendedoras (José Santana, Neysi y Marlene), originarias de la ciudad de Bilwi, municipio de Puerto Cabezas, se unieron hace 8 meses con el propósito de trabajar de manera solidaria para poder acceder a préstamos en Pana Pana,  para tener la oportunidad de mejorar sus pequeños negocios de productos básicos, mejorar sus ingresos y así mejorar la calidad de vida de sus familias. Decidieron nombrar al grupo solidario BRONCE, porque es un metal precioso, sólido y fuerte como los integrantes del grupo solidario.

MARLENE: Es integrante del grupo solidario, tiene 36 años de edad, casada, tiene dos hijos. Con el propósito de tener su propia fuente de ingresos, estableció una pequeña pulpería Gracias a los créditos otorgados por PANA PANA y financiados por KIVA, le han permitido tener una carnicería. Solicita financiamiento para comprar más mercadería para su pulpería y carnicería poder tener más ingresos de la venta. Sueña con llegar a tener una ferretería.
texts.en:
The three members of our community bank, a man and two women--José Santana, Neysi and Marlene--live in the city of Bilwi.  They started their group 8 months ago to access credit from Pana Pana for supporting their small businesses.  They hope this means of borrowing will increase their incomes and, in turn, help them to better support their families.  They call their group BRONCE ["Bronze"] because bronze is a precious metal and, like them, solid and strong.  

Our member, Marlene, 36, is married and has two children.  She started her own grocery because she wanted an income of her own.  Thanks to a Kiva loan, managed by PANA PANA, she was able to add meat sales to her grocery.  She is applying for a new loan that she will use to stock her meat & grocery business with the merchandise that she needs to carry on the business.  For the future, she hopes to add hardware sales.

loans.use: to stock her meat & grocery business.

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en:
Avelina is a native from the town of Bilar, Bohol. She tills the land and grows rice. She has been farming rice for five years now. She is married and has five children aged from 5 to 20 years. Her husband's way of earning is by being a carpenter. Aside from farming, she raises and sells hogs to meet the needs of the entire family.

She owns a rice paddy and sells rice to the local residents in her area. She faces challenges in her livelihood: the lack of capital and the high cost of farm maintenance.

Avelina has requested a loan from CEVI to purchase piglets and fertilizers. These would help her boost and improve the yield of her farm. It would enable her to provide for her family's needs and continue to expand her farm to become more sustainable in the future.

She is grateful to Kiva for the support.

loans.use: to purchase piglets and fertilizers

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Vilma works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines and also earns income from fish vending.

Vilma is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fish nets, gasoline, and other fishing supplies for her fishing business. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fish nets, gasoline, and other fishing supplies.

loans.name: Liljana

texts.en:
Liljana and her three young children live in the house seen in the photograph. She is photographed inside the house and you can tell how poorly her family lives. This past year, Liljana has started doing a job, working in the fields of others. Her husband has started working in construction. From the chestnuts they recently harvested, 8 quintals at a price of $0.9/kg.

Liljana needs your financial help again this time to help her improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to improve the living conditions of her children by making some basic repairs to the family home

loans.name: Merlina

texts.en:
Merlina is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Merlina is 47 years old and has four children, who are in school.

Merlina has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has requested a 13,500 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fish nets, gasoline and other supplies.

Merlina has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish nets, gasoline and other supplies

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is married and has four children. She works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines. Susan earns additional income from fish vending.

Susan is requesting her fourth loan from NWTF for 13,000 PHP, which she will use to buy fish nets, gasoline, and other fishing supplies for her fishing business. She hopes to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase fish nets, gasoline, and other fishing supplies.

loans.name: Las Divas Group

texts.es:
Está conformado por 3 mujeres emprendedoras (Merylu Magdalena, Paulina Auxiliadora y Kiara Yazuara), originarias de la ciudad de Bilwi, municipio de Puerto Cabezas, se unieron hace 4 meses con el propósito de trabajar de manera solidaria para  acceder a préstamos en Pana Pana y tener la oportunidad de mejorar sus pequeños negocios de venta de ropa nueva, calzado y comideria, mejorar sus ingresos y calidad de vida de sus familias.

Paulina Auxiliadora: Es integrante del grupo solidario, es una señora alegre y sonriente de 53 años de edad, madre soltera de 6 hijos: 4 mayores de edad y 2 que estudian su secundaria. Con el propósito de tener su propia fuente de ingresos y sacar adelante a sus hijos, recuerda con gran entusiasmo que inicio vendiendo bastimento, frijoles cocidos, gracias a los créditos otorgados por PANA PANA y financiados por KIVA, le han permitido diversificar sus productos, actualmente vende frito y comida tradicional de la Región del Caribe Norte. Solicita financiamiento para comprar en Masaya y Managua ropa nueva y calzado, venderla a precios accesibles a su clientela y poder tener más ingresos de la venta. Sueña con llegar a tener su propio tramo.
texts.en:
The 3 members of our community bank, all women--Merylu Magdalena, Paulina Auxiliadora and Kiara Yazuara--live in the city of Bilwi.  They started their group 4 months ago to access credit from PANA PANA for growing their clothing, footwear and food sales businesses.  They hope this means of borrowing will increase their incomes and, in turn, their families' quality of life.  

Our member, Paulina Auxiliadora, 53, is a friendly woman.  She is a single mother and has 6 children: 4 of whom are grown and 2 in high school.  She started a food sales business because she needed an income and a way to support her children.  She sold beans and other prepared foods and thanks to a Kiva loan, managed by PANA PANA, was able to expand, adding other prepared foods traditional to this part of the Caribbean.  She is applying for a new loan that she will use to buy clothing and footwear in Masaya and Managua that she will resell.  The investment will allow her to sell the merchandise at reasonable prices and give her an extra income. She hopes to buy a kiosk of her own one day.

loans.use: to stock her clothing & footwear business with merchandise that she will buy in Masaya and Managua.

loans.name: May

texts.en:
May is a 37-year-old woman. She is a mother of two children, ages 13 and 6 years old. With her eagerness to help her husband, she managed to establish her own business, a small store in Estancia, Iloilo. From there, she generates very good income, which is invested in her children’s school fees and food for the household.

May is asking a loan to buy stock such as canned goods, noodles, spices, toiletries, laundry soap, chips, chocolate bars and candies, biscuits, coffee, sugar, drinks and other personal care products.

Her greatest dream is to be successful and to maintain their profitability.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, spices, toiletries, laundry soap, chips, chocolate bars and other personal care products.

loans.name: Ana Paula

texts.es: Ana de 49 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de medicina natural desde hace mas de 2 años, su negocio esta ubicado cerca de su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes por la calidad de los productos y los buenos precios con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas productos por mayor para poder continuar con sus ventas y asi tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en: Ana is 49 years old and lives in her own home with her two sons. For the last two years she has made a living by selling natural medicines. Her business is located close to her house, she has many customers thanks to the quality of her products and her prices. The income she makes allows her to pay for household expenses. She is asking for a loan to buy more stock wholesale so she can continue selling and increase her income.

loans.use: to buy natural medicines wholesale.

loans.name: Smile Simile Group

texts.en:
Mrs Hiền is 51 years old and she is married. She has had a retail business selling dry food and general things for 10 years. Hiền lives in Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover the market need is low in this region.
The main hardship that Hiền faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more goods to resell.

In 2010, Hiền joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Hiền has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.

With her business profit, Hiền hopes for her children to find a good job, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to resell in her general store

location.town: Nhóm 12, thôn 2, Thiệu Vận, Thiệu Hóa

loans.name: Ribka

texts.en:
Ribka is a 31 year-old-woman who has 5 children. She is married to Daniel, a handyman. Ribka is selling vegetables such as kangkung, eggplant, mustard greens, tomatoes, chilies etc at home based. The income generated from her business is averaging IDR 45,000 – 50,000 per day. From that income, Ribka could manage to finance her family needs including children’s schooling expenses.

On the other hand, Ribka wants to expand her business by making and selling cakes but she cannot realized that dream due to limited working capital. Fortunately she heard from one of her neighbor about TLM’s loan product and finally applied for IDR 3,000,000. She received the loan last week and plans to be spending on wheat flour, eggs, cooking oil, firewood, etc.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour, eggs, cooking oil, firewood, etc. to make cakes for sale

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia is 49 years old and married with five children. With one child in school, Sonia works very hard to provide for her family.

Sonia runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, like canned goods, noodles, home-care products, and other groceries. Sonia has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Sonia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like canned goods, noodles, home-care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Loutis

texts.en:
Loutis is 36 years old and married with three children. With three children in school, Loutis works very hard to provide for them.

Loutis runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries.

Loutis has been in this business for 9 years and sells a variety of items. 

In the future, Loutis would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is 48 years old and married with four children. With two children in school, Rosalie works very hard to provide for them.

Rosalie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, home product care, and other groceries.

Rosalie has been in this business for 13 years and sells a variety of items. 

In the future, Rosalie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Roqueza

texts.en:
Roqueza is 45 years old and married with eleven children. With five children in school, she works very hard to provide for her family.

Roqueza runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, like canned goods and personal-care products. Roqueza has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Roqueza would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like canned goods and personal-care products

loans.name: Jeca

texts.en:
Jeca is 24 years old with one child. Jeca works very hard to provide for them.

Jeca runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a loan of 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy items such as soft drinks, biscuits and candies to sell.

Jeca has been in this business for 4 years. In the future, Jeca would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items such as soft drinks, biscuits and candies to sell.

loans.name: Quiteria

texts.pt:
Quitéria tem 38 anos e casada e tem um filho de 20 anos. Ela mora com sua família na comunidade de Mauá São Paulo. Quiteria é uma pessoa que tem objetivos de vida e, sincera e discreta, gosta de estar com as pessoas e sente feliz no que faz .Quiteria se uniu ao Banco do Povo Crédito Solidário (BPCS) para ter acesso aos serviços financeiros e este é o 8 empréstimos com BPCS.
Qiuteria é cabeleireira  a mais de nove anos. Ela ama o seu trabalho por que pode ficar  mais próximo de seus  familiares .Ela sempre trabalhou como vendedora ,vendia  bijuterias e cosméticos.Decidiu trabalhar como cabeleireira porque sempre gostou da área da beleza. Ela diz que este trabalho e como uma terapia  ela  ganhar dinheiro fazendo o que gosta e se divertindo com suas clientes.
Este empréstimo será para a compra de kits e produtos de beleza. Os kits são para dar como brinde para  fidelizar as suas clientes. Ela vai fazer promoção de final de ano para captar mais clientes.A renda extra deste empréstimo permitirá que aprimore o seu trabalho , ela faz cursos , investe em mais produtos e as vezes tira uma parte para o lazer. No futuro, ela planeja abrir um salão em outro estado (Pernambuco) e também comprar um carro. 
Quitéria  gostaria de dizer aos investidores  que se sente  emocionada e importante em saber que outras pessoas querem ajudar.Ela sente muito  orgulhosa de sua atividade porque ama o que faz, e ajudar no sustento da casa. o seu trabalho a faz sentir  muito importante por que ela ajuda  outras pessoas  aumentar  a sua auto estima, trabalha com amor e suas clientes sente orgulho disso.
texts.en:
Quitéria is 38 years old and married with a 20-year-old son. She lives with her family in the community of Mauá in São Paulo. 

Quitéria is a person who has life goals and, sincere and discreet, likes being around other epeople. Quitéria joined Kiva Partner Banco do Povo Crédito Solidário (BPCS) to have access to financial services and this is her 8th loan with BPCS.

Quitéria has been a hairdresser for more than nine years. She loves her job because it allows her to be closer to her family. She always worked as a saleswoman, selling trinkets and cosmetics. She decided work as a hairdresser because she always liked the idea of working in the beautification field. She says this work is more like therapy, and she makes money doing what she loves and having fun with her customers.

This loan will be for the purchase of beauty kits and products. The kits are to give as a gift to her loyal customers, given as year-end promotion to attract more customers. The extra income from this loan will allow her to enhance her work through the courses she takes, investments in new products, and she hopes to use some for leisure. In the future, she plans to open a salon in another state (Pernambuco) and also buy a car.

Quitéria would like to say to Kiva lenders that she feels thrilled and happy to know that other people want to help. She is very proud of her business because she loves what she does, and it helps to support her family. Her work makes her feel very important because it helps other people increase their self esteem, and she loves her work, and her clients feel proud.

loans.use: to buy beauty products and kits

loans.name: Ailyn

texts.en:
Ailyn is 32 years old and married with three children. With three children in school, Ailyn works very hard to provide for them.

Ailyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries.

Ailyn has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items. 

In the future, Ailyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Nova Esperança Ix Group

texts.pt:
O grupo Nova Esperança XI se conhecem há muitos anos,são todos vizinhos e moram na mesma comunidade em Mauá.O grupo já solicitou 3 empréstimos com o Banco do Povo Crédito Solidário (BPCS).
Dona Sonia é a líder do grupo. Ela tem 53 anos é casada e tem duas filhas e dois netos. Ela mora com seu esposo  na comunidade de Mauá em São Paulo. Sonia e uma pessoa batalhadora e vencedora. Já passou por muitas dificuldades na vida e venceu devido a sua força de vontade.
Sonia vende produtos de cama, mesa, banho, tapetes feitos de barbantes que ela mesma fabrica. Com este empréstimo ela vai comprar barbantes, linhas, agulhas e toalhas. Sonia tem uma grande clientela onde mora, quase não consegue atender a todos, vende muito. Ela trabalha há mais de 30 anos para se sustentar e ajudar sua família. Com os lucros Sonia investe em mais  mercadorias e ajuda a as filhas e os netos . Começou trabalhar vendendo de porta em porta, por que na época seu esposo estava desempregado. Como deu certo e ela gostou continuou vendendo ate hoje.Sonia tem um sonho de comprar sua casa própria, abrir uma confeitaria para trabalhar com Buffet. Pretende também ter um espaço na sua casa para ampliar  suas vendas. Sua atividade e especial por que ela se sente feliz, trabalha com muito amor e tudo que conseguiu quer retribuir algum dia. Sonia gosta de ajudar pessoas e sente-se triste e chora quando não pode  ajudar. 
Sonia  gostaria falar para os investidores que “Estou feliz  pelo apoio.É uma ação muito bonita ajudar pessoas que não conhecem.” Ela  parabeniza a todos os investidores por confiar em seu grupo e acreditar.
texts.en:
The New Hope XI group has known each other for many years, and are all neighbors and live in the same community Mauá.

The group has already had three loans with Kiva Partner Banco do Povo Crédito Solidário (BPCS).

Dona Sonia is the leader of the group. She is 53 years old, married and has two daughters and two grandchildren. She lives with her husband in Mauá community in São Paulo. Sonia is a determined and strong-willed person. She has experienced many difficulties in life and won because of her willpower. Sonia sells blankets, bathmats, and small rugs that she makes her self. With this loan she will buy yarn, thread, needles and fabric. 

Sonia has a large clientele where she lives, and can almost can serve all of her customers, given the demand. She worked for over 30 years to support herself and help her family. With profits Sonia invests in more merchandise, and helps her daughters and grandchildren. She began by working door-to-door when her husband was unemployed. 

Because her business was successful and she liked the activity, she continued selling until today.Sonia has a dream of buying her own home and opening a pastry shop with a buffet. She also plans to create a space in her home to increase her sales. Her business is meaningful to her because it makes her happy, she works with love and hopes to pay it back someday. Sonia likes to help people and feels sad and cries when she cannot help. 

Sonia would talk to investors that "I'm happy for your support, it is a very kind thing to help people who you do not know." She applauds all of the lenders for trusting and believing in her group.

loans.use: to buy yarn, thread, needles and fabric.

loans.name: Maria

texts.pt:
Maria tem 43 anos e casada tem 3 filhos com idade de 21, 17 e 15 anos todos os filhos estão frequentando a escola atualmente. Ela mora com seu esposo e seus filhos na comunidade de Mauá  em São Paulo. Maria e uma pessoa simples, sincera, muito exigente. O seu comercio é muito bem organizado. Maria tem 7 empréstimos com o Banco do Povo Crédito Solidário (BPCS) .Ela tem uma mercearia ha 3 anos. Ela decidiu abrir os seu próprio negocio para ficar mais perto da família, sempre trabalhou em casa vendendo sorvete e cachorro quente e como tinha muitos cliente decidiu ampliar para mercearia. A atividade dela e especial para ela porque ela trabalha perto da família e ajuda no sustento da casa. 
Maria  precisa de um empréstimo para comprar,sorvetes, chocolates, frutas, legumes e também comprar uma balança. A renda extra deste empréstimo permitirá que continue investindo na própria atividade e ajudando os filhos. No futuro, ela planeja abrir outra mercearia, e comprar um carro. 
Maria  gostaria dizer aos investidores  que se sente grata pela confiança. Ela é orgulhosa da sua atividade porque gosta de ser seu próprio patrão, e pode trabalha perto da família acompanhando o crescimento dos filhos.
texts.en:
Maria is 43 years old, married, and has 3 children aged 21, 17 and 15 years, who are all currently attending school. She lives with her husband and their children in the Mauá community in São Paulo. 

Mary is a simple, sincere, very strong willed person. Her business is very well organized. Maria has already taken out 7 loans with Kiva Partner Banco do Povo Crédito Solidário (BPCS).

She has run a grocery shop for three years. She decided to open her own business to be closer her to family, and she has always worked at home, first selling ice cream and hot dogs, and as she had a high number of clients she decided to sell groceries as well. Her business is meaningful for her because she works close to her family and this helps in the upkeep of her home.

Maria needs a loan to buy ice cream, chocolates, fruits, and vegetables as well as buy a scale. The extra income from this loan will enable her to continue investing her business and helping her children. In the future, she plans to open another grocery store, and buy a car.

Maria would like to say to her Kiva lenders that she feels grateful for their trust. She is proud of her business because she likes to be her own boss, and can work close to the family and see her children grow up.

loans.use: to buy desserts and fresh produce for her self-run business

loans.name: Solitogtokh

texts.en:
Solitogtokh, 45 years old, lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been working as truck driver for a private firm since 2012. His wife renders taxi service to local people. Their children go to university.

He is requesting a loan of 2,000 USD to install electric heat in his house. By doing so, his family will live in a comfortable and warm place, where less coal is burned for heating, releasing less pollutants into the air.

loans.use: to install electric heat in his house.

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es: Don Jose de 53 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, su hija, su sobrina y su suegra, el posee desde hace mas de 9 años una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia sus clientes son los vecinos y con lo que obtiene de sus ventas es como ha podido salir adelante con su familia, el esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas mercaderia como sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
53-year-old José owns a house where he lives with his wife, his daughter, his niece, and his mother-in-law. He has had a small store for nine years, located at home. His customers are his neighbors, and he has managed to get ahead with his family with what he earns.

He is requesting a loan to buy more products to sell, such as soups, eggs, foodstuff, beverages, candies, and sweet bread. This will result in a better income, and thus in better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more products to sell, such as soups, eggs, foodstuff, beverages, candies, and sweet bread.

loans.name: Dominga

texts.en:
Dominga has been raising hogs for many years now. She resides in the town of Batuan, Bohol.  She is a 66-year-old married woman and she has seven grown  children. She would like to continue to expand and improve her piggery business.  She decided to join KIVA's field partner, CEVI to access a loan.

Dominga needs funds to support her business. She has requested a loan to buy feeds and vitamin. In that way, she could start to raise and sell quality hogs. For the future, Dominga is hoping that she could continue to manage her livelihood so that it becomes sustainable.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamin

loans.name: Ma.terisa

texts.en:
Terisa is 46 years old and married with five children. With four of her children in school, Terisa works very hard to provide for them.

Terisa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,500 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items like canned goods, snack foods, home care products and other groceries for resale.

Terisa has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Terisa would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items like canned goods, snack foods, home care products and groceries for resale.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en: Mahmoud is a 46-year-old married father of four. Fifteen years ago, he started selling car spare parts to cover his family's living. He is a hard worker and sacrificing father who deprives himself for the sake of his children. Today, Mahmoud is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay his children's school tuition fees. He hopes to expand his business more in the future to increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to pay his children's school tuition fees

loans.name: Zorigtbaatar

texts.en: Mr. Zorigtbaatar, 49 years old, lives with his wife and three children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been working as an electrician at a kindergarten since 2010. His wife is a cook and works at a kindergarten also. Their children go to university. He is requesting a loan of 1,000 USD to buy a Mongolian traditional ger (portable felt dwelling) on his land. The ger will be used by his elder son who is marrying in early 2016.

loans.use: to buy a Mongolian traditional ger (portable felt dwelling)

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.en:
Eugenia is thankful for Kiva and its lenders who support small business owners like her. The previous loan that was granted to her really helped sustain her food stall business.

She believes that you could again assist her livelihood by lending her funds in the amount of 19,000 PHP to buy raw ingredients such as meat, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings, as well as cooking utensils needed for her food stall business.

Her earnings help support her family and meet their daily basic needs. She is thankful to the Lord and to you for the financial help that you'll extend to her.

Eugenia dreams that all of her hard work will bear fruit to give her family a bright future. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy meat, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings, as well as cooking utensils.

loans.name: Fabio Jesús

texts.es: Fabio es un joven de 19 años que reside en compañía de sus padres en un barrio del municipio de Soledad, actualmente es estudiante de una carrera universitaria y  tiene muchos deseos de triunfar en la vida, él encontró en el comercio de mercancías una oportunidad de generar sus propios ingresos, actividad que inició por el consejo de un amigo quien vendía mercancías y logró contactarlo con sus proveedores.  Hoy en día su negocio se ha convertido en la principal fuente de ingreso, permitiéndole ayudar a sus padres y costear sus gastos personales e incluso los gastos generados por su actividad académica.  Para Fabio es muy importante mantener un surtido con nuevos diseños de prendas de vestir, colonias y accesorios que ofrece a sus compañeros de estudio, vecinos y referidos, es por ello que está  a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para comprar prendas de vestir y calzado que es de gran demanda en la temporada navideña. Fabio a futuro se proyecta como propietario de un almacén, con sus estudios culminados y ejerciendo su profesión.
texts.en:
Fabio, 19, lives with his parents in the town of Soledad. He is currently a university student and wishes to succeed in life.

Through merchandise trading, he has found an opportunity to generate his own income. He started this work on the advice of a friend who sold merchandise and put him in touch with his suppliers.

Today his business has become his main source of income, allowing him to help out his parents and pay for their personal expenses, as well as his school expenses. It is very important to Fabio that he maintain an assortment of new styles of clothing, colognes and accessories to offer to his clients. This is why he is asking for a Kiva loan, his first funding through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, so he can buy clothing and footwear in high demand for the holiday season.

In the future, with his studies finished, Fabio plans to be a store owner.

loans.use: buy clothing and footwear in high demand for the holiday season.

loans.name: Jahara

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Jahara works hard to support her family.

She has a retail business selling purified drinking water in the Philippines, and earns additional income from food vending.

Jahara is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy additional stock of purified water to sell to customers.

Jahara has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money in order to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of purified water to sell to customers.

loans.name: Merylou

texts.en:
Merylou is 47 years old and married with two children. With one child in school, Merylou works very hard to provide for her family.

Merylou runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her store, like canned goods, snack foods, home care products, and other groceries.

Merylou has been in this business for eight years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Merylou would like to save enough money in order to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snack foods, home care products, and other groceries for resale in her store.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en: Nida is 50 years old and has two children. Nida is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Nida requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock. Nida has been in this business for two years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Nida would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Osu Nyame Bekyere Group

texts.en:
Meet the members of the osu nyame bekyere Group of two members by the name Barbara and Yaw. They are from Chorkor, Accra, a city in Ghana. They are all local entrepreneurs who sell stationary and slippers. This is their second and sixth respective loan from ID-Ghana, a partner of Kiva and they are applying for a loan of GHS 3400.00GHS in total. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more sales, and consequently, improve their living conditions.

Barbara is the featured leader of this group. The 38-year-old is married and a trader. Together with her husband, she has a child to take care of. Barbara has been a businesswoman for 8 years now. She sells stationary. With her share of this loan, she will buy more stationary equipment to sell to customers. They will hold each other responsible for the repayment of the loan.

loans.use: to buy more stationary equipment to sell to customers.

loans.name: Idris

texts.en:
Idris is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Idris has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Idris would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Idris can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 
As a Babban Gona member, Idris will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. 

Idris is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Hạnh's Group

texts.en:
Mrs Hạnh is 45 years old and she is married with 2 children.
 
She has worked in agriculture raising poultry for more than 10 years.
Hạnh lives in Hau Loc district, a semi-urban town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover the market need is low in this region. 
The main hardship that Hạnh faces is lack of capital.  She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in future.
In 2015, Hạnh joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her  business. Hạnh has successfully repaid 3 loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.
She is the group leader of the Hạnh's group, which consists of 3 members.
With her business profit, Hạnh hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in future.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria (29) is a married woman and has 3 children; two of them are at elementary school. Most women in her village are working as vegetable sellers and Maria is one of them. She has been running the business for 7 years and she works from 4 am to 9 am every day. In the afternoon she has to buy vegetables from the farmer to be sold on the following day. The rest of day is totally given for her family.

Lately, Maria is thinking about initiating a pig breeding business. The pig will be fed for one or two months and sold for Christmas and New Year’s celebration later. Therefore she joined with TLM’s loan product and received amounting of IDR 3,000,000. This loan support will enable her to buy 1 piglet and more vegetables to be sold.

loans.use: to buy 1 piglet and more vegetables to be sold.

loans.name: Tres De Mayo De Ancachuro Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “TRES DE MAYO DE ANCACHURO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.                                                                                                                                                                                             
La socia es la Sra. Marleni, la socia tiene 30 años de edad tiene 04 hijos y es conviviente, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose a la crianza de animales menores como chanchos entre otros, la socia es  una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia cría  a sus animales para luego venderlos a sus clientes que le solicitan en las distintas ferias que se realizan por la zona, siendo de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
 Los socios en general agradecen  a quienes forman parte de este sueño  y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de chanchos.
 Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de agricultura, negocio de venta de tienda de abarrotes, negocio de venta de ganadería y negocio de crianza de animales.
La socia que sale adjunta a la foto pidió permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.
La persona que sale con la cara tapada no pertenece al banco comunal.
texts.en:
These are the members of the "Tres de mayo de Ancachuro" communal bank. This bank is located in the Anta district, which belongs to the Anta province and the Cusco department.

Marleni is one of the members. She is 30 years old, has four children, and lives in a common-law marriage. She has different activities, such as raising pigs. She is a responsible and persistent person. She raises farm animals and then sells them to her customers, who come to her at the different local fairs. This is how she continues supporting her family.

All the members want to thank those who are part of this dream, and promise to pay the installments according to plan.

Marleni requested a loan to buy pigs.

The remaining members work in agriculture, sell groceries, sell cattle, and raise and sell farm animals.

The member whose picture was attached to the original one, could not come on time because she had to work. The person whose face is erased is not a member of the communal bank.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is 59 years old and married with five children. Lilia works very hard to provide for them.

Lilia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, school supplies and other groceries.

Lilia has been in this business for 31 years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Lilia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, school supplies and other groceries.

loans.name: Amilcar De Jesus

texts.es: Amilcar de 48 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hijo, el se dedica a la venta de medicina popular desde hace mas de 7 años vende de manera ambulante por los diferentes mercados que se encuntran cerca de su casa, gracias a su trabajo es como el puede solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas medicina popular por mayor para poder continuar con su trabajo y asi poder generar mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en:
Amilcar, 48, owns a house where he lives with his wife and son. He has been selling traditional medicines as a street vendor for more than seven years, visiting the different local marketplaces. Thanks to this job, he is able to cover some of the home expenses.

He is requesting a loan to buy more traditional medicines in bulk in order to be able to continue working, and in that way increase his income.

loans.use: to buy traditional medicines in bulk.

loans.name: Madel Omar

texts.es: Madel de 41 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, el se dedica a realizar viajes en su pick up desde hace 10 años, tiene muchos clientes que lo prefieren por la responsabilidad que tiene a la hora de manejar, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar los gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, el está solicitando un crédito para darle mantenimiento a su vehículo ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y poder tener mejor calidad de vida
texts.en:
Madel is 41 years old and lives in his own house with his family.  He works by providing trips in his pickup for 10 years.

He has many customers who prefer him due to his being very responsible when driving.

With the earnings from his work he is able to cover the costs he has for his home life.

He is requesting a loan for maintenance on his vehicle for that is his only source of work, and to have better quality of life

loans.use: to maintain his vehicle

loans.name: Antonieta

texts.en:
Antonieta is 50 years old and married with three children. With three children in school, Antonieta works very hard to provide for them.

Antonieta runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries.

Antonieta has been in this business for 3 years and sells a variety of items. 

In the future, Antonieta would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, home product care and other groceries.

loans.name: Rosavilla

texts.en:
Rosavilla is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 39 years old and has four children who are in school. She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines.

Rosavilla has requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy spare parts and other materials needed for the maintenance of her business. She has been in this business for six years. In the future, Rosavilla would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and other materials needed for the maintenance of her business.

loans.name: Virgen Purificada Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “VIRGEN PURIFICADA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.                                                                                                                                                                                             
La socia es la Sra. Vilma, la socia continua dedicándose a alquilar habitaciones para familia o estudiantes quienes le solicitan, la socia es una mujer emprendedora que espera con su negocio obtener ganancias para de esta forma continuar apoyando a su familia, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual hasta ahora le trae satisfacciones personales entre otros, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
La socia solicito el crédito para reparar uno de los cuartos. 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de librería, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de servicio de taxi.
texts.en:
These are the members of the "Virgen Purificada" communal bank. This communal bank is located in the Cusco distrcit, which belongs to the Cusco province of the Cusco department.

Vilma, one of the members, continues renting out rooms for families or students. She is an enterprising woman who hopes to make profits with her business in order to continue supporting her family. She has had this business for quite some time now, and it has given her lots of satisfaction. This is how she gets ahead with her family.

She wants to thank those who are part of this dream through this means, and promises to pay the installments according to plan.

She requested this loan to repair one of her bedrooms.

The remaining members work in a bookstore, sell clothes, sell groceries, and drive a taxi.

loans.use: to repair one of her bedrooms.

loans.name: Leoncio

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal "Unión, Fuerza Amistad" de la Asociación Arariwa.
El socio continua con su negocio de compra de carros usados para luego desarmarlos y después vender sus partes como chatarra en una feria sabatina, el socio lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día  a su negocio, el socio es una persona responsable y espera que mediante su negocio el socio pueda obtener más ganancias y de esta manera el socio pueda continuar apoyando a su familia.
El socio solicito el crédito para la compra de faros entre otros.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the community bank "Union, Fuerza, Amistad" of the Arariwa Association.  

He continues with his business of buying used cars which he then dismantles and sells for parts or as scrap at the Saturday market.  

This member has been doing this type of business for some time now and is doing well thanks to the effort he puts into it each day.

This member is a responsible person and hopes that through his business he can make more profit and thus be able to continue supporting his family.

The member is requesting a loan for the purchase of lights among others.

loans.use: for the purchase of lights among others.

loans.name: Cherry

texts.en:
Cherry hails from the rural town of Carmen, Bohol. She is a thirty-seven-year-old married woman with four children. Her oldest child is 17 while the youngest is 1.

She raises and sells hogs. She works hard to support the needs of her children. Her husband works in a machine shop. His income is a great help in catering to the needs of the entire family.

She needs funds to support her existing business. She has requested a loan to buy feed and piglets. These could boost her income. Thus, she will continue to support her family and provide better living conditions for them.

She is hoping that someday she will be productive in her chosen field, and will continue to support the education of all her children.

loans.use: to buy feed and piglets.

loans.name: Patric

texts.en: Patric, 35 years old, is married and has two children. He has a car wash business. He borrowed a loan to purchase additional equipment for his car wash business. Through this business he was able to provide for the needs of his family and help others by giving them work. He shows his thanks to his customers by giving them satisfying services. His ultimate goal is to provide a better life for his family, by expanding his business and opening new branches in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional equipment for car wash business.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
As a parent of seven children, Elizabeth works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending. Elizabeth is borrowing 9,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies for her fishing business.

Elizabeth has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies.

loans.name: Nenge Ngunenge S.h.g Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photo is Eunice. She is forty seven years old and married with six children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) in 2014 in order to benefit from training especially enterprise development which enabled her to better manage her business.

She is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy farm inputs e.g. fertilizers and seeds to increase production.With her increased income she will be able to provide better housing for her family and have access to better healthcare services.

Eunice is grateful to Kiva and their lenders. She promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds and increase production to earn more income to provide better housing and medical care services for her family.

loans.name: Nenge Ngunenge S.h.g Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand in the photo is Sarah. She is thirty three years old, married, and a mother of two children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) in 2014 in order to benefit from training, especially enterprise development.

Sarah is involved in farming, maize and beans. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy farm inputs e.g.fertilizers and seeds. This will enable her to boost production and hence earn more income to provide better housing and access to quality health care for her family.

Sarah is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the financial support. She promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs (e.g. fertilizers and seeds) to increase production and income and hence provide better health care and housing to her family.

loans.name: Rock Of Ages Group

texts.en:
This group is made up of three members, who have been with ID-Ghana. The members run a wide variety of businesses that deal in clothing materials, wigs, fried plantain and yams. This loan will benefit all of the small businesses in the 'Rock of Ages' group.

Vivian joined ID-Ghana a year ago at the invitation of a friend who is a member of the institution. She currently has a business selling wigs. She started the business on her own 14 years ago upon seeing how well this type of business was doing in the market. She will use this loan to increase her capital by purchasing wigs from the main market to sell to her customers. This work generates enough income to support herself, as she is single and has no children.

When asked what she likes best about ID-Ghana, Vivian said she likes the health services and the training that the institution provides.

loans.use: to increase her capital by purchasing wigs from the main market to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 45 years old and married with eight children. With three children in school, she works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, home care products, and other groceries.

Teresita has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Santos Milagro

texts.es: Doña Santos de 46 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos, ella se dedica desde hace 15 años a la crianza de cerdos, comercializa los cerdos en los diferentes mercados y con las ventas que realiza logra salir adelante con los gastos del hogar, Doña Santos está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar mas cerdos y así poder continuar con la crianza de los mismo y tener mejores ganancias para una mejor estabilidad economica.
texts.en:
Santos, 46, owns a house where she lives with his two children. She has been raising pigs for fifteen years, selling them at the different marketplaces. With the sales she makes, she manages to cover the home expenses.

Santos is requesting a loan to be able to buy more pigs, in order to continue raising them, and increase her income to reach financial stability.

loans.use: to buy more pigs.

loans.name: Tanjung Rijasa Group

texts.en:
Luh Putu is the head of the Tanjung Rijasa group. She gets her daily living as a pig breeder and farmer. She lives with her husband and a child. She is trying to develop her pig business by borrowing from the MUK.

From the sale of two pigs in this period, Luh Putu managed to get a profit of 750,000 IDR. The gain was very helpful. The family's finances are currently experiencing difficult times due to increasingly expensive necessities of life. Because the holidays for Hinduism are approaching, Luh Putu with the Tanjung Rijasa group, decided to continue borrowing from the MUK to be especially helpful in developing their pig businesses.

Luh Putu wants to increase her business by keeping local pigs for pig barbeque. She needs a new loan to purchase three local pigs and feed. The pigs for pig barbeque usually only keep for two to three month and then they sell. Her husband supports her business by helping her to give feed and clean the cage. Luh Putu saves her profits, because she has a dream to renovate her kitchen.
