loans.use: to purchase three local pigs and feed.

loans.name: Maria Nila

texts.en:
Maria Nila is a 59-year-old married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Maria Nila has a tailoring business in the Philippines. She has requested a loan of 4,000 PHP through GDMPC to buy additional materials such as thread, needles and cloth for tailoring, and to keep up maintenance on her sewing machine.

Maria Nila has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save money to expand her business and to sustain the daily needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional material such as thread, needles and cloth for tailoring.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is 37 years old and married with two children. With both children in school, she works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, junk foods, home care products, and other groceries.

Analyn has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, junk foods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Asteria

texts.en:
Asteria is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 55 years old now.

Asteria has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy abaca fiber and other materials needed in her business.

Asteria has been in this business for 23 years. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy abaca fiber and other materials needed in her business

loans.name: Charmaine

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Charmaine works hard to support her family.

She has a cake-making business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from her general store. Charmaine is borrowing 25,000 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients such as flour and sugar for her cake-making business.

Charmaine has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like flour and sugar.

loans.name: Maribel Cirila

texts.es:
La socia Maribel  pertenece al banco comunal "UNION, FUERZA Y AMISTAD" de la Asociación Arariwa. 
La socia continua con su negocio de venta de anticuchos de forma ambulatoria, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia es una mujer emprendedora que mediante su negocio la socia espera obtener más ganancias para de esta forma seguir apoyando su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de insumos como aceite, carne, papas entre  otros.
La socia  agradece a los inversionistas por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Maribel is a member of the “UNION, FUERZA Y AMISTAD” communal bank of the Araiwa Association.

She has been selling Peruvian-style meat on a stick on foot for a good while and things are going well thanks to the effort she puts into her business each day. She is an enterprising woman who hopes to increase her earnings through her business so she can continue to support her family.

She is asking for a loan to buy supplies such as cooking oil, meat, potatoes, and other things.

She is grateful to the lenders for this loan and promised to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Odilia

texts.en: Odilia (31) is a mother of 2 year-old girl named Stevani. Her husband Daud is a motor taxi driver. Odilia is intending to operate a business where she can afford to get money for a better living standard, however all the money lender that she ever met are always asking for collateral. The situation led Odilia to postpone her dreams till’ she heard about TLM. Given that TLM did not ask for collateral, it makes Odilia is so grateful and gladly requested a loan of IDR 2,000,000. This loan was disbursed to her last  week and she already plans to buy kiosk stocks such as sugar, coffee, tea, shampoo, matches, candies,  some biscuits, instant noodles etc.

loans.use: to buy kiosk stocks such as sugar, coffee, tea, shampoo, matches, candies,  some biscuits, instant noodles etc

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Her name is Jocelyn. She is 45 years old, and a member of CCT, Silang Branch. She is happily married to Santos, a tricycle driver. The couple works hard to provide for their everyday needs and most especially for the education of their one high school child and one elementary child. A good education is the path and hope for a better future.

She trusts that she can borrow funds in the amount of PHP 10,000 to pay for several pieces of flip-flops, slippers, T-shirts and other souvenir items to sell at her improvised tent along the highway. She will be grateful and thanking God and you in advance for your help to sustain her business. Her earnings will cover her children's school requirements.

Jocelyn aims to rent a stall at the popular tourist spots like at Picnic Grove and at People's Par to attract more customers. She wants her children to earn a college degree. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital,and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for slippers, flip flops, T-shirts and other souvenir items to sell.

loans.name: Cholo

texts.en:
Cholo is a married woman with nine children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 40 years old and has five children who are in school.

Cholo has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy abaca fiber and other materials needed in her business.

Cholo has been in this business for 11 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy abaca fiber and other materials needed in her business

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 56 years old and married with three children. Elena works very hard to provide for them.

Elena runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, home product care, and other groceries.

Elena has been in this business for 6 years and sells a variety of items. 

In the future, Elena would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Geneda

texts.en:
Geneda is 40 years old and married with nine children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Geneda is borrowing 6,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Geneda has been raising pigs for 3 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Kheang

texts.en:
Kheang, 39, is a resident of Kampong Cham province. She is married with four dependent children, two of whom are in school. Income for this family comes from growing rice, raising cows and working for others for a fee.

Since she is need of working capital, Kheang is requesting a loan from VisionFund to save her farming business. She is going to use her loan to buy organic fertilizer to boost rice yields and to buy a cow to raise. She hopes to get abundant rice yields to improve her living conditions and to keep sending her children to school.

loans.use: To buy organic fertilizer to boost rice yields so that she can keep sending her children to school.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Lucia Antonia

texts.es: Lucia de 59 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hijo y su padre, ella se dedica a la venta de verduras y especies desde hace mas de 30 años su negocio esta ubicado en el mercado municipal y tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas verurasy especies por mayor para poder contionuar con sus ventas y asi tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en:
Lucia is 59 years old. She lives in her own home with her son and her father. She has sold vegetables and spices for more than 30 years. Her business is located in the municipal market and she has many customers due to her good prices. With her earnings she is able to pay for some of her household expenses.

She is requesting a loan to buy more vegetables and spices wholesale to be able to continue with her sales and in this way have better economic earnings.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables and spices wholesale

loans.name: Rolly

texts.en:
Rolly is 37 years of age, married and has two children. Soon, they are having a new baby.

Rolly is a driver of an ambulance in a well-known hospital in Dipolog city. Rolly is a hardworking person; he works eight hours a day, and he also frequently accepts overtime when it is needed in his assigned work task. Rally also has two pairs of pigs in the backyard for the purpose of the emergency needs of his family,he took a new loans because he wants to buy some material for their pig fence renovation and aside from that preparing for his wife for nearly due pregnancy.

loans.use: to pay for the hospital for his wife for nearly due pregnancy.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 50 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Elizabeth has been raising pigs for five years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Sadia

texts.en:
Sadia and her husband are living happily and making life comfortable for their three children. Her husband has been driving a rickshaw vehicle for the past year for someone else. However, that is not enough for the family, as their needs have increased over time. He decided to begin his own business by buying a new rickshaw. He believes this will be more convenient for making a living for his family.

Sadia applied for the loan to help her husband buy a rickshaw to lessen the burden on his shoulders. She thanks the Kiva team and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase a rickshaw for her husband.

loans.name: Felomina

texts.en:
Felomina is 69 years old and married with seven children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Felomina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like bread, canned goods, snack foods, home care products, and other groceries. She has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Felomina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like bread, canned goods, snack foods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine is a married woman with three children, she operates a retail shop. In addition to farming to support her family, she applied for a loan of 800,000 UGX from UGAGODE to boost her business. She will use the loan to buy more items to sell such as personal care products, home care products, and other groceries. She works very hard to provide for them.

Justine has been in this business for one year and sells a variety of items.In the future, Justine would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family. Pictured is Justine with the UGAGODE staff in her shop.

loans.use: to buy more stock, such as personal care products, home care products, and other groceries for her retail shop

loans.name: Farasolo Jeannine

texts.fr:
Farasolo a 34 ans, elle est marié et élève 2 enfants. Afin de pouvoir s’occuper de ses enfants et à la fois gagner de l’argent, elle a choisi l’élevage porcin et cela depuis 3 ans.
Les bénéfices qu’elle a réussi à avoir auparavant lui servaient à acheter un terrain et à assurer la vie de sa famille au quotidien.  Avec ce prêt, elle compte acheter 4 porcelets et 1 tonne de farine alimentaire pour engraisser ces porcelets. 
Elle espère pouvoir constituer beaucoup d’épargne afin de construire une maison sur le terrain qu’elle a acheté.
texts.en:
Farasolo is 34 years old. She is married and has two children. For the last three years, in order to take care of her children and make an income at the same time, she decided to raise pigs.

The profits that she made previously helped her buy land and ensure coverage of the daily expenses for her family. With this loan, she intends to buy four piglets and one ton of feed to fatten the piglets.

She hopes to be able to save well in order to build a house on the land that she purchased.

loans.use: to buy four piglets and one ton of feed to fatten the piglets.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva, 53, leads Arrecifes de Kino, a cooperative engaged in sustainable pen shell fishing.

Pen shells live buried in sandy bottoms of the Gulf of California and are harvested by divers for their abductor muscles or scallops known as “callo de hacha”. Pen shell divers use a type of hookah compressor, hooks, and a small boat (panga) equipped with an outboard motor. The fishing season lasts the whole year round, but the best months are from October to June.

Eva is asking for 80,000 pesos to use as working capital during the high season. She will use part of the loan to pay native Seri fishermen for the scallops they harvest.

COBI (cobi.org.mx), a non-profit organization dedicated to promoting the conservation of marine biodiversity in coastal communities of Mexico, has trained Arrecifes de Kino to engage in responsible and sustainable fishing.

With this loan, Eva will increase the revenues of Arrecifes de Kino, while contributing to the conservation of the Canal de Infiernillo, and thus setting an example for other groups that sustainable fishing can also be profitable.

loans.use: to have enough working capital for the scallop fishing season.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther, 53, is part of Shmaakal Winte, a cooperative in Cacahoatal, Chiapas engaged in the production of organic coffee and the sustainable use of local biodiversity.

Shmaakal Winte has produced and sold organic coffee for more than five years. Last year an earthquake destroyed the coffee-drying patios of 9 of the 19 members of the cooperative. The drying process of the coffee affects the final quality and price obtained; thus, unless the patios are rebuilt, Shmaakal Winte will receive a lower price for their coffee.

CONABIO (National Commission for Knowledge and Use of Biodiversity), an institution that promotes the conservation and management of biodiversity based on actions taken by local populations, has helped Shmaakal Winte implement sustainable production of coffee and honey as part of the Commission's effort to promote the sustainable use of biodiversity in the Soconusco Region in Chiapas.

Esther is one of the farmers affected by the earthquake. With this loan, Esther will obtain the resources needed to reconstruct her drying patio in time for the harvest season that begins in November.

loans.use: to repair her coffee-drying patio damaged by an earthquake.

loans.name: Epifanio

texts.en:
Epifanio, 66, is part of Shmaakal Winte, a cooperative in Cacahoatal, Chiapas engaged in the production of organic coffee and the sustainable use of local biodiversity.

Shmaakal Winte has produced and sold organic coffee for more than five years. Last year, an earthquake destroyed the coffee-drying patios of 9 of the 19 members of the cooperative. The drying process of the coffee affects the final quality and price obtained; thus, unless the patios are rebuilt, Shmaakal Winte will receive a lower price for their coffee.

CONABIO (National Commission for Knowledge and Use of Biodiversity), an institution that promotes the conservation and management of biodiversity based on actions taken by local populations, has helped Shmaakal Winte implement sustainable production of coffee and honey as a part of the Commission's effort to promote the sustainable use of biodiversity in the Soconusco Region in Chiapas.

Epifanio was one of the farmers affected by the earthquake. With this loan, Epifanio will obtain the recources to reconstruct his drying patio in time for the harvest season that begins in November.

loans.use: to repair his coffee-drying patio damaged by an earthquake.

loans.name: Abel Angel

texts.es: Don Abel de 50 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus cuatro hijos, el posee una pequeña tienda desde hace 10 años ubicada en su lugar de residencia vende una variedad de productos como golosinas, refrescos, granos básicos, café, sopas, huevos, gelatinas, azúcar, etc. y tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas mercadería por mayor ya que esa es su única fuente de ingresos y así podrá tener mejores ganancias para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Don Abel is 50 years old. He lives in his own home with his wife and their four children. He has had a small store located in his home for 10 years. He sells a variety of products such as candy, soft drinks, basic staple foods, coffee, soup, eggs, gelatin, sugar etc. He has many customers due to his good prices.

Abel is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise wholesale since this is his only source of income and in this way he will be able to have improved earnings and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy candy, soft drinks, staple foods, coffee, soup, eggs, gelatin, sugar etc. wholesale

loans.name: Alhaji Yushau

texts.en:
Alhaji Yushau is a maize farmer from the village of Birnin Nasarawa. As a member of Babban Gona, Alhaji Yushau is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support he has the chance to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of land, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Alhaji Yushau would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Alhaji Yushau can store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 

Alhaji Yushau is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family and in the end hopes to use his increased earnings to expand his farming activities.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Ty's Group

texts.en:
Ty, age 30, resides in Tbuang Khmum province. She is married and has three dependent children. In order to make a living, she grows rubber trees and cassava. The lack of working capital is a challenge to her farming business.

In a group of two members, Ty is the leader. This is her second cycle with VisionFund. Her past loan enabled her to buy enough fertilizer to support her cassava farm. As the group leader, she will use her loan to buy organic fertilizer for her rubber tree farm. She hopes she will earn more income from her farming business to improve their standard of living and to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer to improve her rubber tree farm so that she can upgrade her standard of living and send her children to school.

location.town: Tbaung Khmum Province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Ketura

texts.en:
Ketura is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Ketura has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Ketura would have had to sell her maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Ketura can store her maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Ketura will benefit from marketing support that could see her generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Ketura is thankful that she now has the opportunity to improve the life of her children and family and looks forward to using her additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Mubarak

texts.en:
Mubarak is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Mubarak has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Mubarak would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as for food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Mubarak can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Mubarak will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Mubarak is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Mateo

texts.es:
El socio Mateo vive en la hermosa ciudad del Cusco y pertenece al banco comunal “UNION, FUERZA Y AMISTAD” de la Asociación Arariwa. 
El socio continúa con su negocio de anticuchos de forma ambulatoria, el socio es una persona responsable y espera que mediante su negocio el socio pueda obtener más ganancias y de esta manera el socio pueda continuar apoyando a su familia, el socio  lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le trae satisfacciones personales entre otros, siendo de esta manera que el socio saca adelante a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para comprar insumos como papas, aceite, carne entre otros.
El socio  agradece a los inversionistas por el préstamo y se compromete a pagar sus cuotas con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
The member Mateo lives in the beautiful city of Cusco and belongs to the communal bank "Union, Fuerza, y Amistad" (Unity, Strength, and Friendship) of the Arariwa association. The member continues with his business selling anticuchos (grilled meat) as a street merchant. The member is a responsable person. He hopes that by means of his business he can have more income and to continue sustaining his family in this way.
The member has had this business for a long time, which brings him personal satisfaction, among other reasons, because in this way he can bring his family ahead.
The member is requesting the loan to buy supplies such as potatoes, oil and meat among other things.
He gives thanks to the lenders for this loan, and he promises to make his payments responsibly.

loans.use: to buy supplies like potatoes, oil, meat among other things

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma is single and has one child. She operates a food stall where she cooks food to sell, which she has been doing for three years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals.

Mwanajuma requested her third loan from SMEP Microfinance Bank for 35,000 KES, which she will use to buy more ingredients for preparing food. She will use the anticipated profits to expand the business. Her business goal is to have the best hotel within five years.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients for preparing food.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is a 63-year-old widow with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Erlinda has a tailoring business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 16,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy new supplies for her tailoring business.

Erlinda has been in this business for twenty years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy new supplies for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of four children, Teresita works hard to support her family.

She has a fruit vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from charcoal vending. Teresita is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF to buy a variety of fruits to sell for her fruit vending business.

Teresita has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fruits to sell.

loans.name: Brian

texts.en: Brian is a hardworking, married man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He works as a mechanic in a busy garage located in a busy center of Fort Portal town. He has been doing this work for over three years. He was inspired to start up this business after working from his brothers garage and gaining experience to operate his own business. He is mainly meeting a challenge of competition plus high license fees. However he looks forward to constructing rentals that will bring in more income to enable him provide for his family without any hardship. Brian needs a loan to construct his rentals that will yield him more income.

loans.use: to construct his rentals for income generation.

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi is a maize farmer from Makwala village. As a member of Babban Gona, Naomi is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support she has the chance to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land--5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Naomi would have had to sell her maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Naomi can store her maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 

Naomi is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family and, eventually, she hopes to use her increased earnings to build a house for her family.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Rahila

texts.en:
Rahila is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Rahila has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Rahila would have had to sell her maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Rahila can store her maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 

As a Babban Gona member, Rahila will benefit from marketing support that could see her generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Rahila is thankful that she now has the opportunity to improve the life of her children and family and looks forward to using her additional earnings to provide employment to members of her community through her farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Markus

texts.en:
Markus is a maize farmer from Galadima Mayau village. As a Babban Gona member, Markus is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Markus would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member, Markus can store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a period later on in the season, when he can obtain the best price for his maize, at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Markus no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per hectare of land, Markus hopes to realize better yields.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Iliya

texts.en:
Iliya is a Babban Gona maize farmer. He is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty, renewing his dreams of gaining wealth someday.

Traditionally, Iliya would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs for items such as food and clothing. As a member of Babban Gona, Iliya can store his maize at harvest and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. Benefiting from Babban Gona’s marketing support, Iliya has the opportunity to generate earnings of up to 2,000 USD per hectare of land.

Iliya is thankful that he no longer has to worry about not having money to purchase better inputs to improve his yield. He looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Yakubu

texts.en:
Yakubu is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Yakubu is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty, renewing his dreams of gaining wealth someday.

Traditionally, Yakubu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a member of Babban Gona Yakubu can store his maize at harvest and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. Benefiting from Babban Gona’s marketing support, Yakubu has the opportunity to generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land.

Yakubu is thankful that he no longer has to worry about not having money to pay for his children's school fees and looks forward to using his additional earnings to grow his wealth.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Garba

texts.en:
Garba is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Garba is thankful that the days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

Traditionally, Garba would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs for items such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Garba will store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a date later in the season when he can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price.

With the opportunity to earn up to 2,000 USD per hectare of land, Garba now has the opportunity to realize his dream of growing his agriculture business for himself and his family members. He would like to use this additional income to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Ado

texts.en:
Ado is a maize farmer from Bazana II village. With Babban Gona’s support he has the chance to attain yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria.

Before joining Babban Gona, Ado would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Ado can store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Ado is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family, and in the end, hopes to use his increased earnings to become a better farmer.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Kabiru

texts.en:
Kabiru is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Kabiru has the opportunity to attain yields of up to eight metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Kabiru would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Kabiru can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Kabiru will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Kabiru is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es: José Luis de 27 años vive en la comunidad de Atlántida, Honduras y desde hace cinco años se dedica a la cría de ganado de engorde y producción de leche, negocio con el cual obtiene ingresos que le ayudan a darle un buen futuro a su esposa y tres hijos, por eso se esfuerza mucho para que a su familia no les falte nada.  Dos  de los  hijos de José Luis ya asisten a la escuela y en muchas ocasiones se les ha dificultado hacer sus deberes escolares por la noche ya que en la comunidad donde ellos viven no hay acceso a energía eléctrica y deben iluminarse utilizando lámparas a base de kerosén perjudicando  la salud, a José y su familia  esto es algo que les preocupa bastante ya que como padres desean que sus hijos sean niños saludables, también esto hace difícil que sus labores  diarias de ganadería comiencen muy temprano  ya que tiene muy poca iluminación para realizarlas. Es por esto que  José Luis está solicitando financiamiento a Soluz Honduras para la compra de un Sistema solar que le ayudara a mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y les ayudara con sus respectivos deberes.
texts.en:
José Luis is 27 years old and lives in the Atlántida community in Honduras. For five years he has made a living raising, fattening, and producing milk from cattle. He obtains income from this business which helps him provide a good future for his wife and three children. He works very hard so that his family does not lack anything.

Two of José Luis' children are already going to school and on many occasions, it has been difficult for them to do their homework in the evening since the community they live in does not have access to electricity. They need to use kerosene lamps for lighting which is harmful to their health and this is something that worries José and his family a lot since, as parents, they wish for their children to be healthy. This also makes it difficult for José to begin his daily work with the cattle very early since there is very little light to complete it.

It is for these reasons that José Luis is requesting financing from Soluz Honduras for the purchase of a solar energy system that will help him improve his family's quality of life and will help them with their respective duties.

loans.use: to purchase a solar energy system for lighting which will improve the living conditions of his home.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 44 years old and married with four children.

Alma works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, and other groceries.

Alma has borrowed and paid back one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from rice vending.

Alma aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is a hardworking woman entrepreneur.

She has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell in her store.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Elsie dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her store.

loans.name: Upel

texts.ru: Упел, 34 года, не замужем, мать 2 детей школьников. У Упел - средне образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи она работает воспитателем в детском садике. Также на протяжении 10 лет занимается животноводством и полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду Упел, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 корова. Также арендует 2,0 ГА земельной доли, на которой ежегодно выращивает фасоль и клевер для реализации. Ежемесячный доход составляет 22,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Упел обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 110,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 коров и 10 овец для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Упел планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины и планирует накопить средства на завершение строительства дома.
texts.en:
Upel is 34 years old, not married and the mother of two children of school age. Upen has secondary education. As a main source of income for her family, she works as a kindergarten teacher. She has also worked with livestock breeding and field crop cultivation for a period of ten years.

Thanks to Upel's persistent work, her farm currently has one cow. She also rents 2.0 hectares of land, on which she grows beans and clover for selling every year. The monthly income is 22,000 som (KGS).

With an aim to further develop her business, Upel turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 110,000 som (KGS) to purchase two cows and ten sheep for increasing her herd. Upel plans to use the income from the loan to further increase the number of livestock. She also plans to save money to complete the construction of her house.

loans.use: to purchase two cows and ten sheep in order to increase her herd.

loans.name: Hut's Group

texts.en:
Hut is 62 years old and a farmer living in Sangke district of Battambang province and he has nine dependent children. To make a living, he has been growing rice, raising cows and working for others for a fee. He has been in his job for 12 years. The crop is not growing well since it was affected by drought.

For Hut, he has been with VisionFund for his sixth loan cycle and he paid back his past loans completely. The previous loans helped him to consume to support his lifestyle much better. As the group leader of four, he will use his portion of the loan to buy seed, fertilizer and pay for labor fees to support his farming. He hopes to get high yields to earn more income so that he can expand his current business to improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizer to increase his crop yields so as to raise up his income to save for future needs.

loans.name: Surmakan

texts.ru: Сурмакан, 55 лет, замужем, есть 2 сыновей и дочь. У нее - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, 12 лет занимается торговлей ткани. Оборот в торговле около 520,000 сом (KGS), контейнер, в котором осуществляется торговля  - собственный. Ежемесячная прибыль Сурмакан - 26,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Сурмакан обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку ткани для увеличения ассортимента. Доходы от кредита Сурмакан планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение ее бизнеса и обучение дочери.
texts.en:
Surmakan is 55 years old and has two sons and one daughter. She has secondary education. As a main income for her family, she has worked with selling fabric for 12 years. Her retail turnover is around 520,000 som (KGS) and she owns the container from which she sells. Surmakan's monthly income is 26,000 som (KGS).

With an aim to further develop her business, Surmakan turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 150,000 som (KGS) to purchase fabric for increasing her assortment. She plans to invest the income from the loan in further expanding her business and in her daughter's education.

loans.use: to purchase fabric for reselling in her shop.

loans.name: Chantha's Group

texts.en:
Chantha is a 30-year-old married mother of two dependent children who are still in school. She and her husband have been growing rice as their main source of income for 11 years. Chantha also works as factory worker to earn more income to meet family needs in a timely fashion. Around USD10 is earned every day, out of which she can save around USD5 per day.

This will be Chantha's second loan with VisionFund; her past loan helped her achieve her dreams of sending her children to school and improving her living conditions. As the leader of a four-member group, Chantha will use her loan portion to buy organic fertilizer to boost rice yields. She hopes that she will earn more income to make a better living and to keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy organic fertilizer to boost rice yields so that she can keep her children in school.

loans.name: Keyla

texts.es: Keyla de 31 años vive en la Copan Honduras y desde hace cinco años se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos y hortalizas junto a su esposo Danilo con lo cual obtienen los ingresos para sostener su hogar. Ellos luchan a diario para cumplir con sus metas como familia y poder dar a su hijo las mejores condiciones de vida, pero debido a que en la comunidad donde viven no cuentan con servicio de energía eléctrica, Keyla está solicitando financiamiento a Soluz Honduras para la compra de un Sistema Solar  ya que actualmente el uso de velas y lámparas a base de querosén  le produce daños a su salud y la de su familia debido a los gases tóxicos que emiten. Keyla piensa que con la compra de este sistema su familia se verá muy favorecida con los beneficios que el uso de energía solar proporciona.
texts.en:
Keyla, 31, lives in Copan, Honduras. For five years she has been making a living growing basic grains and vegetables, together with her husband, Danilo, which is how they get the income to maintain their household.

They strive daily to accomplish their goals as a family and to be able to give their son the best living conditions. However, because in the community they live in, they don't have electricity service, Keyla is requesting financing from Soluz Honduras for the purchase of a solar energy system. Currently the use of candles and kerosene lamps cause damage to her health and the health of her family due to the toxic gases they emit. Keyla thinks that with the purchase of this system, her family will really benefit from the advantages that the use of the solar energy system will provide.

loans.use: to purchase a solar energy system, which will improve the living conditions of her household.

loans.name: Justo

texts.es:
El socio Justo  pertenece al banco comunal “UNION FUERZA Y AMISTAD” de la Asociación Arariwa.
El socio continua con su negocio de  compra y venta de granos secos como trigo, habas y entre otros, el socio lleva buen  tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, el socio es una persona responsable y espera que mediante su negocio el socio pueda obtener más ganancias y de esta manera el socio pueda continuar apoyando a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para la compra de maíz.
 El socio se siente agradecido por el crédito y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The member Justo  belongs to the communal bank "Union, Fuerza, y Amistad" (Unity, Strength, and Friendship) of the Arariwa association.
The member continues with his business buying and selling dry grains like wheat, broad beans and others. The member has had his business for a long time. It is running well because of the hard work he is putting in his business every day. The member is a responsable person. He hopes that by means of his business he can have more income and to continue sustaining his family in this way.
The member is requesting the loan to buy corn.
He is thankful to the lenders for the loan and he promises  to comply with the established rates.

loans.use: to buy corn

loans.name: Zuhro

texts.ru:
Зухро из района Хамадони, занимается шитьем с юных лет. Ей 33 года. Она шьет женские одежды. Этому она научилась у своей мамы, которая говорила дочери, что женщина должна владеть ремеслом и помогать мужчинам поддерживать семью.
Учась в школе, Зухро начала шить самостоятельно. На ее труд клиенты восхищаются, и по этой причине у нее количество клиентов возрастают.  Зухро хочет приобрести многофункциональную швейную машинку для расширения деятельность. С такими планами Зухро просит Вас дать ей кредит. Ремесленница желает в будущем научить всех желающих этому красивому ремеслу. Зухро надеется на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en:
Zuhro is from the Hamadoni region. She has worked with sewing since her youth. She is 33 years old. She sews women's clothing. She learnt this from her mother, who told her daughter that a woman should have her own profession and help her husband support the family.

After having finished school, Zuhro started sewing independently. The customers are delighted by her work, and for this reason the number of customers grows. Zuhro would like to purchase a multi-functional sewing machine to expand her business. With this plan, she requests you to give her a loan.

In the future, this craftswoman would like to teach this beautiful craft to everyone who would like to learn it. Zuhro hopes for your support.

loans.use: to purchase a multi-functional sewing machine

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet is a married woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a farm where she keeps dairy cows. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy animal feed and insecticides. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to purchase additional stock.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and insecticides.

loans.name: Diorica

texts.en:
Diorica is 58 years old and married with twelve children. With one child in school, Diorica works very hard to provide for them.

Diorica runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, snack foods, home care products and other groceries.

Diorica has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as mineral water, snack foods, biscuits, candies, and other groceries.

In the future, Diorica would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like beverages, snack foods,  home care products and other groceries.

loans.name: Sani

texts.en:
Sani is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Sani is thankful that the days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

Traditionally, Sani would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Sani will store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a date later in the season when he can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price.

With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Sani now has the opportunity to actualize his dream of growing his agriculture business for himself and family members. He would like to use this additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Attahiru

texts.en:
Attahiru is a maize farmer from Rimi village. As a Babban Gona member, Attahiru is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Attahiru would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price is at its lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs for necessities such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member, Attahiru can store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Attahiru no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per hectare of land, Attahiru plans on using his additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell his maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Alhaji Hassan

texts.en:
Alhaji Hassan is a maize farmer from Kurungofi village. As a member of Babban Gona, Alhaji Hassan is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support, he has the chance to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria.

Before joining Babban Gona, Alhaji Hassan would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Alhaji Hassan can store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Alhaji Hassan is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family and in the end hopes to use his increased earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Gloria Gabriela

texts.es:
Gloria Gabriela es una mujer casada, madre de tres hijos quienes dependen económicamente de ella. Tiene 36 años y vive actualmente en Ensenada, en donde tiene su negocio.
Hace tres años, tras sufrir un accidente que la incapacitó por un tiempo para trabajar, se inició en la venta de bisutería con sus propios diseños de collares, llaveros, entre otras cosas, para salir adelante.
Tras varias ventas, Gloria se dio cuenta que sus productos gustaban a la gente y aprovechó la oportunidad de establecerlo como su trabajo fijo. Con el fin de ganar más dinero, también comenzó a vender pastelería y ropa pero sin perder de vista su objetivo de formalizar el negocio de bisutería.
Con este fin y el de poder crear una cartera de clientes más amplia para poder incrementar sus ventas, Gloria ha solicitado un crédito para poder comprar más mercancía y así tener la oportunidad de crear más diseños y productos para ofrecer a sus clientes.
Con este crédito, Gloria ha tenido la oportunidad de tener una mejor solidez económica, así como de darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos y ayuda a su esposo. Su orgullo por sus diseños y el sueño de tener un negocio de bisutería formar, es lo que motiva a Gloria a seguir adelante y mantener su espíritu de lucha.
texts.en:
Gloria Gabriela is a married woman. She is the mother of three children who depend upon her. She is 36 years old and currently lives in Ensenada where she has her business.

Three years ago, after suffering an accident that incapacitated her from working for a while, she began selling costume jewelry with her own designs of necklaces and key chains, among other items, in order to move forward.

After various sales, Gloria realized that people liked her designs and she took advantage of the opportunity to establish it as her regular work. With the goal of earning more money, she also began selling pastries and clothing, but without losing sight of her objective of setting up her jewelry business.

With this goal, and the goal of creating a larger group of customers in order to able to increase her sales, Gloria has requested a loan to be able to buy more merchandise and thus have the opportunity to create more styles and products to offer to her customers.

With this loan, Gloria has had the opportunity to have more economic strength, as well as to give her children a better quality of life and help her husband. Her pride in her designs and the dream of setting up her jewelry business is what motivates Gloria to continue moving forward and maintain her spirit of determination.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise to be able to make more styles and increase sales

loans.name: Santos

texts.en:
Santos, 72, is part of Shmaakal Winte, a cooperative in Cacahoatal, Chiapas engaged in the production of organic coffee and the sustainable use of local biodiversity.

Shmaakal Winte has produced and sold organic coffee for more than five years. Last year, an earthquake destroyed the coffee drying patios of 9 of the 19 members of the cooperative. The drying process of the coffee affects the final quality and price obtained; thus, unless the patios are rebuilt, Shmaakal Winte will receive a lower price for their coffee.

CONABIO (National Commission for Knowledge and Use of Biodiversity), an institution that promotes the conservation and management of biodiversity based on actions taken by local populations, has helped Shmaakal Winte implement sustainable production of coffee and honey as a part of the Commission´s effort to promote the sustainable use of biodiversity in the Soconusco Region in Chiapas.

Santos was one of the farmers affected by the earthquake. With this loan, Santos will obtain the recources to reconstruct his drying patio in time for the harvest season that begins in November.

loans.use: to repair his coffee drying patio damaged by an earthquake

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es: DOña Jesus de 56 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos, ella posee una tienda en su casa de habitación en la cual vende variedad de productos de primera necesidad. Su deseo es ampliar su tienda con el fin de mejorar las ventas y sus ingresos ya que desea dar a sus hijos mejores condiciones de vida a las que ella ha tenido. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en la compra de productos de tienda como: huevos, cereales, golosinas, aceite, macarrones, detergente, etc. y asi poder seguir teniendo mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Jesus is 56 years old and lives in a home of her own with her husband and two children. She runs a store out of her home, where she sells primary needs products and wants to expand so she can improve her sales and income because she wants to provide the best living conditions for her children. She is asking for a loan through INTEGRAL so she can buy products such as eggs, cereal, sweets, cooking oil, pasta, detergent, etc. so she can continue to improve her income.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Zafarhon

texts.ru: Это мужчина Зафархон. Он живет на районе Хамадони. Зафархон отец троих дочери. Он умный и добрый  мужчина. Зафархон занимается торговлей деятельности и у себя дома выращивает скота. Он во дворе ухаживает о домашних животных. Зафархон решил, построит коровник во дворе для скота. По причине, что уже наступает холод и зима. Осень дождливая погода, и животным будет мокрый и холодно. Из-за нехватки денег Зафархон  просит кредит. Он хочет купить необходимые стройматериалы и построить коровник.
texts.en:
This man is Zafarhon. He lives in the Hamadoni region. Zafarhon is the father of three children. He is a smart and good man. Zafarhon works with retail sales and he also breeds cattle at his home. He keeps the livestock in his yard. 

Zafarhon decided to build a cowshed for the livestock in his yard, because the cold and the winter is already coming. The autumn rain is making the livestock wet and cold. Due to a lack of money, Zafarhon requests a loan. He would like to purchase the necessary building materials and build a cowshed.

loans.use: to purchase necessary building material to build a cowshed

loans.name: Sandra Yamileth

texts.es: Sandra de 30 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hijo, ella se dedica a la elaboracion y venta de camisas para hombres su taller esta ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene mas de 2 años de dedicarse a esa actividad, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de tela por fardos entre otras cosas y asi poder continuar con su trabajo.
texts.en:
Sandra, 30, owns a house where she lives with her husband and son. She makes and sells shirts for men. Her workshop is located at home, and she has had it for more than two years. With the profits she makes, she manages to cover some of the home expenses.

She is requesting a loan to buy bales of fabrics, among other things, in order to continue with her work.

loans.use: to buy bales of fabrics, among other things.

loans.name: Alhaji Yahuza

texts.en:
Alhaji Yahuza is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Alhaji Yahuza has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land. Five and a half times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Alhaji Yahuza would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Alhaji Yahuza can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Alhaji Yahuza will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Alhaji Yahuza is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to build a house for his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell his maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 52 years old and widowed with five children. With two children in school, Jocelyn works very hard to provide for them.

Jocelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and has been in this business for six years selling a variety of items such as biscuits, candies, junk food, charcoal, mineral water and other groceries.

Jocelyn requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as canned goods, junk food, home care products and other groceries.

In the future, Jocelyn would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as canned goods, junk food, home care products and other groceries.

loans.name: Mil Rose

texts.en:
Mil Rose is 25 years old and married with one child in school. Mil Rose works very hard to provide for her child.

Mil Rose runs a general store in the Philippines and has been in this business for three years selling a variety of items such as shampoo, soap, coffee, biscuits, can goods, eggs, junk food and other groceries.

Mil Rose has requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as eggs, canned goods, home care products and other groceries.

In the future, Mil Rose would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as eggs, canned goods, home care products and other groceries.

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Yasmeen belongs to Lahore. She is married and lives with her family. She owns a tailoring business where she makes tradional shalwar kurta for the ladies of the community, along with clothes for children.

She is experienced and can make a variety of clothes. She also takes orders from boutiques to make clothes. Her experience has made her quick and skillful. She wants to make her business more fruitful through investing in it, but she lacks sufficient funds.

Therefore, she has requested a BRAC Pakistan microfinance loan that she plans to invest in buying threads, zips, machine oil, fabric, laces, etc. She aims to become a successful entrepreneur and raise her living standards.

loans.use: To buy materials and accessories for her tailoring business

loans.name: Shitu

texts.en:
Shitu is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Shitu has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Shitu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Shitu can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Shitu will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Shitu is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Pascual

texts.en:
Pascual, 78, is part of Shmaakal Winte, a cooperative in Cacahoatan, Chiapas engaged in the production of organic coffee and the sustainable use of local biodiversity.

Shmaakal Winte has produced and sold organic coffee for more than five years. Last year, an earthquake destroyed the coffee drying patios of 9 of the 19 members of the cooperative. The drying process of the coffee affects the final quality and price obtained; thus, unless the patios are rebuilt, Shmaakal Winte will receive a lower price for their coffee.

CONABIO (National Commission for Knowledge and Use of Biodiversity), an institution that promotes the conservation and management of biodiversity based on actions taken by local populations, has helped Shmaakal Winte implement sustainable production of coffee and honey as a part of the Commission´s effort to promote the sustainable use of biodiversity in the Soconusco Region in Chiapas.

Pascual was one of the farmers affected by the earthquake. With this loan, Pascual will obtain the recources to reconstruct his drying patio in time for the harvest season that begins in November.

loans.use: to repair his coffee drying patio damaged by an earthquake

loans.name: Danilo Jr.

texts.en:
Danilo is a 55-year-old man from the city of Baybay, Leyte. He is married and has two sons; one adult and one-school-aged child.

He and his wife are running a sari-sari (variety) store business to support the needs of their children. They have been proficiently doing this business for 15 years. Aside from this, they are also engaged in a hog raising business.

Danilo is asking for a loan to buy grocery items such as chips, candies, biscuits, coffee, powdered chocolate drinks, sugar, salt, canned goods, noodles, spices, eggs and drinks. He will also buy piglets and feed.

In the future, he plans to have other business opportunities like selling dried fish.

loans.use: to buy chips, candies, biscuits, coffee, powdered chocolate drinks, sugar, salt, canned goods, noodles, spices, eggs and drinks; also, piglets and feed.

loans.name: Ana Mabel

texts.es: Doña Ana de 50 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella se dedica a la elaboracion y venta de  antojitos como: papas fritas, yuca frita, empanadas, etc. que vende de forma ambulante cerca de su lugar de residencia, gracias a las ventas que realiza logra solventar los gastos de su hogar, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de productos que utiliza en la elaboración de sus antojitos como: aceite, papas, maíz,  plátanos y todos los ingredientes para su elaboración y así poder seguir manteniendo su hogar y poder solventar los gastos que se le pueden presentar.
texts.en:
Ana is 50 years old and lives in her own home with her husband. She makes a living by making and selling snacks like french fries, fried yucca, empanadas, etc., which she sells on foot near her residence.

Thanks to her sales, she has been able to pay household expenses. She is requesting a loan to purchase products that she uses to make snacks, like potatoes, corn, plantains, and other ingredients so that she can continue to maintain her household and pay expenses that arise.

loans.use: to purchase oil, potatoes, corn, plantains, and all other ingredients.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman with four children. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a favourable place and her primary customers are locals.

Mary says that her biggest business challenge is inadequate working capital. She will use this KES 20,000 loan to buy more clothes to sell. Her business goal is to own a boutique within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful.

This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She successfully repaid her previous loan.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is 51 years old and married with seven children. With three children in school, Thelma works very hard to provide for them.

Thelma runs a general store in the Philippines and has been in this business for two years selling a variety of items such as eggs, coffee, canned goods, soy sauce, noodles and other groceries.

Thelma has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as canned goods, junk food, home care products and other groceries.

In the future, Thelma would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as canned goods, junk food, home care products and other groceries.

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en:
Avelina is 53 years old and married with seven children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and and also earns an income from food vending.

She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her store, like canned goods, snack foods, home care products, and other groceries.

Avelina has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 25 years and aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like canned goods, snack foods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 51 years old and married with five children, two in school. Editha works very hard to provide for her family.

Editha runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products and other groceries.

Editha has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Editha would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products and other groceries.

loans.name: Ruela

texts.en:
Ruela is a 60-year-old married mother of seven children, three in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Ruela has a fishing business in the Philippines. Ruela requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies.

Ruela has been in this business for two years. In the future, Ruela would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies.

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es:
Guadalupe es una madre soltera en la comunidad de Puerto Rico Campeche y lleva 35 años trabajando vendiendo jaiba que le compra a los pescadores de su comunidad.
Quiere un crédito con SGS para la compra de materiales para poder acabar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
Guadalupe is a single mother who lives in the community of Puerto Rico Campeche. She has been buying crabs from local fishermen and selling them for 35 years.

She needs a loan from SGS to buy construction materials in order to be able to finish building her house.

loans.use: to build a house for her and her only son.

loans.name: Nazario

texts.en:
Nazario, 56, is part of Shmaakal Winte, a cooperative in Cacahoatan, Chiapas engaged in the production of organic coffee and the sustainable use of local biodiversity. 

Shmaakal Winte has produced and sold organic coffee for more than five years. Last year an earthquake destroyed the coffee drying patios of 9 of the 19 members of the cooperative. The drying process of the coffee affects the final quality and price obtained; thus, unless the patios are rebuilt, Shmaakal Winte will receive a lower price for their coffee. 

CONABIO (National Commission for Knowledge and Use of Biodiversity), an institution that promotes the conservation and management of biodiversity based on actions taken by local populations, has helped Shmaakal Winte implement sustainable production of coffee and honey as part of the Commission´s effort to promote the sustainable use of biodiversity in the Soconusco Region in Chiapas. 

Nazario is one of the farmers affected by the earthquake. With this loan, Nazario will obtain the resources needed to reconstruct his drying patio in time for the harvest season that begins in November.

loans.use: to repair his coffee drying patio damaged by an earthquake

loans.name: Jai Sri Ram - 1 Group

texts.en:
In the calendar year 2011, five women members from Munikhol village of Rayagada district in Odisha, India formed a Self Help Group named Jai Sri Ram - 1 to access a loan from Mahashakti Foundation to expand their businesses. Till now the group has already had three loan cycles. The repayment behavior of the group is 100% on time. This will be the 4th loan cycle.

Pramila is one of them. She is a 33-year-old lady with three children. The member standing second from the right with a raised hand in the photo is Pramila.

Pramila makes leaf plates and sells them in the nearby market. Pramila's income is about 7,500 INR per month. It is not at all sufficient to meet the day-to-day expenses and to make savings for future needs is almost impossible. She wants to expand her business by taking a loan from Mahashakti Foundation. She will utilize the present loan to buy a huge quantity of leaves to make leaf plates. Pramila hopes to give her children better education and build a bright carrier.

The other four members of this group are also involved in similar business and doing vegetable cultivation and its associated business.

loans.use: to buy a huge quantity of leaves to make leaf plates.

loans.name: Rakhi's Group

texts.en:
Women in both rural and urban India, actually the world over, have one thing in common. They like to wear well-stitched clothes. Women in the village of Korba are no different. And it is this need that Rakhi caters to. She is a humble and a differently-abled lady standing to the left hand side in the photograph.

She has had a tailoring business for the last 6 years. Initially it was very hard to work. She put in long hours to set aside savings to buy a sewing machine. With this machine in place she is not able to cater to an even larger clientele. Rakhi now needs a loan to meet the growing demand from her customers.

Therefore along with her group member, she is requesting a loan amount of 30,000 INR from Kiva's partner People's Forum. She would like to use her portion of the loan amount to buy materials in bulk and give her customers a wider choice. Rakhi is confident, has an established business and just needs a little help to make it even better and bigger. Help Rakhi in this endeavour and she assures you that you are investing in one of the faster growing businesses.

loans.use: to buy materials in bulk and give her customers a wider choice.

loans.name: Maqboolan

texts.en:
Maqboolan is a loving and dedicated mother living in Lahore. She is a supportive mother and is always there for her children.

Maqboolan's son is young and needs employment. He has learned to drive a rickshaw and has a licence too, but he does not have a rickshaw. In order to help her son become self-employed she has requested a loan. This will help her son cover his expenses on his own and also make him responsible.

Maqboolan hopes for a better future for her son.

loans.use: to help her son buy an auto-rickshaw.

loans.name: Alba Odena

texts.es: Alba de 43 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hija, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tortillas desde hace 12 años, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes, adicional a eso tambien posee una tienda, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de maíz por mayor y cal para poder continuar con la elaboración de las tortillas y así poder tener mejores ingresos para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Alba is 43 years old and lives in her own home with her daughter. She has made a living for the past 12 years by preparing and selling tortillas. Her business is located in her home and she has many customers. She also owns a store. With her earnings, she has been able to pay some household expenses.

She is requesting a loan to purchase corn in bulk and lime so that she can continue to make tortillas and earn more money to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase lime and corn in bulk.

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es: Maria tiene 54 años de edad y vive en casa propia con su hijo, ella posee una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace 6 años, tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios y la amabilidad que tiene a la hora de vender, gracias a sus ventas es como ella ha podido salir adelante con los gastos de su hogar, la clienta está solicitando nuevamente un crédito para poder comprar más mas mercaderia como huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, gaseosas, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. y tener mas surtida su tienda y asi poder generar mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en:
Maria is 54 years old and lives in her own home with her son. She has owned a small store located in her home for the past 6 years. She has many customers due to her good prices and the friendliness with which she greets her customers.

Thanks to her sales, she has been able to move ahead with her household expenses. She is requesting a loan to purchase more merchandise like eggs, staple grains, beverages, sodas, snacks, pastries, etc. so that she can stock her store with more products and earn more money.

loans.use: to purchase more merchandise like eggs, staple grains, beverages, sodas, snacks, pastries, etc.

loans.name: Comerciantes Hacia El Progreso De Colquepata Group

texts.es:
La socia  pertenece al banco comunal COMERCIANTES HACIA EL PROGRESO DE COLQUEPATA, el banco es ubicado en el distrito de Colquepata, provincia de Paucartambo y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Valentina tiene 62 años de edad y es casada, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose a la agricultura,  la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia es una mujer emprendedora que espera con su negocio obtener ganancias para de esta forma continuar apoyando a su familia,  a la vez la socia se dedica a la crianza de  animales menores, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, abono entre otros.
Los socios en general agradecen el crédito otorgado y se comprometen a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
She is a member of the "Comerciantes Hacia el Progreso de Colquepata" [Businesspeople Towards the Progress of Colquepata] communal bank, located in the Colquepata district, Paucartambo province of the Cusco department.

Valentina is 62 years old and married. She has different activities, such as agriculture. She has had her business for quite some time now, and is doing well thanks to how hard she works every day. She is an enterprising woman who hopes that her business leaves her good profits in order to continue supporting her family. She also raises farm animals; this is how she gets ahead with her family.

She is requesting a loan to buy seeds and fertilizers, among other supplies.

All the members are grateful for the loan they received and promise to pay the installments according to plan.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers, among other things.

loans.name: Voces Unidas Group

texts.es:
¨Voces Unidas¨ es proveniente de los lugares rurales de la ciudad, pero no significa que por eso  dejan de ser personas responsables a quienes les guste el trabajo día a día, todo esto para el desarrollo personal y sacar adelante a su apreciada familia. Por 3era vez solicitan crédito para seguir desarrollando sus labores diarias. Coordinado por Alejandra, de 31 años, ajuntada y con un hijo, se dedica a la compra y venta de cosechas desde hace 15 años. Ahora con el crédito requiere de la compra de papaya, piña, melón, sandia, al por mayor para así poder cubrir la demanda solicitada por la clientela.
