Las otras socias son Johana de 29 años dedicada a la venta de frutas, Miuris de 25 años y Melissa de 22 las dos se dedican a la preparación y venta de tamales para comercializarlos de manera ambulante.
texts.en:
The "Voces Unidas" group is from one of the rural areas of the city, but this doesn't mean that they are not responsible people who like to work every day in order to improve themselves and move their beloved families forward.

This is the third time that they are requesting a loan to continue with their daily labor. Alejandra, who is 31 years old, is the leader. She is married and has one son. She has made a living by purchasing and selling produce for the past 15 years. She will use the loan to purchase papaya, pineapple, melon, and watermelon in bulk so that she can meet her customers' demands.

The other members are Johana, who is 29 years old and sells fruit, Miuris, who is 25 years old, and Melissa, who is 22 years old. Miuris and Melissa prepare and sell tamales on foot.

loans.use: to purchase papaya, pineapple, melon, and watermelon in bulk.

loans.name: Binapani Group

texts.en:
This group is located in a village named Muniguda which is in Rayagada district of Odisha, India. Gouri is one of the members of this group. She is sitting second from left with raised hand in the photo. She is a very active young lady of 31 years of age. She leaves with her husband and two children. All the children are attending school.

Gouri along with her husband has been doing a grocery business for the last 6 years. Six years back Gouri started the business. During 2011 she formed a group and availed herself of a loan from Mahashakti. This will be her 4th cycle loan. The past record says that the group repayment is always in time. Presently Gouri earns about 8,500 INR per month from her business which is insufficient to meet the day-to-day expenses of her family as well as the farm expenses.

She wants to expand her business by taking a loan from Mahashakti Foundation. She will utilize the present loan to purchase rice, whole tea, sugar, oil, nuts, biscuits, detergent, shampoo, soap etc. She expects a good return from her business by expanding. Gouri dreams of being a wholesaler of grocery items in the market in the near future. She also hopes to give her whole family a bright future through her hard work.

The other four members of this group are also involved in leaf plate making and selling businesses.

loans.use: to purchase rice, whole tea, sugar, oil, nuts, biscuits, detergent, shampoo and soap.

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.en:
Dilorom was born in the year 1984. She is single and she lives with her parents. Dilorom is a very hardworking woman. She has had her own business for more than 6 years.

Dilorom sells sim-cards, mobiles, DVDs, discs and etc. She has a little shop. Dilorom’s brother Rahmonaly helps her with managing the business. Dilorom works hard every day. She is going to buy a TV set to use in her shop and in this way to develop her business.

Dilorom is asking for a loan of 6,000 Somoni with this aim. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy a TV set to develop her business.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa vive en la hermosa ciudad del Cusco al sur del Perú. 
La socia continua con su negocio de venta productos de primera necesidad como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, leche y entre otros, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia es una mujer emprendedora que mediante su negocio la socia espera obtener mas ganancias para de esta forma seguir apoyando su familia.
La socia  pertenece al banco comunal "UNION, FUERZA,AMISTAD".
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de arroz, leche entre otros.
La socia agradece a los inversionistas por el préstamo y se siente contenta por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Teresa lives in the beautiful city of Cusco, South of Peru.
She continues with her business of selling basic needs products such as rice, sugar, milk and others. The member has had this business for a while and does well thanks to the effort she puts into it each day.  She is an entrepreneurial woman and through her business hopes to obtain more profit to continue supporting her family.
Teresa belongs to the community bank “Union, Strength, Friendship”.
She requests a loan to buy rice, milk and other products.
She is grateful to the investors for the loan and feels happy for the credit given to her, she commits to meet the established repayment schedule.

loans.use: to buy rice, milk and other products.

loans.name: Señor De Qoyllority De Chimpahuaylla Group

texts.es:
La socia  pertenece al banco comunal SEÑOR DE QOYLLORITY DE CHIMPAHUAYLLA, el banco es ubicado en el departamento de Cusco.
La socia Estefanía  sigue con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia es una mujer emprendedora que espera con su negocio obtener ganancias para de esta forma continuar apoyando a su familia,  la socia continua vendiendo  arroz, azúcar, leche entre otros para todos sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual hasta ahora le trae satisfacciones personales entre otros, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de azúcar, huevos, leche entre otros.
Los socios en general agradecen el crédito otorgado y se comprometen a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the community bank SEÑOR DE QOYLLORITY DE CHIMPAHUAYLLA, the bank is located in the Cusco region.

The member called Estefanía continues in the grocery store business.She is an enterprising woman who depends on her business for an income so that she can continue to support her family. She sells rice, sugar, milk among other things at the request of her customers. The business has been doing well up to now, providing a sense of personal achievement as it allows the member to provide for her family.
The member is asking for the loan to buy sugar, eggs, milk among other items.

The members of the group are thankful for the loan that has been approved and promise to meet the specified repayments.

loans.use: to buy sugar, eggs, milk and other items.

loans.name: Miriam Del Socorro

texts.es: Hace mucho tiempo que Doña Miriam se dedica a la venta de comida, está casada y tiene un hijo. Poco a poco ha logrado salir adelante con el apoyo de su esposo, ha mejorado las condiciones de su hogar y del negocio. Los platillos que ofrece a sus clientes son bien demandados es por esta razón que solicita un crédito para comprar granos básicos, gaseosas, jugos entre otros. Con este crédito podrá ofrecer mayor variedad de platillos y obtener mejores ganancias con las ventas.  En un futuro desea comprar más mesas para mejorar la presentación del negocio y atender bien a su clientela.
texts.en:
Miriam began selling food for a living many years ago. She is married and has one son. Little by little, she has been able to move forward and, with the help of her husband, has improved the conditions of her household and of her business.

The products that she offers to her clients are in high demand, which is why she is requesting a loan to purchase staple grains, sodas, juice, etc. With this loan, she will be able to offer a better variety of products and earn more money from her sales. In the future, she hopes to purchase more tables in order to improve the appearance of her business and tend to her clients.

loans.use: to purchase staple grains, sodas, juice, etc.

loans.name: Esterlina

texts.en:
Esterlina is a married woman who is 59 years old. She is the mother of four children: three adults and one school-aged child. She and her husband work hard together for their family.

With her eagerness to help her husband, Esterlina decided to have her own business. She successfully started her hog raising business a few months ago.

She is now asking for loan to buy feed for her sow and piglets as well. Esterlina wishes for healthy growth for her piglets and for her business to become profitable.

loans.use: to buy feed for her sow and piglets.

loans.name: Jai Sri Ram - 2 Group

texts.en:
Basanti is an inhabitant of Munikhol village in Rayagada district of Odisha, India. The lady standing in the middle with a raised hand in the photo is Basanti. She is 30 years old and resides with her husband and three children. The main source of income for Basanti is making leaf plates and selling them as well as tailoring. Basanti does both the jobs with the help of her husband in marketing.

Basanti has been doing this profession for the last 6 years and her earnings mean that she and her family just live hand to mouth. The family income of Basanti is about 8,000 INR each month. So to overcome this situation, in the year 2011 she formed a self help group comprised of four other members and took a loan from Mahashakti Foundation. This will be her 4th cycle loan. The repayment behavior of the group is very good, 100% on time.

From this loan amount she will purchase a big quantity of leaves and a Pico machine, cloths and threads. This loan will definitely help her get more income. Basanti hopes to construct a house and provide better education for her children.

The other four members of the group are doing a bangle business, a fancy store, a grocery shop and dairy.

loans.use: to purchase a big quantity of leaves and a Pico machine, cloths and threads.

loans.name: Chhatarbai's Group

texts.en:
Chhatarbai, standing to the left hand side in the photograph, is a differently abled lady and belongs to a village in Korba, Chattisgarh, India. She stays there with her small family, consisting of her husband and two sons. The couple has been, for years now, engaged in farming work to earn a living. For the last 14 years, they have been growing vegetables such as cabbage, ladyfinger, mustard, etc. in the field, and earn by selling those in the village market at a reasonable rate.

From the earnings, they try their best to support their sons' educational expenses and wish to provide them with higher education for a brighter future.

To earn more income by maximizing yield from the land, Chhatarbai now plans to avail herself of a loan from Kiva's partner People's Forum. She, along with her group member, is requesting a loan amount of 30,000 INR. The loan amount will enable Chhatarbai to buy good-quality fertilizers and pesticides, etc. to increase the quantity and quality of yield from the land without any financial worry.

The couple hopes to earn some more income through this upgrade and save for their future.

loans.use: to buy good-quality fertilizers and pesticides, etc. to increase the quantity and quality of their yield.

loans.name: Ganga Group

texts.en:
Laxmi, the lady seating second from left with a raised hand in the photo, is a very active woman of 31 years of age. She resides with her family in a village named Muniguda in Rayagada district in Odisha, India. Laxmi hails from a very poor tribal family from below the poverty line. She has two children. Both are studying in school.

Laxmi has been running a tea stall with leaf plate making and selling for six years. Six years ago with a small investment of her own Laxmi started her business. She has already availed herself of a loan from Mahashakti. This will be her 4th Cycle Loan. The past record says that the group repayment was always on time.

Presently Laxmi is earning a monthly income of 6,100 INR. As per the statement of Laxmi, this small income is not at all sufficient to manage the family along with the educational expenses of her children. So she wants to increase her income by expansion of her existing business.

With the present loan she will purchase a huge quantity of leaves to make leaf plates and some utensils, sugar, tea, etc; for her tea stall. She hopes that this loan will help her to increase her income and make savings. She will be able to construct a house for her family as well as a permanent cabin for her business.

The other three members of the group are doing leaf plate making and selling businesses.

loans.use: to purchase a huge quantity of leaves for making leaf plates and some utensils, sugar and tea.

loans.name: Francisca Aracely

texts.es: Francisca, de 29 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposo con quien tiene 4 hijos y reside con ellos en una de las aldeas del Municipio de Nueva Frontera, Santa Bárbara. Anteriormente ella se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y productos de catálogo (AVON). Hace dos años se ha dedicado a la cría y engorde de gallinas para la venta. Esta actividad la realiza en su casa.  Ella solicita la cantidad de 10,000 Lempiras para la compra de 300 pollos para engorde, con el propósito de incrementar su negocio y poder cubrir la demanda de sus clientes. Su meta es seguir criando pollos para obtener mejores ingresos y tener mejor vida con su familia.
texts.en:
Francisca, 29, lives in a common-law marriage. She and her partner have four children together. They live together in one of the villages of the municipality of Nueva Frontera, Santa Bárbara. In the past, she used to sell cosmetics from an AVON catalogue. Two years ago, she started raising and selling chickens at home.

She is requesting 10,000 lempiras [HNL] to buy 300 chickens to fatten, thinking of expanding her business and fulfilling her customers' demands. Her goal is to continue raising chickens in order to improve her income and her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy 300 chickens to fatten and sell.

loans.name: Aty

texts.en:
Aty is a 23-year-old mother of 3 children whose ages are 5 years old, 3 years old and 7 months old. None of them are attending school. Besides her husband’s income, Aty contributes to the household by selling local vegetables at the market. She starts working from 5 am by taking the vegetables to the market which is about 5 km from her house then she is able to return back home around 10 am if they have been sold.

The net income she usually produces is averaging IDR 50,000 to 70,000. Aty is pretty happy with her current business, however she really wants to add more stock such as salty fish and tomatoes but has very limited income to do so. Last week she was accepted as a new client of TLM and received a loan amounting to IDR 3,000,000. She is so grateful and hopes to see the improvement in her business soon.

loans.use: to purchase more stock such as salty fish and tomatoes.

loans.name: Epifania

texts.en:
Epifania is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Epifania is 59 years old now.

Epifania has a abaca weaving business in the Philippines. Epifania requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy abaca fiber and other supplies to use in her business.

Epifania has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Epifania would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy abaca fiber and other supplies to use in her business.

loans.name: Maa Majhi Gouri - 1 Group

texts.en:
This group is located in Muniguda, district Rayagada of Odisha, India. The group consists of six women members from below poverty-line category, and Rajima is one of them. The lady standing second from the left with a raised hand in the photo is Rajima. She is 35 years old. She is the leader of this SHG (self-help group). She lives with her husband and two sons.

Rajima has been doing a fruits and vegetables business with the support of her husband for the last ten years. Rajima manages the in-house activities as well as the business. From the business, she earns a monthly income of 8,500 INR. According to Rajima, in the context of the present market situation, this income is hand to mouth for her family, so it is very difficult to think of the future development. Although there is potential market for her business, finance was a hindrance for her.

After the intervention of Mahashakti Foundation in her village, she saw a ray of hope and motivated other women members to borrow from Mahashakti Foundation by forming this group. It will be the third-cycle loan. The past repayment behavior is 100% on time.

From the present loan, she will purchase stock of brinjal, tomatoes, green chilies, ginger, garlic, cauliflower, cabbage, carrots, cucumbers, and all green vegetables, as well as bananas, apples, oranges, pineapple, etc. to expand the existing business. She hopes this will help her to generate more income to materialize her dream of giving better education to her children and to construct a house for her family.

The other five members of the group are also running small enterprises like vegetable vending and fruits stall.

loans.use: to purchase stock of brinjal, tomatoes, green chilies, ginger, garlic, cauliflower, cabbage, carrots, and cucumbers, as well as bananas, apples, oranges, pineapples, etc.

loans.name: Amaro

texts.en:
Amaro is a 39-year-old married father of three child who works hard to support his family. He is a staff of an agriculture college and his wife is housewife. Although the family works very hard, it can be difficult for them to afford the cost of their cousin's education.

This loan of $ 1,000 will allow Amaro to help his cousin to graduate from University. He will use the loan to pay for registration, textbooks, and school supplies. In the future, Amaro hopes that his cousins are all well-educated and knowledgeable.

loans.use: to pay for registration, textbooks, and school supplies.

loans.name: Maa Majhi Gouri - 2 Group

texts.en:
In the year 2010, a women entrepreneur named Jayanti from Muniguda village in Rayagada district in Odisha, India formed a group with five other women of her locality with the intervention of Mahashakti Foundation. The lady standing second from left raising her hand in the photo is Jayanti.

She is 31 years old, living with her husband and only son. She is doing vegetable vending with the support of her husband. Jayanti is selling vegetables from her home. She started this business seven years ago on a small scale and has been working hard to grow her business. Her family earns a monthly income of 8,500 INR which makes it very hard to manage the family with educational, domestic and business expenses.

Due to lack of finance she is not able to complete the construction of her house. So Jayanti is planning to expand her business. From the present loan she will purchase a stock of brinjal, tomatoes, green chili, zinger, garlic, curly flower, cabbages, carrots, cucumbers and all green vegetables with a large quantity of potatoes and onions. Jayanti dreams of completing the construction of her house and giving better education to her children.

The other five members of the group, are doing vegetable vending and fruit businesses.

loans.use: to purchase brinjal, tomatoes, green chili, zinger, garlic, curly flower, cabbages, carrots, cucumbers, potatoes and onions.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El señor es un joven padre de familia que actualmente padece de fuertes dolores dentales debido a una malformación congénita en su dentadura posterior, por lo que requiere un tratamiento reconstructivo maxilar para poder corregir su dentadura y poder llevar un nivel de vida mejor.
texts.en:
He is a young father who currently suffers from strong dental pain due to a congenital malformation of his back teeth.

He, therefore, needs reconstructive jaw treatment to be able to correct his teeth and to be able to live a higher quality of life.

loans.use: to pay for dental treatment.

loans.name: Dilsia Del Carmen

texts.es: Dilsia de 34 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa propia con su hijo, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace 20 años inicio el negocio con ayuda de su madre para poder sacar adelante a su hijo y gracias a ese trabajo es como ha podido salir adelante, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas ropa por mayor para poder continuar con su trabajo y asi tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en: Dilsia is 34 years old. She is a single mother and is living in her own house with her son. She is selling clothes for 20 years. She started the business with the help of her mother to be able to bring her son forward. Thanks to this work she managed to get ahead. She is requesting a loan to buy more wholesale clothing so she can continue her work and thus have a better income.

loans.use: to buy more wholesale clothing.

loans.name: Ronie

texts.en:
Ronie is a 28-year-old man who lives in Baybay, Leyte with his family. He is the father of an 11-month-old baby boy. He is raising his family by running a hog raising business. He has been doing this for two years.

Thus, he is asking for a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy additional piglets to raise and to buy feed as well.

In the future, he wishes for healthy growth for the pigs he is raising and for his business to become profitable. He wants to improve and expand his business for the sustainability of his family.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is a married man. He has three children. He describes himself to be disciplined.

He operates a retail business where he sells clothes. He has been involved in this business for six years. His business is located in a good area, and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes.

His business goal is to have a big boutique within five years. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes.

loans.name: Julian Jr.

texts.en:
Julian is encouraged that he previously received and faithfully paid back his loan on time. He continues to work hard despite the hardship of driving a tricycle under the heat of the sun and the rains during rainy season to provide for his loved ones.

To help Julian maintain his service, he is again humbly seeking a PHP 25,000 loan to replace tires, tune-up and fuel his tricycle. He values his transportation business for it is his main source of income. He is thanking God and you in advance for supporting his livelihood.

Julian aims to acquire one more tricycle to improve his income. He prays for safety and guidance for his business. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay Micro finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for tricycle maintenance (new tires, tune-up and fuel).

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a woman with five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Evelyn is 36 years old and has three children who are in school.

Evelyn has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines. Evelyn requested a PHP 19,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy abaca fiber and other supplies for her business.

Evelyn has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Evelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy abaca fiber and other supplies for her business.

loans.name: Hazel

texts.en:
Hazel is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Hazel is 43 years old and has two children who are in school.

Hazel has a business buying and selling mineral water in the Philippines. Hazel requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more containers of mineral water to sell.

Hazel has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Hazel would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more containers of mineral water to sell.

loans.name: Levina

texts.en:
Levina is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Levina is 41 years old and has two children who are in school.

Levina has a internet café business in the Philippines. Levina requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy a monitor, a mouse, etc..

Levina has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Levina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy a monitor and a mouse.

loans.name: Emelia Mirasol

texts.en:
Emelia Mirasol is 44 years old and married with three children. With two of her children in school, Emelia Mirasol works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and and sells a variety of items. She requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, like eggs, cigarettes, coffee, and other groceries.

Emelia Mirasol has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like eggs, cigarettes, coffee, and other groceries.

loans.name: Gina Paola

texts.es: Gina es una comerciante reconocida en el municipio de Sabanalarga que cuenta con una amplia experiencia en la administración de su tienda de víveres y abarrotes ubicada en esta localidad. Su  madre fue propietaria de una tienda en donde ella le ayudaba y pudo adquirir experiencia, para que años más tardes continuara con este legado familiar al aperturar su propio negocio en el año 2013 en las instalaciones de su vivienda, permitiéndole cumplir con su  rol de cónyuge y responsabilidades en el hogar. Todos los días de la semana a partir de las 6 a.m. en jornada continua hasta las 8 p.m., su negocio está disponible para recibir a vecinos y transeúntes que realizan sus compras de víveres correspondientes  a la canasta familiar, es por ello que su negocio debe estar muy bien surtido para que encuentren todo lo que necesitan en un mismo lugar.  En la actualidad aplicó a una solicitud de crédito, su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para comprar víveres, bebidas, carnes y verduras al por mayor a proveedores en el mercado. Su meta a futuro es adecuar su vivienda y darle más espacio al local donde funciona su tienda.
texts.en: Gina is a merchant, well known in the town of Sabanalarga, who has lots of experience in managing her food and grocery store. Her mother had a store where she helped and she was able to gain experience so that years later she would be able to continue this family achievement by starting her own business in her home in 2013. This allowed her to fulfill her responsibilities as a spouse and in the home. She works every day from 6:00 am to 8:00 pm and her business is ready to welcome neighbors and passers-by who stop by to make their food purchases. This is why her business needs to be well-stocked so that customers will be able to find everything they need in one place. She used her first Kiva loan, through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to buy foodstuff, beverages, meats, and vegetables in quantity from suppliers in the market. Her goals for the future are to fix up her home and provide more room for her store.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Gregorie

texts.en:
Gregorie is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Gregorie is 35 years old and has four children who are in school.

Gregorie has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines. Gregorie requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy spare parts and other materials needed in her business.

Gregorie has been in this business for 6 years. In the future, Gregorie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Florenda

texts.en:
Florenda is 57 years old and married with one child who is in school. Florenda works very hard to provide for them.

Florenda has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell.

Florenda has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, canned goods and other groceries.

In the future Florenda would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith is a married woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself as honest. She operates a retail business where she sells sugar, bread, flour, soap cooking oil and other items. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, bread, flour, cooking oil and other items. She hopes that in the future, she will have a large scale shop. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, bread, flour, cooking oil and other items.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 39 years old and married with five children; three of her children are in school. She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Gemma has been in this business for 19 years now and has borrowed from NWTF two times in the past to sustain it. In the future, she would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Dilobai's Group

texts.en:
Cow rearing being a cost-effective venture to earn some income many people in rural areas are involved in this activity. It is convenient to run from home and does not require any extra time like other businesses. Dilobai, a widow, standing to the left hand side in the photograph, also has been running a cow rearing activity for the last 6 years to earn some additional income for her family. Her only son works as a labour to support their family expenses, after his father's demise.

Dilobai's earnings from the sale of cow's milk to local people has been helping the family in leading a better life. Along with her group member, she wishes to avail of a loan of 30,000 INR from Kiva's partner People's Forum. She will use her portion of the loan amount to buy one more cow for her business.

She feels that without doing much extra effort this scaling up of the business will help her in earning double income and improving their financial conditions.

loans.use: to buy one more cow for her business.

loans.name: Ma. Evelyn

texts.en:
Ma. Evelyn is a married woman with one child. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Ma. Evelyn is 51 years old now.

Ma. Evelyn has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Ma. Evelyn requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy boxes of fish to sell.

Ma. Evelyn has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Ma. Evelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Ashafa

texts.en:
Ashafa is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Ashafa has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Ashafa would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Ashafa can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Ashafa will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Ashafa is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to ensure that all his children get a post-secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 45 years old and has four children. Lolita is married and has three children who are in school.

Lolita is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Lolita requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Lolita has been in this business for 3 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Lolita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Elosy

texts.en:
Elosy is a married woman with two children. She describes herself as joyful. She operates a retail business where she sells cereals. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals.

Elosy says that her biggest business challenge is inadequate working capital. She will use this KES 30,000 loan to buy more cereals to sell. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children.

Elosy's business goal is to have a big cereals store within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children to university level.

This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She successfully repaid her previous loan.

loans.use: to buy more cereals to sell.

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela, a Kiva borrower with two children, describes herself to be honest. For five years Pamela has been operating a retail business where she sells sugar, bread, cereals, flour, soap, cooking oil and other items. Her primary customers are locals, and her biggest business challenge is inadequate working capital.

Pamela will use this Kes 25,000 loan to buy more sugar, bread, soda, flour, cooking oil and other items. Her previous two loans fully repaid, this will be her third with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, bread, soda, flour, cooking oil and other items.

loans.name: Maa Bhairabi Group

texts.en:
Mamata, aged 32, is a self-motivated active women entrepreneur from Muniguda village in Rayagada district of Odisha, India. She is a very hard-working lady sitting third from left with a raised hand in the photo. She resides with her husband and only one son.

Mamata has been doing leaf plate making and selling for the last five years. Her husband is also supporting her in the business. Initially Mamata started this business with a small investment of her own. When Mahashakti Foundation started working in her village she motivated another five women entrepreneurs and formed a group named “Maa Bhairabi” during 2014 and took loan for the development of their businesses.

Now Mamata’s income is about 7,800 INR per month, but it is not at all sufficient to meet the household expenses. So for further development she will take another loan. It will be the 2nd cycle loan for the group. The previous loan was repaid on time. From this loan Mamata will purchase huge quantity of leaves. Mamata hopes to construct a permanent cabin for her business and a good house for her family.

The other five members are doing a shop selling mutton, leaf plate making and selling, a hotel, a grocery shop and vegetable vending.

loans.use: to purchase a huge quantity of leaves.

loans.name: Trust In God Group

texts.en:
The 'Trust in God' group in the Chorkor area has a membership of two energetic women. Their names are Victoria and Felicia. They sell fruits and underwear respectively and are seeking help from Kiva through ID-Ghana for a loan sum of 1700GHS.
Victoria is the group leader, She is in her twelfth year of working experience at the marketplace where she sells fruit. This business has made her gain access to regular customers. She seeks a loan to purchase more fruit on a wholesale basis, due to the increase in fruit consumption.
Victoria is married with two children and lives in a compound house in the locality of Chorkor.

loans.use: to purchase more fruit on a wholesale basis, due to the increase in fruit consumption.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Bintou est un éleveur ovin  malien,  qui  tient la corde de la main droite et la corne du bélier de la main gauche.
Agée  de  49 ans, mariée et mère  de 4 enfants, dont leur âgés  respectifs sont: 10 ans ; 8 ans ; 6 ans et 4 ans, et un(01 est scolarisé.
 Depuis 20 ans, Bintou exerce l’élevage des ovins (moutons, chèvres), elle emprunte au RMCR  pour  acheter  sur le marché hebdomadaire des villages voisins plus  d’agneaux afin de les élever tout en les ajoutant de la valeur ajoutée. 
Son mari est un vieux paysan de 62 ans, qui se contente des produits de la récolte agricoles pour faire face aux besoins de la famille  
 Huit mois  déjà les produits de Bintou sont fin prêts pour être revendus elle les acheminent à l’occasion sur les différents marchés hebdomadaires des villages environnants et génère par la suite un profit de 25 000 f CFA par tête de mouton qui ,la permette de subvenir à ses besoins et à celui de ses enfants notamment la prise en charge  des frais de scolarité et les frais médicaux ainsi ,qu’elle épaule son  mari dans la prise en charge  de la famille. 
Une femme qui se bat elle tient toujours a ces engagements de remboursement ses difficultés dans l’exercice de son activité sont la montée du prix de l’aliment bétail en période sèche et manque de vétérinaires qualifiés pour donner  meilleurs soins aux animaux.      
Son  ambition est de recevoir une formation pratique  sur l’élevage qui, va lui permettre d’exercer son activité efficacement .
texts.en:
Bintou, the woman holding the ram in the photo, is a livestock farmer from Mali. She is a 49-year-old married mother to four children, aged between four and 10 years old. Only one of her children is currently receiving an education. She is married to an elderly farmer, aged 62, who relies on harvesting crops to provide for his family.

For the past 20 years. Bintou has been raising livestock (sheep and goats). She has turned to RMCR so she can purchase more sheep from the weekly markets in neighbouring villages. By doing this, she will be able to earn a greater profit when she sells them all.

After eight months of rearing, Bintou's livestock is ready to be resold. She takes them to the different weekly markets held in the surrounding area and earns around 25,000 FCFA per sheep. These profits allow her to meet her needs and those of her children, notably their school and medical fees. She is also able to support her husband in providing for their family.

Bintou always works as hard as she can and she sticks to her repayment schedule. Some of the difficulties she faces in this business include the increased cost of livestock feed during periods of drought and the lack of qualified local veterinarians to treat her animals.

Her ambition is to receive practical livestock training which will allow her to better manage her activity.

loans.use: to purchase sheep and goats to raise as livestock.

loans.name: Mujeres Responsables Group

texts.es:
LA ASOCIACION COMUNAL MUJERES RESPONSABLES ESTA CONFORMADA POR DOCE INTEGRANTES TODAS MUJERES, ORIGINARIAS DE MALPAISILLO, LUGAR QUE ESTA UBICADO EN LA ZONA DE OCCIDENTE DE LEON, SE CARACTERIZA POR SER TRABAJADORAS, RESPONSABLES, CON GANAS DE SUPERACION PERSONAL EN SUS RATOS LIBRE LE GUSTA  DISFRUTRA DE LA COMPAÑÍA DE SUS HIJOS, EN LA ACTUALIDAD LUCHAN PARA SEGUIR ADELANTE, PARA BRINDARELES A SUS HIJOS UN FUTURO MEJOR.
GRACIAS A SUS GANAS DE SALIR ADELANTE LA CORDINADORA ES PASTORA Y TIENE POR ACTIVIDAD ECONOMICA LA VENTA DE COSMETICOS COMO: BODY, CREMAS, SHAMPOO, ANTI OJERAS, DELINEADOR, CREMAS ANTIARRUGAS, LABIALES, PERFUMES ETC. ELLA DEDICA A SU NEGOCIO UNAS DIES HORAS DIARIAS OFRECIENDO SUS PRODUCTOS, CON EL OBJETIVO DE OBTENER MEJORES GANANCIAS EN UN FUTURO NO MUY LEJANO. MUJERES RESPONSABLES AGRADECEN LA AYUDA QUE LOS INVERSIONISTAS KIVA LE BRINDAN A PERSONA SE ESCASOS RECURSOS Y PAISES POBRE COMO ES NICARAGUA PARA TENER UN MEDIO DE TRABAJO DIGNO.
texts.en:
The Mujeres Responsables community bank is made up of 12 members. They are originally from Malpaisillo, located in the west of Leon. They are known for being hard-working and responsible, aiming for personal improvement. In their free time, they like to enjoy the company of their children. Currently, they are fighting to move forward, to provide their children with a better future.

Thanks to her desire to get ahead, the coordinator is Pastora. She earns a living through selling cosmetics such as: body lotion, cream, shampoo, eye cream, eyeliner, anti-wrinkle cream, lipstick, perfume and other items. She works in her business for around ten hours per day, selling her products. Her goal is to obtain better profits in the not-too-distant future.

Mujeres Responsables are grateful for the help that Kiva investors give to people with few resources and poor countries, such as Nicaragua, so that they may have a dignified way of working.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics such as: perfume, body lotion, anti-wrinkle eye cream, make-up remover, lipstick, concealer, blusher and eye shadow, etc.

loans.name: Maria Paula

texts.es: Doña Maria de 59 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas y tambien tiene tienda, con lo que obtiene de sus trabajos logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella quiere mejorar su vivienda encemnetando el piso y colocando puertas y ventanas pero como no posee de suficiente capital esta solicitando un credito para la compra de materiales de construccion necesarios y pago de mano de obra para poder tener una vivienda digna.
texts.en:
Maria is 59 years old and lives in her own house with her family group. She earns a living by selling tortillas and she also has a shop. With what she earns from her jobs, she is able to settle some of her home expenses.

She wants to improve her home, starting with the floor and hanging doors and windows. However, as she does not have enough capital she is asking for a loan to buy the necessary construction materials, and to pay for the labour so that she can have a dignified home.

loans.use: to buy necessary construction materials and to pay for labour.

loans.name: Digna

texts.en:
Digna is 56 years old; she is married and has two children.

She is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Digna requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Digna has been pig fattening for six years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Digna would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: ELLA ES UNA SEÑORA DE 55 AÑOS DE EDAD VIUDA Y MADRE DE FAMILIA, SUFRE DE INFLAMACIÓN EN LAS ENCÍAS Y SANGRADO, POR LO QUE LE URGE UN TRATAMIENTO PARA EVITAR LA PERDIDA DE VARIAS PIEZAS DENTALES, DESAFORTUNADAMENTE NO CUENTA CON EL DINERO NECESARIO PUES LOS RECURSOS QUE OBTIENE TRABAJANDO COMO AFANADORA EN UNA EMPRESA NO LE ALCANZAN PARA SOLVENTAR EL TRATAMIENTO.
texts.en: She is 55 years old, a widow and a parent. She suffers from inflamed and bleeding gums, so she has been encouraged to seek treatment in order to avoid  the loss of several teeth. Unfortunately she doesn't have the money necessary, as the amount of money she makes working as a cleaner  at a company is not enough to pay for the treatment.

loans.use: to obtain dental treatment.

loans.name: San Bartolome Group

texts.es: Betty tiene 48 años de edad es casada con 02 hijos dependientes. Ella se dedica a la venta de frutas palta chirimoya y tunas hace 22 años. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de mas frutas al por mayor directamente de la chacra. Para luego expenderlos a los mercados a un precio que genere buenas ganancias. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Betty es la segunda persona parada del lado derecho.
texts.en:
Betty is 48 years old, married, and has two dependent children. She has sold local fruit (avocados, chirimoya, and prickly pears) for 22 years. She will use the money from this loan to buy more fruit in bulk directly from the farm to sell at the markets for prices that generate good profits. 

The group is thankful to the KIVA lenders for the loan. Betty is pictured standing second from the right.

loans.use: to buy more fruit wholesale.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself to be visionary.

Beatrice operates a retail business where she sells soap, flour, sugar, vegetables and other items. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in an area with potential for growth and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, flour, soap, rice and other items.

Her business goal is to have a wholesale business within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have improved living standards.

This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, flour, soap, rice and other items.

loans.name: Jamilu

texts.en:
Jamilu is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Jamilu has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Jamilu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Jamilu can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Jamilu will benefit from the marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land.

Jamilu is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the lives of his children and family, and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Madelyn

texts.en:
Madelyn is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Madelyn is 55 years old and has three children who are in school.

Madelyn has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients such as vegetables, fish, etc..

Madelyn has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as vegetables, fish, etc.

loans.name: Sonia Del Carmen

texts.es: Sonia de 39 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo quien trabaja como agricultor, ella se dedica desde hace 2 años a la venta de pupusas, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes, gracias a su trabajo y al credito que habia solicitado anteriormente ha podido solventar algunos gastos y comprar mas materia prima, la clienta nuevamente esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas maíz, frijol, chicharrón, quesillo, etc. para poder continuar con la elaboración de las pupusas y así poder tener mejores ingresos para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Sonia is 39 years old and lives in her own house with her husband who works as a farmer. She has earned a living for the last 2 years selling pupusas (thick corn tortillas stuffed with meat, cheese or beans). Her business is located in her place of residence and she has a lot of customers. Thanks to her hard work and the loan that she took out previously, she has been able to settle some expenses and buy more premium material.

Sonia is currently asking for a loan to buy more corn, beans, pork rinds, fresh cheese and other items to be able to continue making pupusas. This way she will be able to have a better income for a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more corn, beans, pork rinds, fresh cheese and other items.

loans.name: Maritza Estela

texts.es: Maritza de 33 años de edad reside en vivienda propia al lado de su hija de 9 años de edad y su hijo de 14 años de edad. Ella es una madre responsable y trabajadora que busca la manera que a sus hijos no les falte nada, y para ello se dedica a administrar un negocio de venta de artículos varios con el fin de poder obtener los ingresos económicos necesarios y así cubrir sus necesidades básicas y las de su familia. Maritza solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: platos y vasos desechables, ropa para dama y caballero, medicina, utensilios de cocina, etc. para aumentar las ventas de su negocio y así también las ganancias.
texts.en:
Maritza is 33 years old and lives in her own house with her 9-year-old daughter and 14-year old son. She is a responsible and hard-working mother who is seeking a way to provide for her children. To do this, she makes her living managing a store that sells various items with the goal of obtaining the necessary income to cover her basic needs and those of her family. 

Maritza is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in: disposable plates and cups, men's and women's clothing, medicine, cooking utensils, etc. to be able to increase her sales at her business and in this way also increase her earnings.

loans.use: to invest in disposable plates and cups, women's and men's clothing, medicine, cooking utensils, etc. to sell in her store

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a married woman. She has four children. She operates a farm where she keeps dairy cows. She has been involved in this business for 12 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

Grace will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy another dairy cow. She hopes that in the future she will have more dairy cows.

This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy another dairy cow.

loans.name: Nelyn

texts.en:
Nelyn is 26 years old and married with two children. With one child in school, Nelyn works very hard to provide for them.

Nelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like bread, beverages, canned goods, home care products and other groceries.

Nelyn has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Nelyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like bread, beverages, canned goods, home care products and other groceries.

loans.name: Nora Belinda

texts.es: Doña Nora, tiene 51 años de edad, esta casada, ella tuvo 4 hijos pero vive junto a dos de ellos en el Municipio de Macuelizo, Santa Bárbara. Ella tiene su propio negocio de venta de ropa y variedades. Hace 11 años que se dedica a este negocio el cual lo ha establecido en un local en la comunidad cercana de donde vive y vende pantalones, blusas, camisas, ropa interior, faldas, zapatos, juguetes y otros. Está solicitando el cuarto ciclo de préstamo con la institución y  es por 10,000 Lempiras para comprar ropa nueva como blusas, camisas, pantalones, sandalias, y variedades, con esta inversión espera incrementar los ingresos para su familia y aumentar su clientela. Su sueño es crecer como microempresaria y generar ingresos para mejorar su calidad de vida y de su familia.
texts.en:
Nora, age 51, is married. She had four children, but she lives with two of them in the Macuelizo municipality in Santa Bárbara. She has her own business selling clothes and assorted items. She established her business 11 years ago at a place in the community that is close to where she lives. She sells pants, blouses, shirts, underwear, skirts, shoes, toys, and other items.

She is requesting her fourth loan cycle with the institution for 10,000 lempiras to buy new clothes like blouses, shirts, pants, sandals, and other items. With this investment she hopes to increase her income for her family and to increase her clientele.

Her dream is to grow as a small businesswoman and to generate income in order to improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy new clothes like blouses, pants, shirts, sandals, and other items to stock up on and sell.

loans.name: Mupa

texts.en:
Mupa is a married mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over six years, she has operated an open-air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves and cooking fat.

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves and cooking fat.

loans.name: Isiyaku

texts.en:
Isiyaku is a maize farmer from Dan Auta village. As a Babban Gona member, Isiyaku is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Isiyaku would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member, Isiyaku can to store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize, at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Isiyaku no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Isiyaku hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Shehu

texts.en:
Shehu is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Shehu has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Shehu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Shehu can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Shehu will benefit from the marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land.

Shehu is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the lives of his children and family, and looks forward to using his additional earnings to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: el joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 25 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica a la crianza de ganado repasto y a la agricultura se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 6 años y es gracias a ese trabajo como puede salir a delante, el joven vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, el esta solicitando un credito para la compra de ganado repasto y asi poder continuar con la crianza ya que esa es su fuente de trabajo.
texts.en:
The young man who has his face pixelated is 25 years old and lives in a high risk area. He devotes himself to raising grazing cattle and agriculture. He has been engaged in this business activity for six years. Thanks to this work he is able to get ahead. He lives in his own house with his family.

He is requesting a loan to buy grazing cattle. This way he will be able to continue raising cattle, which is his source of work.

loans.use: to buy grazing cattle.

loans.name: Naciendo Con Esperanza Group

texts.es:
lA ASOCIACIÓN COMUNAL NACIENDO CON ESPERANZA ESTA CONFORMADA POR NUEVE INTEGRANTES DOS HOMBRES Y SIETE MUJERES, MADRES Y PADRES RESPONSABLES CON QUINCE HIJOS TODOS ORIGINARIOS DEL SAUCE LUGAR QUE ESTA UBICADO EN LA ZONA NORTE DE LA REGIÓN, SE CARACTERIZAN POR SER TRABAJADORES, RESPONSABLES, CON GANAS DE SUPERACIÓN PERSONAL EN SUS RATOS LIBRE LE GUSTA DISFRUTAR DE LA COMPANIA DE SUS HIJOS, LAMENTABLEMENTE POR FALTA DE RECURSOS ECONÓMICOS NO PUDIERON ESTUDIAR Y SE VIERON EN LA NECESIDAD DE TRABAJAR A TEMPRANA EDAD, PARA AYUDAR CON LOS GASTOS DEL HOGAR

GRACIAS A SUS GANAS DE SALIR ADELANTE LA COORDINADORA ES ERIKA Y TIENE POR ACTIVIDAD ECONÓMICA UNA PULPERIA LA CUAL CONSISTE EN UNA PEQUEÑA TIENDA QUE VENDE PRODUCTOS COMESTIBLES EN CANTIDADES PEQUEÑAS COMO: ARROZ, FRIJOLES, AZÚCAR, LECHE, PAN, JUGOS, GALLETAS ETC. EL OBJETIVO DEL CREDITO ES INVERTIR EN CAPITAL DE TRABAJO Y SURTIR PARA QUE EN UN FUTURO NO MUY LEJANO PUEDA OBTENER MEJORES INGRESOS. NACIENDO CON ESPERANA AGRADECE LA AYUDA QUE LOS INVERSIONISTAS KIVA LE BRINDAN A PERSONAS DE ESCASOS RECURSOS   Y PAISES POBRE COMO ES NICARAGUA PARA TENER UN MEDIO DE TRABAJO DIGNO.
texts.en:
The "Naciendo con Esperanza" communal bank is made up of nine members, two men and seven women, mothers and fathers responsible for fifteen children. They are all natives of El Sauce which is located in the Northern region of the country. They are hard-working and responsible with a desire for personal growth. In their spare time they like to enjoy the company of their children. Unfortunately due to the lack of economic resources they couldn't study. They had to work at an early age to help with the household expenses.

Thanks to her desire to get ahead Erika is the coordinator. Her economic activity is a small grocery store where she sells food products in small quantities like: rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, cheese, oil, juice, biscuits, etc. The object of the loan is to invest in working capital and stock so that in the not too distant future she can obtain higher income.

The "Naciendo con Esperanza" communal bank is grateful for the support from Kiva lenders for people of low resources and poor countries like Nicaragua to have a means of dignified work.

loans.use: to buy food products like rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, cheese, oil, juice, biscuits, etc.

loans.name: Mengkea

texts.en:
Mengkea, a rice farmer in Kampong Cham province, is 34 years old and married. He has two dependent children, one of whom is in school while the other one is too young for school.

He has grown rice as his main source of income for 10 years. He earns additional income by working for others for a fee. He earns about (USD) $5 per day and can save about (USD) $3 each day for future needs.

Mengkea is new to VisionFund and is applying for a loan to renovate his house. He hopes to live in a proper and comfortable house so his family members can be healthier.

loans.use: to renovate his house.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Willians Nahun

texts.es: Willians de 31 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus dos hijas, el se dedica desde hace 3 años a la crianza de ganado de engorde comercializa sus productos en los pueblos aledaños y con ese trabajo logra solventar los gastos del hogar, el cliente esta solicitando nuevamente un credito para la compra de otros toretes de engorde para seguir con la crianza y poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: 31-year-old Willians lives in his own home with his wife and two daughters. For three years, he has been raising beef cattle. He sells his products in nearby towns. This occupation allows him to pay for his household expenses. He is requesting a new loan to buy young beef bulls in order to improve his income and have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy young beef bulls.

loans.name: Hector Adonay

texts.es: Hector de 34 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, el se dedica la cultivo de loroco, jocote, maiz y frijol desde hace 15 años, cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la comercializa en los pueblos aledaños y con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el esta solicitando un credito para la compra de insumos agricolas como: abono, fertilizantes, controles de plagas, etc. para tener una buna cosecha y asi mejores ganancias.
texts.en: 34-year-old Hector lives in his own home with his wife. He has been growing loroco (a Central American edible flower), jocote (a Central American fruit), corn and beans for the past 15 years. When his harvest is ready, he sells the products in nearby towns. His earnings allow him to cover his household expenses. He is requesting a loan to buy agricultural supplies such as fertilizers, plague controls, etc. in order to have a good harvest and improve his income.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies such as fertilizers, plague controls, etc.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a 47-year-old married mother of six children, two in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Nancy has a tailoring business in the Philippines. Nancy requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials like thread and needles for her dress making business.

Nancy has been in this business for five years. In the future, Nancy would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials like thread and needles for her dress making business.

loans.name: Almavic

texts.en:
Rosenel is 16 years old and is the oldest of three children in the family. Her mother, Almavic, supports the family through her food vending business in the Philippines.

Rosenel is studying for a bachelor of science degree in business administration and is currently in her first year of this four-year course.

Almavic is borrowing PHP 6,900 to pay the tuition fees of her daighter Rosenel for the second semester of the 2015-16 school year..

When she graduates, Rosenel plans to be gainfully employed in the future.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees.

loans.name: Judy Ann

texts.en:
Judy Ann is 22 years old, single and works very hard.

Judy Ann runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, snack foods, home care products, and other groceries.

Judy Ann has been in this business for one year and sells a variety of items in her store.

In the future, Judy Ann would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, snack foods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Foliga

texts.en:
Foliga is 35 years old and married with four children. She lives in Samoa.

Foliga owns and operates a convenience store in her village. She has been running her business for eight years now. She has an excellent repayment record.

Foliga is applying for a loan to buy a freezer, chicken, flour, sugar, rice, tinned fish, vegetable oil, milk, and sausage to help her run the business.

She became a member of SPBD in 2007.

loans.use: to buy a freezer, chicken, flour, sugar, rice, tinned fish, vegetable oil, milk, and sausage,.

loans.name: Jose Adrian

texts.es: José es un joven soltero de veinte años de edad ,estudiante de Administración de Empresas eligió esta Profesión ya que actualmente existe demanda laboral en esta carrera,trabaja en una empresa como asistente Administrativo por las tardes ya que por las mañanas estudia,le va muy bien tiene buenas calificaciones, José no cuenta con la ayuda económica de sus padres ya que no cuentan con recursos para ello, el préstamo que solicito le permitirá poder sacar la titulación que es costosa y sentirse mas tranquilo,Agradece mucho el apoyo recibido por los inversionistas Kiva ya que sin su ayuda nada de esto podría ser posible por que elmayor obstáculo que tenia era la falta de apoyo económico.
texts.en:
José is twenty years old and single. He is a Business Administration student, and chose this profession because of the current demand there is for jobs in this field. He works for a company as an administrative assistant in the afternoons, and goes to school in the mornings. Things are going very well for him and he is getting good grades.

José doesn't get financial support from his parents because they don't have the resources to help him. The loan he is requesting will allow him to earn his degree, which is costly, and to have more peace of mind.

He is very grateful for the support offered by Kiva lenders. Lack of financial support was his main obstacle, so none of this would be possible without their help.

loans.use: to pay for college fees.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 30 years old and married with four children, all in school. Marites works very hard to provide for her family.

Marites runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, bread, snack foods, home care products, and other groceries.

Marites has been in this business for one year and sells a variety of items in her store.

In the future, Marites would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, bread, snack foods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Rubie Ann

texts.en:
Rubie Ann is a 25-year-old mother of four children, three in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Rubie Ann has a egg vending business in the Philippines. Rubie Ann requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy more eggs to sell. Rubie Ann has been in this business for four years.

In the future, Rubie Ann would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more eggs to sell.

loans.name: Faalogoae

texts.en:
Faalogoae is a 58-year-old mother with 4 children and has a small business of selling vegetables (cabbage, eggplant, and cucumber) in her community to earn a living.

Faalogoae requested a loan to buy vegetable seeds, chemicals, wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, and hand gloves to assist her in running the business.

She hopes to expand her business by using her profit. She became a member of SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds, chemicals, wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, and hand gloves.

loans.name: Amriddin

texts.ru: Амриддин молодой активный дехканин. Он проживает на районе Хамадони. У Амриддин трое детей. Он живет вместе с матерью, братом, снохой, женой и детьми. Амриддин занимается купли-продажи скота. Он покупает скота, откармливает их несколько месяцев, потом перепродает  их на скотном рынке. Амриддин идет по стопам дедушки. Он зарабатывает на жизнь, только путем выращивание скота. С начала бизнеса Амриддину было тяжело, потом он освоил все навыки. Более 5 лет Амриддин продвигает свою работу. Амриддин решил взять кредит и приобрести несколько скотов. Ваш кредит поможет ему расширить животноводческую деятельность.  Амриддин будет рад на Вашу помощь.
texts.en: Amriddin is a young and active farmer. He lives in the Hamadoni region, and has three children. He lives with his mother, brother, daughter-in-law, wife and children. Amriddin works in the buying and selling of livestock. He buys cattle, fattens them for several months, and then resells them at the livestock market. Amriddin is following in the footsteps of his grandfather, and earns a living purely by raising cattle. When starting the business, it was hard for Amriddin, but now he has mastered all of the skills and after 5 years, he has expanded his work. Amriddin decided to take a loan and acquire some cattle. Your loan helps him to grow his livestock business. Amriddin will be happy for your help.

loans.use: to buy some cattle and expand his livestock business.

loans.name: Ruby

texts.en:
Ruby, 42, is married with three children, one of whom is in school.

Ruby is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Ruby has been raising pigs for 1 year now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Ruby would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Juana Alicia

texts.es: Hace cuatro años que Doña Juana se dedica a su pequeña pulpería su esposo y su hija son su principal apoyo en cada momento, poco a poco ha ido diversificando su negocio con diversos productos para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes. Doña Juana quiere seguir incrementando sus ventas es por esta razón que solicita un crédito para comprar granos básicos, gaseosas, jugos, galletas entre otros productos de consumo. Con las ganancias obtenidas podrá mejorar su estabilidad económica y ahorrar para comprar más vitrinas para el negocio.
texts.en:
For the past four years, Juana has been running a small grocery store. Her husband and her daughter are her main source of support at all times. She has gradually diversified her business little by little, incorporating new products in order to meet her customers' demand.

Juana wants to continue increasing sales, which is why she is requesting a loan to buy basic grains, sodas, juice, cookies, and other grocery products. The profit she makes will allow her to improve her financial stability and to save up money to buy more display cases for her business.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, sodas, juice, cookies, and other products.

loans.name: Haruna

texts.en:
Haruna is a Babban Gona maize farmer. He is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty, renewing his dreams of gaining wealth someday.

Traditionally, Haruna would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a member of Babban Gona, Haruna can store his maize at harvest and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Benefiting from Babban Gona’s marketing support, Haruna has the opportunity to generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land.

Haruna is thankful that he no longer has to worry about having had no money to provide healthcare for his family and children, and looks forward to using his additional earnings to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Santa Librada Group

texts.es:
El grupo se formó en la ciudad de Itá, trabajan dentro del programa de eliminación, luchando por mejorar sus vidas para poder ayudar a sus seres queridos a través del esfuerzo unido de todas.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Mariela, ella se encuentra mejorando su situación de pobreza, a través del seguimiento permanente de capacitaciones y verificaciones que les da la fundación paraguaya, ella se dedica a la venta de comidas de todo tipo que ella misma hace y que después se encarga de vender por su barrio.
La Sra. Mariela pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de verduras, carne, pollo, jamón, queso y otros insumos para poder seguir con sus ventas, y de esa forma cumplir con el pedido de sus clientes.
texts.en:
This group was formed in the city of Itá. They are participating in the “Poverty Spotlight” program, striving to improve their lives in order to be able to help their loved ones, through the joint efforts of all.

One of the group members is Señora Mariela, who is improving her poverty situation through ongoing training and verification of good practice that Fundación Paraguaya gives them. She makes her living by selling all kinds of food, which she makes and then sells in her neighborhood.

Sra. Mariela is asking for this loan in order to invest in the purchase of vegetables, meat, chicken, ham, cheese and other supplies in order to be able to continue her sales, and thus fulfill her customers’ requests.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make meals, such as: vegetables, meat, chicken, ham, cheese and others.

loans.name: San Martin Group

texts.es:
El grupo de nombre San Martin está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Maria, quien a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y las aplicaciones de los comportamientos vitales de una mujer exitosa, ella se encuentra mejorando su situación de pobreza.
Maria tiene un kiosco donde vende todo tipo de productos, tiene una muy buena clientela que siempre se acerca hasta su negocio. Ella agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus seres queridos, comenta que gracias a sus esfuerzos está saliendo adelante. 
La Sra. Maria solicita  este préstamo para la compra de los productos que ella ofrece en su negocio como ser: bebidas, comestibles, jugos, golosinas, y otros productos, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir creciendo y ayudando a sus seres queridos.
texts.en:
The San Martin group is in its first loan cycle in the “Committee of Women” program, where everyone works and helps others to get ahead. One of the group members is Señora Maria, who through effort, steady work, and application of the vital skills of a successful woman, is improving her poverty situation.

Maria has a kiosk where she sells all kinds of products. She has a very good clientele, who always come to her business. She is grateful for the opportunity to be empowered to improve her living conditions and those of her loved ones. She says that thanks to her efforts, they are getting better.

Sra. Maria is requesting this loan to purchase the products she offers in her business, such as: drinks, food, juice, candy, and other products. This way she will be able to continue with her sales as she has been doing. She gives thanks for the opportunity to be enabled to keep improving and helping her loved ones.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her kiosk, such as: drinks, food, juice, candy, and other products.

loans.name: Jennilyn

texts.en:
Jennilyn is 26 years old and married with three children. She is working for Aficionado Company as a saleslady. Her husband is a tricycle driver but both their incomes cannot cover their family's daily needs and also the needs of her two children who are already now in school.

Jennilyn is applying for a loan to renovate her house. They want to renovate the house because when they have a rainy season, her family will be evacuated to another place for their safety. The purpose of her loan is to purchase some raw materials for the renovation of the house. Now Jennilyn's family will be safe if they have a heavy rain and they will feel good because of their new house.

loans.use: To pay for the raw materials for house renovation

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Maezel is 17 years old and is the 3rd of six children in her family. Her mother, Lilibeth, supports the family through her general store business in the Philippines.

Maezel is studying in a Bachelor of Secondary Education program and is currently in her 2nd year of a 4-year course.

Lilibeth is borrowing PHP 3,800 to pay for the tuition fees Maezel's second semester of the school year 2015-16.

When she graduates, Maezel plans to be gainfully employed.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees.

loans.name: Salang's Group

texts.en:
Salang, a local farmer from Battambang province, is 42 years old and a married mother of five children, four of whom are in school.

She has been growing rice as the main source of her family’s income for 10 years. Nowadays, she has been working for others for a fee to earn additional income. She is able to save about 5 USD each day.

Due to a lack of working capital, Salang decided to take a loan with VisionFund to support her farming business and this is the first loan for her. She is willing to use her loan portion to buy fertilizer and pesticide to grow the crop with nutrients.

Salang hopes her crop will grow well so that she can gain good profits to support her children’s studies until their graduation and upgrade her family’s living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide to grow the crop fruitfully so that she can gain good profits to support her children’s studying.

loans.name: Villa Jardin Group

texts.es:
El grupo Villa Jardín  está en su ciclo número 5to del programa de comité de mujeres, son de la Ciudad de Itá, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, esforzándose por poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus seres queridos.
Laura es una de las que integra este grupo, ella es una persona muy trabajadora que con sacrificio y esfuerzo está logrando salir adelante, se dedica a la costura, es una mujer muy buena en lo que hace y es por eso que tiene muy buena clientela, gracias a ello tiene los medios para poder procurar una mejor calidad de vida para ella y su familia.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de telas, hilos, gomas, cierres, y otros insumos para poder seguir con sus confecciones como lo viene haciendo, y agradece por la oportunidad que esta recibiendo de mejorar cada día.
texts.en:
The Villa Jardín (Town Garden) group is in its 5th loan cycle in the “Committee of Women” program. They are from the city of Itá, where they all work and help one another to get ahead. They are participating in the “Poverty Spotlight” program, striving to improve their living conditions and that of their loved ones.

Laura is one of the group members. She is a very hardworking person, who through sacrifice and determination is succeeding in getting ahead. She makes her living through sewing and is very good at what she does. That is why she has a very good clientele, thanks to which she has the means to obtain a better quality of life for her and her family.

She asks for this loan to buy fabric, thread, elastic bands, zippers, and other supplies to continue with her clothing making business as she has been doing. And she is grateful for the opportunity that she is receiving to improve every day.

loans.use: to buy supplies to use in making clothing, such as: fabric, thread, elastic bands, zippers, and other supplies.

loans.name: Ana Arely
