texts.es: Ana de 41 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos, ella se dedica desde hace mas de 2 años a la elaboración y venta de pupusas su negocio esta ubicado cerca de su lugar de residencia en una zona muy transitada, con lo que obtienen de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de chicharrón, quesillo, frijoles, maíz y demás ingredientes y asi poder seguir con su trabajo que le genera buenos ingresos.
texts.en: Ana is 41 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and two children. She has been making and selling pupusas out of her home, located in a well-travelled area, and is able to pay the household expenses with her earnings. She is asking for a loan to buy pork rinds, cheese, beans, dried corn, and other ingredients so she can continue to work and generate a good income.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Rosa Aminta

texts.es: Doña Rosa es una mujer emprendedora que se dedica a la elaboración de nacatamales y ladrillos a la vez, hace diez años que inicio con la actividad su mama fue quien le enseño ambas actividades. Su esposo es su principal apoyo. Para seguir aumentando sus ventas y generar mayores ganancias Doña Rosa solicita un crédito para comprar la materia prima de la elaboración de los nacatamales y los materiales para elaborar los ladrillos. De esta manera podrá cumplir con los pedidos de todos sus clientes.
texts.en:
Rosa is an enterprising woman, who earns a living through making nacatamales (a traditional corn cake steamed in banana leaves) and bricks at the same time. She started this job ten years ago. Her mother taught her both activities.

Her husband is her main supporter. To keep increasing her sales and generating greater earnings, Rosa is asking for a loan to buy raw ingredients for making nacatamales and the materials for making bricks. In this way she will be able to meet the needs of all her customers.

loans.use: to buy the raw ingredients for making nacatamales and the materials for making bricks.

loans.name: Rhoda Belle

texts.en: Rhoda Belle is a 33-year-old single mom and has only one child. She has been operating her business for more than 12 years. It is her source of income and also the provider of their daily needs such as the tuition fees of her child. Rhoda needs additional capital for her sari-sari store business as she wants her business to become a mini-grocery store at her place. She took a new loan for the purpose of improving her business and to buy additional goods for her mini-grocery business. She has a lot of costumers in her groceries shop, she provides the needs of her costumers and she also gives excellent services. Rhoda Belle is improving her living through this business because she earns more income.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods for her sari-sari store .

loans.name: Khabibullo

texts.ru: Хабибулло 35 летный бизнесмен. Он умный и честный человек. Хабибулло 35 лет. Он женат и имеет двоих детей. Его жена рукодельница. Она занимается шитьем дома, и помогает Хабибулло обеспечить семью. Сам Хабибулло имеет торговую точку на рынке. Он продает мелочи хозяйственные товары.  Хабибулло давно мечтал о расширения торговлей деятельности. Он не смог расширить торговлю, потому что он зарабатывает и тратит на жилищные расходы. Хабибулло решил взять кредит и перевозить больше товар на продажу. Путем расширения деятельности увеличиться доход от торговля. Хабибулло очень нуждается в помощи. Помогите ему расширить торговля.
texts.en: Khabibullo is a 35-year old businessman. He is a bright and honest person, and is married with two children. His wife is a seamstress; she works from home and helps Khabibullo provide for the family. Khabibullo has his own stand at the market where he sells household goods. Khabibullo has long dreamed of expanding his trade business. He could not do this, because he earns and spends on housing costs. Khabibullo decided to take a loan and carry more goods for sale. By expanding his work, revenue from trade will increase. Khabibullo is very much in need of help. Please help him to expand his trade.

loans.use: to carry more goods for sale.

loans.name: San Miguel Group

texts.es:
El grupo San Miguel es de la ciudad de  Itá, está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres, ellas están luchando y esforzándose por mejorar sus condiciones de vida, esto gracias al programa de la fundación paraguaya y al trabajo unido de todas.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Juana quien se dedica a la venta de comidas dentro de su comunidad actualmente es miembro del comité y se siente conforme y muy a gusto dentro del grupo. Ella comenta que se encarga de hacer las comidas desde muy temprano, y luego sale a vender por su barrio.
 Pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos para hacer sus comidas, como ser verduras, carne, pollo, jamón, queso, manteca, aceites y otros, y de esa forma poder seguir cumpliendo con el pedido de sus clientes. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder crecer y mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
The San Miguel group is from the city of Itá, and is in its first loan cycle with the “Committee of Women” program. They are striving and persevering to improve their living conditions, with thanks to the program of Fundación Paraguaya and the combined work of all.

One of the group members is Señora Juana who sells food in her community. Currently she is a member of the committee and feels comfortable and very happy within the group. She says that she is responsible for making meals from early in the morning, and then for selling them in her neighborhood.

She asks for this loan to buy supplies to make meals, such as vegetables, meat, chicken, ham, cheese, butter, oils and others; so as to be able to continue fulfilling her customers’ requests. She gives thanks for the opportunity to be enabled to grow and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make meals, such as: vegetables, meat, chicken, ham, cheese, butter, oils and others.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es: Edgar  tiene la edad de 65 años, está casado   y vive con  la esposa  y   actualmente. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de unas vacas de doble propósito   .El espera poder obtener más leche y queso para vender a los negocios y vecinos y engordar las crías  y venderlos con el peso ideal y  así tener mayores ingresos económicos. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo. Es el primer préstamo que recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Edgar is 65 years old. He is married and currently lives with his wife. He wants the loan to purchase some dual purpose cattle. He hopes to obtain more milk and cheese to sell to businesses and neighbors and fatten their offspring and sell them at an ideal weigh and thus have greater economic income.

He hopes in the future to provide his family with a better quality of living and greater economic stability and be able to continue to grow. This is the first loan he has had from FUDECOSUR. He has not had loans from the state banks before and FUDECOSUR is providing the loan with better conditions and a much lower rate of interest.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Auwalu

texts.en:
Auwalu is a maize farmer and a Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Auwalu has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Auwalu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Auwalu can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Auwalu will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Auwalu is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell his maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Ayuba

texts.en:
Ayuba is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, he has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Ayuba would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs for necessities such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, he can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Ayuba will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare. He is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family, and looks forward to using his additional earnings to move into a better home with his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es: Jose de 34 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus dos hijos, el se dedica desde hace 15 años a la agricultura siembra maíz, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía para poder continuar con su trabajo y tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Jose is 34 years old and lives in his own home with his wife and two children. He has been raising corn for the past 15 years and sells his harvest at the various markets near his home and is able to pay the household expenses with his earnings. He is asking for a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, compost, insecticide, etc. so he can improve the land he is showing us in the photo, continue to work, and have a better income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, and insecticide to improve the soil.

loans.name: Rocelyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Rocelyn works hard to support her family. She has a dry goods business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.

Rocelyn is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of bags, shoes, shirts, etc. for her dry goods business. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF.

Rocelyn hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of bags, shoes, shirts, etc.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 52 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Victoria is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF in order to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Victoria has been raising pigs for 6 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so that she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Huzaifa

texts.en:
Huzaifa is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to the organization’s support, the days of poor yields are long gone, and Huzaifa is thankful. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to eight metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land. That is 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

Traditionally, Huzaifa would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs for food and clothing. But, with Babban Gona’s support, Huzaifa will store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until later in the season, when he can obtain a premium of up to 37 per cent more than the harvest price.

With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Huzaifa now has the opportunity to actualize his dream to grow his agricultural business for himself and his family. He would like to use this additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Lawal

texts.en:
Lawal is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Lawal has the opportunity to attain yields of up to eight metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land. That is 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Lawal would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs for food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Lawal can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37 per cent higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Lawal will benefit from marketing support that could help generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Lawal is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to ensure that all his children get a post-secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Ibodulo

texts.ru: Опытный дехканин Ибодуло. Он занимается животноводством. Ибодуло много лет выращивает скота. На районе Хамадони прекрасная погода для развития сельскохозяйственной деятельности. Возле дома Ибодуло есть поле для пасти скота. Ибодуло покупает молодых телят и выращивает их несколько месяцев, потом вывозят их на скотном рынке на продажу. Чтобы добиться цели нужно больше трудиться. Хабибуло большая мечта, увеличить поголовья скота и расширить животноводческую деятельность. Ибодуло просит кредит для закупки несколько молодых телят. Он ждет поддержку с вашей стороны. Ему очень нужно Ваша поддержка. Ваша поддержка поможет Ибодулло не потерять бизнес.
texts.en:
Ibodulo is an experienced farmer who works in animal husbandry. Ibodulo has raised cattle for many years. The region of Hamadoni has excellent weather for agricultural development. Near to Ibodulo's house there is a field for grazing livestock. Ibodulo buys young calves and rears them for several months, later taking them to the livestock market for sale.

To achieve one's dreams, you need to work hard, and Ibodulo has a big dream: to increase his number of livestock, and to expand his work in animal husbandry. Ibodulo is asking for a loan to buy some young calves. He awaits support from your side, and very much needs your backing. Your support will mean that Ibodulo will not lose his business.

loans.use: to buy some young calves.

loans.name: Raava

texts.en:
Raava is a 48 year old mother with 7 children. She runs a small business of selling taro and banana in her village to earn a living.

Raava has requested a loan to buy taro roots (seedling), banana tubes (seedling), a wheelbarrow, a rake, and a shovel to help her run her business.

She hopes to use her profit to expand her business and provide for her family needs. She rejoined SPBD last year.

loans.use: to buy taro roots (seedling), banana tubes (seedling), a wheelbarrow, a rake and a shovel for her business.

loans.name: Serena Group

texts.en: Asma is in her late 30s, married and the mother of three school-aged children. For the last six years, she has earned a living by selling charcoal and running a store. She works from 6 a.m. to 4 p.m. daily and makes a good monthly profit. This will be her 12th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She repaid her previous loans after using them to buy more inventory to sell. She is grateful to Kiva for supporting her group, and has used the profits she made to pay school fees, buy a motorcycle, reinvest in her business, and cover household expenses. Asma will share this loan with her group Serena, which has four members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock her store and buy sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be prayerful.

She operates a farm where she grows maize and rice. She has been involved in this business for 30 years. Her business is located in a fertile area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be water shortages.

She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy farm supplies. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Khna

texts.en:
Khna, 43, is a farmer who lives in Tbaung Khmum province’s Dambae district. She is also a mother of three children, one of whom is dependent on her and needs her support for schooling. To support her family, Khna has been raising piglets for 10 years and growing rice to earn supplemental income. The main challenge to her business has been illness among her piglets.

Khna has never been with Vision Fund before now. She is now applying for a loan to buy more piglets and pig feed to expand her business. She hopes her pigs will grow well and that she will be able to sell them at a higher price to earn more income.

loans.use: to buy more piglets and pig feed to expand her current business.

loans.name: Marizel

texts.en:
Marizel is 38 years old and has four children. She is married and her four children are in school.

Marizel is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins and other supplies with which to raise her livestock.

Marizel has been in this business for eight years now, and has borrowed two loans in the past from NWTF to sustain her business activities.

In the future, Marizel would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and other supplies with which to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a married woman. She has six children. She describes herself to be committed.

She operates a farm, where she grows crops and also keeps cows. She has been involved in this business for 12 years. Her business is located in a fertile area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy farm supplies. She hopes that in the future, she will be a role model to other farmers. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en: Sabina is single and the mother of one child. She describes herself as trustworthy and earns a living by selling curtains and sheets. She has been in this business for ten years and works in a good area where most of her customers are locals. Sabina describes her biggest business challenge as inadequate working capital, and is requesting a Kes 25,000 loan to buy more curtains and sheets to sell. Her goal for the future is to expand her business. This is her fourth loan from SMEP Microfinance Bank. She repaid all of her prior loans successfully.

loans.use: to buy more curtains and sheets to sell.

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en: Perlita is 49 years old, married and the mother of two children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines, and is requesting a loan for PHP 8,000 from NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies for her livestock. Perlita has been in this business for seven years, and has taken out and repaid seven prior loans from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, she would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies for her livestock.

loans.name: Shuaibu

texts.en: Shuaibu is a maize farmer from Baure A village. As a Babban Gona member, he is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior supplies that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to eight metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer. Before joining Babban Gona, Shuaibu had to sell his maize at harvest, when its price is low, to meet his immediate needs for food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member, he can store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until later in the season for a price up to 37% higher than what the market pays at harvest. Shuaibu hopes to use his additional income to ensure that all of his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest time.

loans.name: Alh. Umaru

texts.en:
Alhaji Umaru is a maize farmer from Maájah village. As a Babban Gona member, Alhaji Umaru is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior equipment that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to eight metric tons of maize per hectare of Land, which is 5.5 times more than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Alhaji Umaru would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs, such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member Alhaji Umaru can store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a period later on in the season, when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Alhaji Umaru no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Alhaji Umaru hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Tahira

texts.en:
Tahira is 39 years old, and she has five sons and two daughters. She lives with her family in Lahore.

Tahira's son drives a rickshaw. He is hardworking and obedient. He wakes up early in the morning and goes out to provide passenger pick-up and drop-off services. He roams around the city all day, providing transportation services to the locals. His mother feels proud of her son and is sure that he will fulfill his dream of having a rickshaw service soon.

Due to constant wear and tear, Tahira's son's rickshaw gets stuck each day, creating difficulty in driving. Tahira is here to help her son again by requesting a loan from BRAC Pakistan for her son, so that he can drive smoothly without any interruption.

loans.use: to help her son with the maintenance of his rickshaw.

loans.name: Thon's Group

texts.en:
A local farmer from the Kampong Cham province, Thon is 58 years old. She is a widowed mother of four dependent children. To make a living, she has been growing rice on a hectare of farmland and she sometimes works for others for a fee.

Thon earns about USD $13 per day and can save about USD $8.50 each day. Pests are the main challenge to her rice growing business.

She has been with VisionFund for two loan cycles already. With her effort, she can renovate her house and upgrade her living condition.

As the leader of six-member group, Thon is going to use her loan to buy organic fertilizer and organic pesticide for her rice farm. She hopes to harvest abundant rice yields so she can save up to expand this business in the future and to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer and organic pesticide to get abundant rice yields to expand her farming business.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Munkaila

texts.en: Munkaila is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. He expects a good harvest this season because he is achieving yields of up to eight metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. Before joining Babban Gona, Munkaila had to sell his maize at harvest, when prices are lowest, to meet his immediate needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, he can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% more than the market price at harvest. As a Babban Gona member, Munkaila will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. He is thankful for the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family, and looks forward to using his additional earnings to ensure that all of his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest time.

loans.name: Rocio Del Pilar

texts.es: Rocío de 47 años es una emprendedora mujer que laboró durante años en una empresa privada, sin embargo sus deseos de ser empresaria independiente e incrementar su ingreso y obtener beneficios adicionales,  la llevaron a tomar la decisión de retirarse y con su liquidación emprender su sueño de prosperidad.  Ella  adecuó un espacio de la sala de su vivienda para emprender su negocio de productos misceláneos, actividad que le garantiza un ingreso seguro para el sustento de su familia y alternamente continúa con sus demás roles sin inconvenientes. Ella es madre soltera de dos hijas de 24 y 14 años de edad a quienes ha logrado ofrecer bienestar con su trabajo y estar muy al pendiente de su formación académica, ética y moral, beneficio que le otorga el hecho de laborar desde su casa.  En la actualidad desea incrementar sus inventarios con la finalidad de incrementar sus ventas en la temporada decembrina, es por ello que está aplicando a una solicitud de crédito, su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para comprar perfumes, esmaltes, productos capilares, cosméticos, cremas y demás. A futuro Rocío proyecta que su negoció tendrá una mejor imagen y le garantizará mejores ventas para mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
47-year-old Rocío is an entrepreneurial woman who worked for years in a private business. However, her wishes are to be an independent entrepreneur, boost her income, and get additional benefits. These brought her to make the decision to leave and launch her dream of prosperity with her severance pay. She modified a space in her home's living room to launch her miscellaneous products business--a business which guarantees her a secure income for her family's support and alternately continue with her additional roles without inconvenience.

She is a single mother of two daughters, ages 14 and 24, whom she has managed to offer wellbeing with her work. She is very attentive to their academic, ethical, and moral development--the benefit that she receives due to the fact that she works from home.

She currently wishes to increase her inventory with the objective of increasing her sales in the December season. It is for this that she is submitting a loan application--her first Kiva loan, through intermediary Fundación Mario Santo Domingo--to buy perfume, nail polish, hair products, cosmetics, creams, and other things. In the future, Rocío projects that her business will have a better image and will guarantee her better sales to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy perfume, nail polish, hair products, cosmetics, creams, and other things.

loans.name: Leidy Johanna

texts.es: Leidy es una joven emprendedora que guiada por sus instintos hace cuatro años inició con un pequeño capital suministrado por su familia, su negocio de venta de mercancías varias tras incorporarse a una empresa de multinivel y promocionar artículos de su oferta entre sus vecinos, familiares y amigos con muy buenos resultados. Leidy es madre de un niño de cuatro años y en compañía de su cónyuge le ofrecen bienestar y lo que más le agrada a Leidy de su labor es que puede estar cerca de su familia y muy pendiente de la crianza de su hijo. Diariamente ella labora a partir de las 8:00 a.m. a 6:00p.m. mediante visitas a sus clientes y está convencida que con un mayor capital podrá ampliar su clientela, e incrementar sus ventas por lo cual está tramitando con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo  su primer Credikiva, recursos que planea invertir en perfumes, cremas, colonias, desodorantes, talcos y calzado, productos de mayor demanda entre sus clientes. Su sueño de prosperidad es organizar su negocio en un local comercial y a largo plazo adquirir su casa.
texts.en:
Leidy is an entrepreneurial young woman, who, guided by her instincts, began four years ago with a little capital provided by her family, beginning her business of selling various merchandise after setting up a multilevel business and promoting articles from her offerings among her neighbors, family, and friends, with very good results.

Leidy is the mother of a four-year-old son, and along with her husband they offer him well-being. What most pleases Leidy about her work is that she can be near her family and very attentive to the raising of her son. Every day she works from 8:00 am to 6:00 pm through visits to her customers, and she is convinced that with greater capital she will be able to expand her customer base and increase her sales.

For this reason she is negotiating with the Mario Santo Domingo foundation for her first Kiva loan, [for] resources that she plans to invest in perfumes, creams, colognes, deodorants, talcum powders, and footwear, products with great demand from her customers.

Her dream of prosperity is to organize her business in a commercial location and in the long term to acquire her house.

loans.use: to invest in perfumes, creams, colognes, deodorants, talcum powder, and footwear, the products with greatest demand from her customers.

loans.name: Gloria Estefania

texts.es:
Gloria tiene 21 años es soltera tiene 3 hijos ella vive en el Recinto eL Caimito perteneciente al Canton Puebloviejo se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maiz y ademas a la crianza de gallinas, el credito lo solicita para la comprar de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos y alimento para la crianza de las gallinas.

Gloria es una persona muy feliz porque hace lo que le gusta la agricultura... en los tiempos libres le gusta bailar.
texts.en:
Gloria is 21 years old. She is single and has 3 children. She lives in Recinto Caimito, belonging to Puebloviejo canton. She earns a living sowing corn and also raising chickens.

She requests a loan in order to buy seeds, fertilizers, manure, and feed for growing the chickens.

Gloria is a very happy person because she does what she likes: agriculture. In her free time, she likes to dance.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, manure, and feed for raising chickens.

loans.name: De Monchita Group

texts.es:
Conformado por grandes personas  luchadoras y trabajadoras .Poniendo todos sus esfuerzos para seguir luchando y progresando para el bienestar familiar de sus seres amados. Coordinado por don Sergio, de 57 años de edad, casado y con tres hijos quienes son su motor de vida. Dedicado a la venta de pescados variados, para tener mayores ingreso. Ahora el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de pescados pardos, cabeza de pescados, raya (chuletas) gato macho, cangrejo.
 Las demás integrantes son María, de 42 años dedicada a la venta de carbón, Josefa de 45 años quien vende granos básicos como arroz, trigo, maíz, azúcar, aceite y purina.
texts.en: This group is made up of people who are very hardworking. They put all of their effort into getting ahead for the well-being of their loved ones. The group is coordinated by Sergio, who is 57 years old, married, and has three children who are his reason for living. He sells a variety of fish so that he can have better income. He'll use this loan to buy red snapper, fish heads, rays (steaks), catfish, and crabs. The other members are María, who is 42 years old and sells charcoal, and Josefa, who is 45 years old and sells basic grains such as rice, wheat, corn, and sugar, cooking oil, and pet food.

loans.use: to buy red snapper, fish heads, rays (steaks), catfish, and crabs.

loans.name: Buena Vista Group

texts.es: Grupo ¨Buena Vista¨ conformado por personas  emprendedoras provenientes de la zona rural del país, luchando y solicitando crédito para seguir financiando sus negocios y así poder engrandecer y recibir mayores remuneraciones. Coordinado por Harold quien por 3er ciclo trabaja el crédito para invertirlo en compra de productos para engrandecer y diversificar su  negocio de cafetín colegial. Invertirá en la compra gaseosa, reposterías, snikers, golosinas, jugos, fresquitos y gelatinas. Las demás socias Carla de 28 se dedica a la preparación y  venta de comida. Ana, de 26 años prepara y vende tortillas y frijoles cocidos en su hogar.
texts.en:
The "Buena Vista" group is formed by entrepreneurial people from the rural zone of the country, who are working hard and applying for a loan to continue financing their businesses and thus to continue growing and receive greater profits. [They are] coordinated by Harold, who for the third cycle will work with the loan to invest it in the purchase of products to enlarge and diversify his business, a school cafe.

He will invest in the purchase of soft drinks, pastries, Snickers, candies, juices, Fresquito [brand snacks], and gelatins.

The other members are Carla, who is 28 years old and prepares and sells food, and Ana, who is 26 years old and prepares and sells tortillas and beans cooked in her home.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, pastries, Snickers, candies, juice, Fresquito [brand snacks], and gelatins.

loans.name: Vergenia

texts.en:
Vergenia is 47 years old and has 8 children. She is married, and 3 of her children attend school.

Vergenia is in the agriculture business raising pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a 7,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy fertilzer and other farm supplies.

Vergenia has been in this business for 7 years now and she has borrowed once before from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Vergenia would like to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilzer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Las Encantadoras Group

texts.es: El grupo ¨Las Encantadoras¨esta nuevamente solicitando crédito para el desarrollo y crecimientos de sus negocios, así mejorar sus condiciones de vida que le permitan salir adelante a sus familias. Coordinado por Maria, de  53 años, casada y con 1 hijos. Se dedica a la venta de cosechas de frutas de manera ambulante. Con el crédito solicitado invertirá en la compra de cosechas de tamarindo. Las otras socias son Sandra, de 37 años, quien prepara y vende comida y gaseosas.  Maria de 36 años quien requiere del dinero para invertirlo en la compra de cosechas como el tamarindo.
texts.en: The Las Encantadoras Group is applying for a loan to develop and grow their businesses to improve their living conditions and help their families cope. The group is coordinated by Maria, 53, who is married and has one child. She sells her harvests of fruit as a street vendor. With this loan, she will buy tamarind plants to harvest. The other members are Sandra, 37, who prepares and sells foods and beverages and Maria, 36, who will also invest in buying fruits like tamarind.

loans.use: to purchase tamarind plants

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a married woman. She has one child. She describes herself to be visionary.

She operates a retail business where she sells washing soap, flour, bread, sugar, and other items. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a busy area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be competition.

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of washing soap, flour, sugar, and other items. Her business goal is to have a mini-supermarket within five years.

This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She will use the anticipated profits to improve her standards of living.

loans.use: to buy more stock of washing soap, flour, sugar, and other items.

loans.name: Zennie

texts.en:
Zennie is 31 years old and she has 3 children. She is married, and all of her children attend school.

Zennie is in the agriculture business farming vegetable in the Philippines. She has requested an 8,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy fertilizer and other farming supplies.

Zennie has been in this business for 3 years now and she has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to help sustain it.

In the future, Zennie would like to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farming supplies.

loans.name: Marcy

texts.en:
Marcy works hard to support four children. She is married and has a business raising livestock in the Philippines.

Marcy requested a PHP 22,00 loan through NWTF to buy a water filter.

She is getting the water filter because she wants to have safe drinking water.

Marcy is aware that by using the water filter, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a water filter.

loans.name: Dahiru

texts.en:
Dahiru is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Dahiru has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Dahiru would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Dahiru can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Dahiru will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Dahiru is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to ensure that all his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Amirbeg

texts.ru: На фотографии снято Амирбег. Он дехканин. Амирбег из района Хамадони. Ему 41 лет. Амирбег женат и отец двоих детей. Амирбег имеет одного брата и сестренку. Его брат занимается перевозом грузов, на грузовой автомашине. Сам Амирбег занимается земледелием. Он идет по стопам родителей. У Амирбег имеется большой земельный участок. Он выращивает арбуз. Амирбег был маленьким, когда мечтал освоить деятельность родителей и стать хорошим дехканином. Он каждый сезон получает качественный и богатый урожай, потому что Амирбег больше трудиться, чтобы собрать богатый урожай. Амирбег с большими надеждами обратился к Вам за кредитом, на операции сестренки. Его сестренка болеет, и ей срочно нужно сделать операцию. Амирбег верит в Вас и на Вашу доброту.
texts.en:
The man in the photo is Amirbeg. He is a farmer from the Hamadoni region. He is 41 and married with two children, and has a brother and a sister. His brother works in trucking, transporting goods. Amirbeg works in agriculture, following in his parents' footsteps. He has a large piece of land where he grows watermelon. He was still small when he started dreaming about mastering his parents' trade and becoming a good farmer. Every season he receives a good and rich harvest, because he works very hard to grow quality crops.

Amirbeg is turning to you with great hope for a loan to pay for an operation for his sister. She is ill and in urgent need of an operation. He trusts in you and in your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for an operation for his sister

loans.name: Responsabilidad Group

texts.es:
Por 5ta vez, se encuentra solicitando crédito para el desarrollo de sus diversas actividades económicas del grupo llamado ¨Responsabilidad¨. Quien coordina el grupo es Aracelly de 33 años, dedicada a la venta de zapatos deportivos usados, desde hace 8 años con ahorros personales de su trabajo anterior. Actualmente tiene un hijo, quien procura darle las mejoras condiciones de vida para su desarrollo. Ahora requiere del crédito para poder comprar una paca de zapatos usados surtidos como deportivos, sandalias, zapatos cerrados, etc. Aumentando su inventario y su diversidad de estilos.
Las otras socias son Karen de 32 años, dedicada a la venta de calzados como botines y sandalias. Y Julieta de 50 años a la venta de calzados usados.
texts.en: For a fifth time, the group called "Responsabilidad" (Responsibility) is requesting a loan to develop their diverse business activities. The group's coordinator is 33 year old Aracelly, who has worked for eight years with her personal savings from a previous job selling second hand sports shoes. Currently, she has a son for whom she works to give better life conditions. Now, she is requesting a loan to buy a package of assorted second hand shoes such as sports shoes, sandals, closed shoes, etc. in order to increase her inventory and her diversity of styles. The other members are Karen, 32 years old, who sells footwear such as short boots and sandals, and Julieta, 50 years old, who sells second hand footwear.

loans.use: to be able to buy a package of assorted second hand shoes such as sports shoes, sandals, closed shoes, etc.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is a married mother of with 11 children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 52 years old, and 4 of her children attend school.

Remedios has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a 1,800 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy a solar lamp.

Remedios has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Sokong's Group

texts.en:
Sokong is 45 years old and a resident in Kandal province. She is married with three dependent children, one of whom is in school. She supports her family’s living through growing rice and working for others for a fee. There is not enough water for her to irrigate her farmland and this is the challenge to her.

Sokong has been with VisionFund for 11 cycles already and those past loans have helped her improve her living condition and timely meet her family's basic needs. In fact, she can buy new clothes and provide enough healthy food to her family. She, who is the leader of the three-member group, will use her loan to buy organic fertilizer to improve her rice farm.

She hopes to increase her income so as to upgrade her standard of living and to buy school supplies.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer to improve her rice farm to upgrade her standard of living and to buy school supplies.

loans.name: Shanirobai's Group

texts.en:
Shanirobai, a differently abled lady standing to the right side in the photograph, a tailor by occupation, is married to a driver and has three daughters to care for. The couple work really hard to cater to their children's needs and their education.

Shanirobai has been managing her tailoring business for four years now. She, along with her group member, wants to avail a loan of 30,000 INR from Kiva's partner People's Forum. She plans to utilize her portion of the loan amount to purchase a Pico machine and some other necessary materials with the loan.

Shanirobai runs this business from home and finds it very convenient to juggle between business and household duties. She feels that adding a Pico machine would increase the number of customers as she will then be able to take and complete more orders and deliver them faster.

Shanirobai belongs to the lower-income community and the narrow thinking of her community did not allow her to study. She is, however, determined to ensure that her daughters receive their education without any hitches. Your contribution could take Shanirobai another step closer to accomplishing this.

loans.use: to purchase a Pico sewing machine and some other necessary materials.

loans.name: Subhashree Group

texts.en:
Rashmita is an active married lady of 27 years of age and resident of a rural village named Muniguda in Rayagada district of Odisha, India. The lady seated in the front row, second from left with raised hand in the photograph, is Rashmita. She resides with her husband and only one daughter.

To increase the income of her family, Rashmita, along with other five likeminded women of her locality, formed a group and wish to avail a loan from Mahashakti Foundation during 2015.

Rashmita’s husband is a goldsmith, and has also been making silver ornaments in his business for the last five years. At present the monthly household income is 8,500 INR. The monthly income hardly meets the monthly expenses.

To increase the income, Rashmita’s husband wants more investment in the business. From the loan, they will purchase silver ornaments to meet the demand of local customers from the wholesaler. From the loan Rashmita wants to fulfill the desire of her husband.

The other five members of the group's businesses are leaf plate making and selling, a grocery shop, and a saloon. The loan will definitely change the income level of the members.

loans.use: to purchase silver ornaments.

loans.name: Genara

texts.es: Genara tiene 42 años de edad es madre soltera y vive junto a sus 3 hijos una niña de 13 años y dos varones de 17 y 18 años de edad ella siempre muestra su esfuerzo, y es gracias a ello que ha logrado sacarlos adelante. Ella prestando sus servicios domésticos y vendiendo pollo por libras es que logra llevar el sustento a su hogar, y apoyar a sus hijos para que estudien. Genara desea construir una pared en su vivienda, ya que como se observa en la fotografía el área de la cocina se encuentra desprotegida y ella teme por la seguridad de su familia, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y hierro para construir la pared en su vivienda lo antes posible. Anteriormente ella había solicitado un crédito el cual utilizo para construir el servicio sanitario de su vivienda.
texts.en: Genara is 42 years old. She is a single mother and lives with her 3 children: a 13 year old girl and two boys, 17 and 18 years old. She is always showing her hard work, and thanks to it she has been able to move her children forward. She has been rendering domestic services and also selling chicken by weight, and with this she supports her household and helps her children with their studies. Genara wants to build a wall in her house, because as one can see on the photograph, the kitchen area is not protected and she worries for the safety of her family. This is why she is requesting a loan to FUSAI to buy: cement, sand, gravel, bricks and iron to build the wall in her house as soon as possible. Previously, she had requested a loan that she used to build a bathroom in her house.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, bricks and iron to build the wall in her house.

loans.name: Leonor

texts.en: Leonor is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Leonor is 30 years old and one of her children is in school. Leonor has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Leonor requested a PHP 8000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell. Leonor has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Leonor would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Sadhna's Group

texts.en:
Sadhna, a differently abled lady standing to the left hand side in the photograph, lives in a small village of Korba, Chattisgarh, India, with her husband and 11 year old daughter. Sadhna's husband works as a daily wage labourer while she sells cow's milk for a living.

Rearing cows is an attractive economic activity for households in rural India because of the additional income and nutrition that milk provides to the family but also because cow's manure serves as an important fertilizer and fuel for the agricultural fields and home.

Sadhna has been rearing cows for six years now. She, along with her group member, is requesting a loan of 30,000 INR from Kiva's partner People's Forum. She will use her portion of the loan to buy an additional cow to scale up her income and business.

By investing in Sadhna's loan you can help improve her family's living standards in a sustainable manner.

loans.use: to buy an additional cow to scale up her income and business.

loans.name: Munawar

texts.en:
Munawar is 40, married and a mother of six children. A stay-at-home mother, she lives with her family in Lahore. Her husband has a small food stall where he sells local delicacies that include chaat, samosas, gol gappa, etc. His stall is always crowded as locals like the delicacies and he has the art to make really tasty food. He has to prepare the ingredient at night at his home, and Munawar is always there to help him with cutting and chopping the vegetables and fruits.
They have a big family and are not able to save money. In order to sell more variety at his stall, he wants to buy more ingredients and spices. Munawar has, therefore, requested a loan to help her husband buy the ingredients.

loans.use: To help her husband buy ingredients for his food stall

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.en: Mavluda is a very kind and hardworking woman. She is divorced and has two children. Mavluda is the only feed keeper and upbringer of her children. Mavluda has worked more than six years in a local school as a teacher. Mavluda is also a student. She studies at the Pedagogical University to get her master's degree. She studies well and she always tries to improve her knowledge. Mavluda teaches chemistry. She will be the best teacher because she is clever but she needs more experience. Mavluda is asking for a loan of 1,800 Somoni to pay for the university tuition. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to pay for her university tuition.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: María es una mujer trabajadora que a sus 37 años de edad vive en casa de su propiedad junto a su grupo familiar desde hace 16 años. Ella siempre demuestra sus deseos de superación, ya que desde hace 3 años se dedica a prestar sus servicios domésticos con sus vecinos y amigos, lo que le permite salir adelante con mucho esfuerzo. El cuarto de la cocina de María esta hecho de lámina deteriorada, como se observa en la fotografía, por lo que ella solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir: cemento, arena, grava, lamina para construir el cuarto de la cocina que se encuentra deteriorado y de esta manera de contar con un lugar adecuado para preparar sus alimentos.
texts.en:
Maria is a hard-working woman, who, at the age of 37, has lived with her family group in a house that she owns for 16 years. She always demonstrates her desire to achieve, since for three years she has been offering her domestic services to her friends and neighbors, which allows her, with much effort, to get ahead.

The room containing Maria's kitchen is made of deteriorated metal sheeting, as seen in the photograph. For this reason, she is applying to FUSAI for a loan to invest in cement, sand, gravel, and metal sheeting to build the room for the kitchen, which is now deteriorated, and in this way have a suitable place to prepare their food.

loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, and metal sheeting to build the room for the kitchen, which is deteriorated.

loans.name: Secilie

texts.en:
Secilie works hard to support three children. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Secilie requested a PHP 2,200 loan through NWTF to buy a water filter.

She is getting the water filter because she wants to have safe drinking water and prevent her family from diseases caused by contaminated water.

Secilie is aware that by using the water filter, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a water filter.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Edna works hard to support her family. 

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional  income from buying and selling fish. Edna is borrowing PHP 22000 through NWTF to purchase additional bundle of fishing nets for her fishing business.She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business. 

Edna has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional bundles of fishing net

loans.name: Adelina

texts.en:
Adelina is applying for a loan of $1,000 from TRM (Tuba Rai Metin). She is 43 years old. She is running a kiosk in front of her house and she will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store such as slippers, salt, milk, water, cigarettes, sugar, coffee, soap, shampoo,fish and biscuits. She is making good money from selling and she wants to apply for a bigger loan in the future.

Adelina is living in a town nearby the school; her kiosk is located in a strategic place where many people come to buy, including students.

loans.use: to buy slippers, salt, milk, water, cigarettes, sugar, coffee, soap, shampoo, fish and biscuits

loans.name: María Magdalena

texts.es: María es una mujer trabajadora de 47 años de edad que vive junto a sus dos hijos de 20 y 13 años de edad, además tiene un hijo de 23 años que está casado, pero que siempre está pendiente de ella. María logro sacar adelante a sus hijos como madre soltera, apoyada en su venta de pollos, pero actualmente se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, además de platos típicos, por las tardes. María desea cambiar el techo de su vivienda, ya que como se observa en la fotografía en cualquier momento puede caer, por lo que ella solicita un crédito a FUSAI que le permita comprar: lámina, madera, clavos y alambre para cambiar el techo y continuar mejorando la calidad de vida de sus hijos, ya que anteriormente solicito un crédito con el cual construyo una fosa séptica y a pila de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Maria, 47, is a hardworking woman who lives with her children, ages 20 and 13. She also has a son, 23, who is married but is always looking out for her. Maria raised her children as a single mother, supporting them by selling chickens. Currently, she sells fruits and vegetables and also sells traditional meals in the afternoon.

Maria wants to replace the roof of her home - as you can see in the photo, it could cave in at any moment. She has asked FUSAI for a loan to buy tin sheeting, wood, nails and wire to replace the roof and improve her kids' quality of life. She previously took out a loan that she used to build a septic tank and sink/water storage.

loans.use: to buy tin sheeting, wood, nails and wire to replace the roof and improve her kids' quality of life.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more kinds of vegetables such as water spinach, cabbage, chili, tomato, coriander, turmeric, etc.

loans.name: Jose Eduardo

texts.es: Jose de 48 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, el posee una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace 8 años, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el esta solicitando un credito para la compra de más sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Jose, 48, lives in his own house with his wife. For eight years, he has had a small store located at his place of residence. With the profits, he is able to cover some of the household expenses.

He is requesting a loan to buy more soups, eggs, staple grains, soft drinks, candy, sweet rolls, etc. This will allow him to improve his income and quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more soups, eggs, staple grains, soft drinks, candy, sweet rolls, etc.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself to be patient. She operates a farm where she grows maize and also keeps cows. Her business is located in a fertile area and her primary customers are locals. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy a water tank to store clean water for domestic use. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a farm where she grows vegetables. Her business is located in a fertile area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her family's challenge to be a lack of water during the dry season.

She will use the Kes 60,000 loan to buy a water tank to store clean water for domestic use. She hopes that in the future, she will have improved living standards. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Dioleta

texts.en:
Dioleta is 48 years old and married with six children. With two of her children in school, Dioleta works very hard to provide for them.

Dioleta runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, snack foods, home care products, and other groceries.

Dioleta has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Dioleta would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, snack foods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Monserrat Group

texts.es:
Conformado por 3 mujeres emprendedoras y luchadoras se encuentra en grupo ¨Monserrat¨, coordinador Rosa de 31 años, casada y con dos hijos de edades 5 y 12 años, se dedica a la fabricación de vestidos folclóricos como huipiles y cotonas. Solicita dinero para comprar en mayores cantidades de dacron, manta hindu, hilo, seda, elásticos y otros. Así aumentara su inventario y las ganancias irán en aumento. 
Las otras integrantes son María José, 21 años y tiene su taller de costura donde también elabora trajes típicos, y Saleska de 21 años tiene una venta de ropa nueva, calzado y cosméticos en su domicilio.
texts.en:
The lending group "Monserrat" is made up of three tough and entrepreneurial women. Rosa, 31, is the coordinator. She is married and has two children, ages 5 and 12. She makes traditional costumes like tunics and blouses.

Rosa asks for a loan to buy large quantities of Dacron fabric, Hindu fabric, thread, silk, elastics and other things. This will increase her inventory and also her profits.

The other members of the group are Maria Jose, 21, who also sews traditional clothing; and Saleska, 21, who sells new clothing, shoes and cosmetics out of her home.

loans.use: to buy bulk quantities of Dacron, Hindu fabric, thread, silk, elastics and other things.

loans.name: Lucia Luz

texts.es:
Lucia Luz con 31 años de edad,vive en casa propia, en el distrito de Zaña,provincia de Chiclayo,departamento de Lambayeque,país Perú. Ella cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

Lucia Luz se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales como carneros y cerdos, con una experiencia en el rubro desde hace 8 años aproximadamente, sus ventas las realiza en su mismo domicilio y en el mercado de Cayaltí. Solicita préstamo para invertir en la compra de animales,alimentación y en otros gastos diversos.

Lucia Luz cuenta con experiencia crediticia, en Edpyme Alternativa es su tercer crédito.
texts.en:
Lucia Luz, 31, lives in her own home in the district of Zana, province of Chiclayo, department of Lambayeque in Peru. She has very good personal and professional references from people in her region. The inhabitants there primarily work in agriculture, commerce, and cattle.

Lucia Luz raises and sells animals like rams and pigs. She has about 8 years of experience in the field. She makes the sales out of her home and in the market in Cayalti.

She asks for a loan to buy animals, feed and for various other expenses. Lucia has credit experience - this is her thrid loan with Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to buy animals, feed, and various other expenses.

loans.name: Rutchie

texts.en:
Rutchie is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with two children.

Rutchie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock of household goods to sell.

Rutchie industriously earns additional income through other business ventures such as a buy-and-sell rice business.

Rutchie dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock of household goods to sell.

loans.name: Josphine

texts.en:
Josphine is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Josphine has operated a retail shop business for the past ten years, selling household consumables such as wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and transportation in her business.

With the loan Josphine is requesting, she wants to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

She decided to join Yehu to access loans that will boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Nader Group

texts.en:
Roueida is the featured borrower of the Nader group; she joined with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, because they have always been neighbors and friends.
Roueida is a 49-year-old married mother of one child who has been working in the handicraft business from her house for a long time. She has professional skills in this domain and is well-known among her customers for her creative beautiful crafts. Due to the low income of Roueida's family, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay her child's school tuition fees. Roueida is the lady standing in the middle. 
With respect to the other group members, Haneen is the lady on the left, and May is the first lady on the right of the photo.

loans.use: to pay her child's school tuition fees

loans.name: Neiser Ronald

texts.es:
Neiser Ronald con 31 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente,vive en casa propia de material rústico,junto a su cónyuge y sus hijos, ene l distrito de Santo Tomás,provincia de Cutervo,departamento de Cajamarca,país Perú.El cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona.Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

Neiser Ronald se dedica a la actividad de la agricultura, especificamente al cultivo de café,de variedad Catimor, a la fecha tiene 1.5 hectáreas, plantación tiene tres y cuatro años de edad, esta en primer y segundo año de producción, cuenta con una experiencia en el rubro hace 4 años, en terreno propio en Caserío El Roble distrito santo Tomás. Su producto lo comercializa en distrito santo tomas a compradores mayorista de la zona. Adicionalmente se dedica a la cría de animales menores como (patos, gallinas, pavos, chanchos y cuyes), cuenta con experiencia en el rubro, así mismo al cultivo de productos de pan llevar (yuca, plátanos, vitucas, frutas y otros), siendo estos para su consumo y en ocaciones para la venta.El destino del crédito será para el mantenimiento de su cultivo, con ello obtendrá buena producción y mayores ingresos para así poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.

Neiser Ronald es socio recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Neiser Ronald, 31, lives with his partner and children in his own rustic home in Santo Tomás district, Cutervo province, Cajamarca department, Perú. He has very good personal and work references from area residents. The locals work primarily in agriculture, commerce, and ranching.

Neiser Ronald works in agriculture, specifically growing the Catimor variety of coffee. He currently has 1.5 hectares, and his plantation is three to four years old and is in its first and second year of production. He has four years of industry experience on his own land in Caserío El Roble, Santo Tomás district. He sells his product to area wholesale buyers in Santo Tomás district. In addition, he raises smaller animals such as ducks, chickens, turkeys, pigs, and guinea pigs. He also has experience growing basic food crops (yucca, bananas, taro, fruits, and others) for his own consumption and sometimes to sell.

The loan is for the purpose of maintaining his crop. With it, he will obtain good production and greater income so that he and his family will enjoy a better quality of life. Neiser Ronald is a repeat borrower with Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to maintain his crop.

loans.name: Gladis Carolina

texts.es: Gladis de 32 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus tres hijas, ella se dedica desde hace 3 años a la elaboración y venta de tortillas, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes, gracias a su trabajo logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de maíz por quintales y cal para poder continuar con la elaboración de las tortillas y así poder tener mejores ingresos para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Gladis is 32 years old and lives in her own house with her husband and their three daughters. For the last three years, she has been dedicated to making and selling tortillas. Her business is located in her place of residence and she has many customers. Thanks to her work, Gladis manages to cover some of their household expenses.

Gladis is soliciting a loan to purchase corn by the hundred-weight plus powdered lime so that she can continue making tortillas and, thus enjoy a better income and a better quality of life.

loans.use: purchase corn by the hundred-weight and powdered lime for making tortillas.

loans.name: Ana Rose

texts.en:
Ana Rose works hard to support her family. Ana Rose is married and has a refreshment and food vending business in the Philippines.

Ana Rose requested a PHP 29000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients like bread, meat, cooking oil, ketchup, hot-dog, soft-drinks, etc. for her business.

Ana Rose has been in this business for 21 years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Ana Rose would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like bread, meat, cooking oil, ketchup, hot-dog, soft-drinks, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia  is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Lucia  is 52 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Lucia  has a general store business in the Philippines. Lucia  requested a PHP 16000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

Lucia  has been in this business for 10 years. Lucia  would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Yusif

texts.en:
Yusif is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Yusif has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, which is 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Yusif would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Yusif can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% greater than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Yusif will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land.

Yusif is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family, and he looks forward to using his additional earnings to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell his maize crops for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Basiru

texts.en:
Basiru is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Basiru has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. 
Before joining Babban Gona, Basiru would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Basiru can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 
As a Babban Gona member, Basiru will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Basiru is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to diversify his farm and grow other crops.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest
